results.description:
Details: http://www.veggieprideparade.org/

Veggie Pride Parade NYC 2016
9th annual
Confirmed date is Sun., Apr. 3, 2016

Parade route runs from Olde Meat District to Union Square Park.... The exact location of the line-up is 9th Ave at Gansevoort Street, which is just 2 short blocks south of W. 14th Street.

Parade line-up begins at 11 am. Parade launch takes place at Noon, sharp.

Parade participants are encouraged to dress up in costumes and wear sign boards announcing their pride in their vegan lifestyle. Local restaurants, veg groups, and veg everything will be represented with banners and chants. The parade will include animal-rights activists, environmentalists, and people simply concerned with their health. But at the next VEGGIE PRIDE PARADE, all will come together with one voice, one expression, of veggie pride.

http://www.veggieprideparade.org/

The parade culminates at Union Square Park (north plaza) at approximately 12:45 pm... in a festival for all to enjoy. (Festival goes until 5 pm....). There, revelers of all persuasions will hear well-known vegan speakers and music by vegan artists. They'll all partake in free vegan food and explore a wide variety of exhibitor presentations. At 2 p.m., a costume contest will take place.

Throughout the day, individuals will be encouraged to speak their mind at the Soapbox Testimonial Station. Other activists will beckon passersby to receive a dollar in return for watching a pro-veg video.

Organizer Pamela Rice feels confident that this year's parade will be the best ever. Ms. Rice said, "I'm hoping that at this event people will see vegans and vegetarians come out of the shadows, once and for all."

Visit http://www.veggieprideparade.org/ for more information about every aspect of the event.
results.how_to_find_us: If you'd like to march in the parade, post in the comments!
results.name: NYC Veggie Pride Parade

results.description:
It is time once again to take to the streets of NYC, shout out how proud we are to be vegan/vegetarian, and express what we want most...total animal liberation! 

Below is the description of the event taken from the Facebook event page:


Veggie Pride Parade NYC 2016
9th annual
Confirmed date is Sun., Apr. 3, 2016

Parade route runs from Olde Meat District to Union Square Park.... 

The exact location of the line-up is 9th Ave at Gansevoort Street, which is just 2 short blocks south of W. 14th Street.

Parade line-up begins at 11 am. Parade launch takes place at Noon, sharp.


Parade participants are encouraged to dress up in costumes and wear sign boards announcing their pride in their vegan lifestyle. Local restaurants, veg groups, and veg everything will be represented with banners and chants. The parade will include animal-rights activists, environmentalists, and people simply concerned with their health. But at the next VEGGIE PRIDE PARADE, all will come together with one voice, one expression, of veggie pride.


The parade culminates at Union Square Park (north plaza) at approximately 12:45 pm... in a festival for all to enjoy. (Festival goes until 5 pm....). There, revelers of all persuasions will hear well-known vegan speakers and music by vegan artists. They'll all partake in free vegan food and explore a wide variety of exhibitor presentations. At 2 p.m., a costume contest will take place.

Throughout the day, individuals will be encouraged to speak their mind at the Soapbox Testimonial Station. Other activists will beckon passersby to receive a dollar in return for watching a pro-veg video.

Organizer Pamela Rice feels confident that this year's parade will be the best ever. Ms. Rice said, "I'm hoping that at this event people will see vegans and vegetarians come out of the shadows, once and for all."


Feel free to make your own signs and wear a costume! We will bring leaflets and will be leafleting during/after the parade. We may grab a bite to eat after the festivities as well. It truly will be a day full of veggie pride!
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet on the northwest corner of 9th and Gansevoort in NYC. Look out for our meetup sign.

results.description:
Join us for a special visit from Badee Dwaik; a humanist Palestinian organizer, filmmaker, and father working out of his hometown of Al-Khalil (Hebron). Holding a degree in social work and organizing in his community for decades, Badee has a wealth of wisdom he will share with us through both film and word.

Badee's current work is with Human Rights Defenders; a grassroots media justice organization who use their own video equipment to document Israeli raids, attacks, and human rights abuses by soldiers and settlers so they can release these reports online for a global audience. This work is essential for both educating international audiences and holding Israel accountable for its violence. Palestinian people in Al-Khalil live in an extremely high-tension urban context of apartheid with normalized military presence, checkpoints, and encroaching Israeli settlements.

Badee is not receiving an honorarium for this event and would greatly appreciate donations towards his work.

Please come with open ears, open minds, and respect.

About the speaker:

At the age of 20, Badee spent three years in jail for participating in a political action. Badee’s time incarcerated taught him the necessity of studying anti-colonialism and teaching youth, both Palestinian and Israeli, about it’s inner-workings. “After my release from jail, I began to think differently about the real enemy for me and my people. I heard about Israelis struggling against the occupation. That encouraged me to try to connect with Jewish people who had solidarity with our issue. I came to believe that if we want to get our rights as Palestinians, we have to get it by nonviolent resistance.”
results.name: Sunday Platform: Israeli Occupation Through the Lens of Resistance

results.description:
Details: Why do our attitudes, behaviors and character traits have much more impact on our handling or mishandling of money than technical concepts like interest rates, fees, monthly payments, and tax deductions?  How do financial products and the marketing of them in today’s culture influence our behaviors? How can we re-evaluate and re-shape our behaviors towards money to improve the future of our finances?

About the Speaker: Cyrus Collier is a musician and software engineer, and has been studying personal finance for the last 6 years. He is passionate about helping people improve their financial lives, and believes in empowering everyone to learn for themselves the basics of handling their money wisely. 

For more information, click here.

results.name: Mind Over Math: Your Brain and Money

venue.name: Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
We have never seen anything like it – a major party candidate for the presidency who is a flaming narcissist, has never held public office and elaborates virtually no program. He is politically vacuous. What he does have are hyperbolic slogans, insults, obscenities and a speaking style not above a fifth grade level. But worse, he is a demagogue who appeals to the frustrations of his base and incites anger, even violence. But worse still, he wins the favor of the crowd through the demonization of others – Muslims, Latinos, the disabled, women. Whatever programs he espouses are, for the most part, impossible, and he repeatedly contradicts himself, while making a virtue of his unpredictability. The more he is attacked, the more he rises in the polls. His campaign is outside the bounds of reason. He appeals to the gut, not to the mind.

That a person such as Donald Trump should emerge as a major contender for the most powerful office in the world, is surreal, a Dadaist nightmare. Whatever else, his success so far, should he ultimately win or lose the presidency, is itself a dire statement on the nature of our democracy. Never have I felt that the membrane separating our democratic way of life from authoritarian governance was so thin and fragile.

The press has become comfortable in labeling Trump a demagogue, and the question has been raised as to whether he is a fascist. This is the question I feel impelled to explore, and it is a difficult and very serious one. The word “fascist” draws a direct association to Mussolini and Hitler, the paragons of political systems identified with the greatest evil history has produced.
Does the term apply here?

Read more on our website.... Everyone is invited to Sunday Platform meeting.

===========================

The Sunday School at the Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County helps children aged 2-14 explore and develop their moral and critical thinking skills through fun and interactive lessons and field trips. We meet weekly at 11am on Sundays for 1.5 hours while the adults of the Ethical Culture Society are attending the platform meeting. Our wide ranging curriculum allows kids to examine themselves, their community and the world in general. We teach about different cultures, philosophies and religions. We encourage our students to ask questions, think for themselves and make up their own minds about the bigger questions in life. Our children develop strong values and ethical standpoints. The Sunday School Graduation Rite of Passage, completed by our 8th graders, allows them to present to the community how their Sunday School experience has informed their moral and ethical development.
results.name: Joe Chuman: Thinking About Fascism

results.description:
IMPROV FOR ACTORS - Expect the Unexpected

Surprises are opportunities. When you are open to whatever comes your way you are able to be fully present and let go of the need to control the outcome. You learn to discover what will happen next instead of having an agenda. This breathes life and energy into your scenes and taps into your resourcefulness and creativity.

In this workshop you will practice techniques and do scenes that introduce the unexpected. You will learn to handle anything that happens on stage with ease and learn to let go of the need to control how a scene is going to play out.

Suggested Donation: $15 (or whatever you can pay)

*most improv classes in NYC cost $35-50 or more per session

_____________________________________________________________________

THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV


Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.
results.name: Expect the Unexpected

venue.name: In front of the National Academy Museum, 5th Avenue and 89th Street

results.description:
About 7 miles and 5 hours. We will visit two museums connected to Archer Huntington and see statues created by his wife, Anna Hyatt Huntington.

We will meet in front of the National Academy Museum at 11:30, spend about 45 minutes in the museum, walk across Central Park to the Whole Foods at Columbus Avenue and 97th Street for lunch, walk west along 93rd Street to Riverside Drive to see the Joan of Arc statue, then north along Riverside Drive to the Hispanic Society museum at Broadway and 155th Street. The Hispanic Society museum is open until 4:30 p.m.

The American Academy of Arts and Letters, which is next door to the Hispanic Society in the Audubon Terrace complex, is also showing an exhibit, The Invitational Exhibition of Visual Arts. The exhibit is open until 4:00 p.m. Here is a link to the exhibit web site : Visual Arts exhibit. 

There will be a somewhat steep staircase to walk up in Riverside Park and another hill to walk up at 155th Street. Admission to the National Academy is pay what you wish but you must pay something, I paid $1.00; the Hispanic Society and American Academy exhibit are free.


Archer Huntington was the son (step or perhaps biological) of railroad magnate Collis P. Huntington and his second wife, Arrabella Yarrington, who was the teen aged daughter of the proprietor of a boarding house where Collis stayed while developing railroads in Virginia. Arrabella used her husbands wealth to accumulate a large art collection, which is now housed at the Huntington Library in San Marino, California, and encouraged her son Archer to pursue intellectual and artistic activities.

The National Academy is an honorary association of American artists which operates a school and museum and is housed in the opulent townhouse that was Archer and Anna's home and Anna's sculpture studio. The academy is closing the museum on June 1 to sell the building to create an endowment and move to a new location. Archer established the Hispanic Society in 1904 as part of his lifelong interest in the history and culture of Spain. Archer and Anna met when he commissioned her to create a sculpture of El Cid for the courtyard of the Hispanic Society.

Here is a link to the National Academy museum: National Academy Museum

Here is a link to the Hispanic Society web site: Hispanic Society

Meet: 11:30 in front of the National Academy museum at 1083 Fifth Avenue, at 89th Street. Take the 4,5,6 train to 86th Street and Lexington Avenue.

Leader: Tom Bergen[masked] [masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for Shorewalkers members who have paid the $20 annual membership fee, $3 for non-members. Non-members please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike or visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.
results.name: Huntington Walk: National Academy, Joan of Arc and Hispanic Society

results.description:
Our first Room Escape Meetup sold out so quickly so we're doing it again!

Get ready for crazy fun and lots of laughs as you play our Room Escape Game!  We will put together a team - you and other Meetup members will enter a room, find the clues, solve the puzzles and work together in order to escape!! 

How it works/itinerary: 
The games starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle at Noon at a local bar/pub (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other Meetup members and break up into teams. 

PREPAY ONLY EVENT ($39-$49 depending upon how early you purchase ticket) - http://bit.ly/1nZZjHs

Play one of the following games:

• You are Dr. Watson trapped in a mysterious room. Unfortunately, Sherlock Holmes can't help because he is somewhere else - he's waiting for you to join him in tracking down the hound of the Baskervilles, the adventure of your lives. Escape before time runs out!

• An ultra-intelligent Big Bad Wolf has trapped your team in his magical forest! And one of your teammates is locked away from the rest. Note: HE WON'T BE IDLE. He will collaborate with other team members to solve puzzles and earn his freedom. After the team is reunited, they work together to escape the forest! 

• You are trapped in a sequence of dreams of a troubled individual, the kind of character from an Edgar Allan Poe story. You will be taken to visit the dreamer's past, present and future. Get ready to solve puzzles made from optical illusions, special visual effects and hidden imagery. Your goal is to escape from this man's subconscious!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT.  MUST PURCHASE TICKET HERE - http://bit.ly/1nZZjHs

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% attend on their own. 


How many members will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. About 30 members will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+. 

Is this private? Yes. Private for Meetup members & their guests.  It is a non-ethnic specific event. 


Review from Yelp - You will love this if you like riddles and enjoy a fun challenge. It is also a great icebreaker for someone who you have not met or getting to know. This will also give you you a great sense of achievement if you are able to ESCAPE!!
results.name: Room Escape Game & Pre-Mingle (PREPAY ONLY)

group.name: The New York City Social Group (12,000+ members!)

Organizer`s phone number is[masked]

PLEASE LEAVE YOU EMAIL OR PHONE NUMBER FOR THIS EVENT

Walk-and-Eat in a West Greenwich Village Tour made popular for its authentic bohemian history. You will find famous places where celebrities of 20th century liked to come for a cup of coffee and chat with friends and acquaintances. These places still exist and are open to all and every visitor who comes to the Village. Woody Allen, Andy Warhol, Valery Solanas, John Tyler, Jackson Pollock, Eugene O`Neill, Charlie Chaplin, Gregory Corso, Bob Dylan, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Allen Ginsberg, LeRoi Jones, Jack Kerouac,Ray Bremser, Jimi Hendrix, Bruce Springsteen, The Velvet Underground, Cat Mother & the All Night Newsboys, Kool and the Gang, Peter, Paul & Mary,  Lenny Bruce, Joan Rivers and many more- feel like a part of New York Bohemia. There is no other place like New York. This tour will include the sample of authentic New York style food such as pizza, falafel, riceballs and more. (only for a  group of no less than 10 people)

Washington Square

New York University

New York Authentic Food

Musicians memorable places

"Friends" Building

"Stonewall Inn" Riot and more

This tour takes approximately two hours and is easily accessible for baby strollers and wheelchairs. 

The cost for this event is only $10
results.name: Walk-and-Eat West Village

results.description:
APA Member Rocio Segura is an emerging beauty, fashion and portraiture photographer from Spain based in New York. 

  Adorama NYC Store
  42 W 18th Street
  Sunday, April 3rd, Noon - 1 pm.

Rocio will be presenting some of her best work, talk about the development of her vision, the different inspiration sources that keep her art moving and what she finds fascinating about photography.

Rocio Segura graduated with a Master of Professional Studies in Digital Photography from the School of Visual Arts in NYC. She has held numerous group and solo exhibitions in countries as diverse as the U.S., UK, Italy and her native Spain. Her New York debut solo exhibition occurred in April 2012 at Umbrella Arts Gallery in the Lower East Side.

>> The event is free and click HERE to RSVP
results.name: APA|NY Emerging Photographer at Adorama: Rocio Segura

He will collaborate with other team members to solve puzzles and earn his freedom. After the team is reunited, they work together to escape the forest! 

• You are trapped in a sequence of dreams of a troubled individual, the kind of character from an Edgar Allan Poe story. You will be taken to visit the dreamer's past, present and future. Get ready to solve puzzles made from optical illusions, special visual effects and hidden imagery. Your goal is to escape from this man's subconscious!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT.  MUST PURCHASE TICKET HERE - http://bit.ly/1nZZjHs

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% attend on their own. 

How many members will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. About 30 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+. 

Is this private? Yes. Private for Meetup members & their guests.  It is a non-ethnic specific event. 

Review from Yelp - You will love this if you like riddles and enjoy a fun challenge. It is also a great icebreaker for someone who you have not met or getting to know. This will also give you you a great sense of achievement if you are able to ESCAPE!!
results.name: Room Escape Singles Game (PREPAY ONLY)

Walk-and-Eat in a West Greenwich Village Tour made popular for its authentic bohemian history. You will find famous places where celebrities of 20th century liked to come for a cup of coffee and chat with friends and acquaintances. These places still exist and are open to all and every visitor who comes to the Village. Woody Allen, Andy Warhol, Valery Solanas, John Tyler, Jackson Pollock, Eugene O`Neill, Charlie Chaplin, Gregory Corso, Bob Dylan, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Allen Ginsberg, LeRoi Jones, Jack Kerouac,Ray Bremser, Jimi Hendrix, Bruce Springsteen, The Velvet Underground, Cat Mother & the All Night Newsboys, Kool and the Gang, Peter, Paul & Mary,  Lenny Bruce, Joan Rivers and many more- feel like a part of New York Bohemia. There is no other place like New York. This tour will include the some samples of authentic New York style food such as pizza, falafel, riceballs and more (only for a  group of no less than 10 people) .

Washington Square

New York University

New York Authentic Food

Musicians memorable places

"Friends" Building

"Stonewall Inn" Riot and more

This tour takes approximately two hours and is easily accessible for baby strollers and wheelchairs. 

The cost for this event is only $10.

The games starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle at Noon at a local bar/pub (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and break up into teams.

results.description:
Hello everyone! 

Our next meetup will be at NJ Buffet on Route 23 North in Riverdale on Sunday, April 2nd at 12:00pm.  I chose this location as it is very close to the Route 287 / Route 23 Intersection and for their reasonable price.   The manager has been very accommodating to us in the past. 

Adults are $11.99 per person plus drink.  We will have separate checks.  


Based on turnout from our past meetups, it seems our members really enjoy our lunch outings. 

We will have the younger people sit together so they can talk and the parents sit together.  This group was originally started for a social group for Aspergers young adults but has also been forming into a support group for the Asperger's parents which is wonderful.

Hope to see you there! 

PS  Suggestions for future meetup are welcomed!

results.description: Following Augustus was going to be a difficult act for anyone but the succeeding emperors of the Julio-Claudian line were more than a bit unusual, interesting and peculiar personalities. In this session, we'll try to understand two of them - Tiberius and Caligula, both successful generals but with very different leadership styles as Emperor. The first was a reluctant politician whose reign lasted more than two decades before dropping out while the other ruled only briefly but was best known for his cruelty, extravagance and possible insanity.
results.name: The Julio-Claudian Era - up close and personal with Tiberius and Caligula

results.description:
If you haven't been to this parade, it's a great event that draws a whole lot of people from all over the country. I've done talks there for many years, and have really enjoyed the other speakers, vendors and the big parade too. 

Join me at the parade staging area, or come say hi/introduce yourself to me at the HealthyPlanet table!  Here are all the details...

Parade line-up begins at 11 am  9th Ave at Gansevoort Street, which is just 2 short blocks south of W. 14th Street.


The parade route runs from Olde Meat District to Union Square Park, and launches at Noon, sharp.

Parade participants are encouraged to dress up in costumes and wear sign boards announcing their pride in their vegan lifestyle. Local restaurants, veg groups, and veg everything will be represented with banners and chants. The parade will include animal-rights activists, environmentalists, and people simply concerned with their health. But at this VEGGIE PRIDE PARADE, all will come together with one voice, one expression, of veggie pride.

http://www.veggieprideparade.org/

The parade culminates at Union Square Park (north plaza) at approximately 12:45 pm... in a festival for all to enjoy. (Festival goes until 5 pm....). There, revelers of all persuasions will hear well-known vegan speakers and music by vegan artists. They'll all partake in free vegan food and explore a wide variety of exhibitor presentations. At 2 p.m., a costume contest will take place.

Throughout the day, individuals will be encouraged to speak their mind at the Soapbox Testimonial Station. Other activists will beckon passersby to receive a dollar in return for watching a pro-veg video.

Parade Organizer Pamela Rice feels confident that this year's parade will be the best ever. Ms. Rice said, "I'm hoping that at this event people will see vegans and vegetarians come out of the shadows, once and for all."

Visit 

http://www.veggieprideparade.org/

 for more information about every aspect of the event.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be at the parade staging area between 11 and noon. Also, HealthyPlanet will have an informational table once the parade reaches Union Sq Park, and I'll be speaking on the main stage (time TBD)!
results.name: Veggie Pride Parade NYC 2016

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
REGISTER HERE 

Rocio Segura is an emerging beauty, fashion and portraiture photographer from Spain based in New York. 


She will be presenting some of her best work, talk about the development of her vision, the different inspiration sources that keep her art mooing and what she finds fascinating about photography.

Rocio Segura graduated with a Master of Professional Studies in Digital Photography from the School of Visual Arts in NYC. She has held numerous group and solo exhibitions in countries as diverse as the U.S., UK, Italy and her native Spain. Her New York debut solo exhibition occurred in April 2012 at Umbrella Arts Gallery in the Lower East Side.


This event is part of the APA | Adorama Emerging Photographers Series.
results.name: Rocio Segura Photography   APA | Adorama Emerging Photographers Series

results.description:
Updated March 5, 2016

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.
results.why: It's fun and you like it...

results.description:
Are you looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track, to be more FLEXIBLE and RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?


Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

$5 FOR FIRST CLASS TO CROSS TRAIN...

_________________________________________________

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by starting with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL enhance your alignment, performance, and overall sense of balance!


Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten it in ingrained patterns around the muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga For Runners class, one can experience tension release, fluid movement, and benefit from improved posture, circulation, injury prevention, as well as increased respiratory control and mental focus...

Each Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with a series of held Yin/floor postures. While surrendering into the edge of each pose (for 2-5 minutes), students are guided to experience the discomforting stagnant energy and its release around the hips, thighs, and lower back, and be connected to the present moment. The Yang flow sequence designed to follow will allow students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for greater circulation and achieve new level of flexibility and energy.  Guided Relaxation provided at the end will promise to be YUMMY!

__________________________________________________

Testimonies x3: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

"I ran my best time running a 18 mile course the day after..." Lori

“ I started taking Jennifer's Yin/Yang Yoga for Runner's Class over the summer, and it was fantastic. I had never practiced yoga regularly before, and was pleasantly surprised at how it helped to improve my flexibility, running, and overall fitness. Jennifer is a great, hands-on teacher, and really knows how the body works. I highly recommend this class! ” Theresa

________________________________________________________

THIS PERFORMANCE ENHANCING WEEKLY 1.25 HOUR CLASS IS NOT OFFERED ANYWHERE ELSE IN NYC! COME CHECK IT OUT!

By Cash or Check

Did I Already Mention----FIRST CLASS FOR ONLY $ 5!! 

This Meet Up RSVP $15

Class Card $130/10-Class Card, or $13/class *****BEST DEAL!

Bring a Friend Get a Free Future Class Pass!

Please dress in layers (cool to start) and it's okay to eat prior.  Please message any questions and pass this invite to your friends. Thank you and see ya you on the mat!


Namaste, Jennifer, RYT-500hr

results.description:
You MUST signup and purchase a ticket at the following URL in order to attend:


https://womentechmakersnj.splashthat.com/

This event is being hosted by the North Jersey Google Developer group. To check their page out see the link below:

http://www.meetup.com/GDG-North-Jersey/events/229460551/

International Women's Day is back again, which means that the ladies of Women Techmakers North Jersey are hosting their second annual "Techmakers U" conference. They've been working hard on an amazing lineup of tech and entrepreneur leaders from the area, and invite you to come out to this exciting event at Saint Peters University in Jersey City.

Speakers 

Anna Zapesochini Project Manager & Analytical Lead at Google

Jovena Whatmoor CEO & Founder of Clutch Talent

Alexandra Wolf CEO & Founder of BOSSBABE INC

Vajaah E. Parker Director of Strategy - Web Development Group Agency

Lisa Campagne Manager at LinkedIn

Zahra Amanpour Founder at Indiegrove 

Agenda

12:30pm - Registration

Registration & Sign-in

1:00pm – Opening Remarks

Women Techmakers North Jersey Lead Team, GDG North Jersey Organizers & Mary Kate Naatus from Ignite Institute, St. Peter's University

1:15pm – Panel:'Celebrate The Process of Getting Things Done'

Speakers: Vajaah Parker, Alexandra Wolf, and Zahra Amanpour

Moderator: Chrishan Wright

2:00pm – Creative Interactive Demo "I am Remarkable Project'

Moderator: Anna Zapesochini 3:00pm – Break and Hors d'oeuvres

Refreshments and food will be served

3:30pm – Track 1: The Blue Prints of Joining or Building a Successful Tech Start-up

Speaker: Jovena Whatmoor

Kindly bring your laptop, tablet or mobile device to be used during this session.

3:30pm – Track 2: Marketing Your Creative Self & Mapping Your Brand

Speaker: Lisa Campagne

We recommend setting up a basic LinkedIn profile if you do not have one.

We also advise you to bring a laptop, tablet or mobile device that you can use during this session. 4:30pm – Wrap-up

Event Summary & Networking

* This is an all inclusive event (everyone welcome and encouraged to attend) and the theme "Our Time to Lead" will be incorporated throughout the event via a series of speeches and interactive breakout sessions. "Our Mission is provide visibility, community, and resources for women in technology to increase innovation and participation in the field."
results.name: Techmakers U (2nd Annual IWD Event)

results.description:
Walk the streets of New York with a real police detective ~ visit REAL LIFE locations of your favorite Cop Movies, TV shows & famous crime scenes; see what lies beneath the glamour & glitz of New York's underworld; the

Hangouts /Hide-aways of the city's most notorious criminals

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is FREE for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Please join us for Geology of Manhattan Skyscrapers with geologist Jasmine Bayron on Sunday, April 3 at 1 PM. Come and learn about the geological history of Manhattan and discover fossils in NYC buildings! Our walk begins through Central Park, where Jasmine will discuss the geological history of the rocks in Central Park showing us important minerals and evidence of glacial erosion. We will then exit at E 72 street and once on 5th Ave, we will learn about the geology of some NYC buildings and Jasmine will point out cool fossils that can be found in the buildings that we pass every day!

Please meet at the corner of 61st Street and Central Park West (on the park side) at 12:50 PM as the tour will start promptly at 1 PM. If you have difficulty finding us please call, (917)[masked] or (917) 880-5389. No reservations necessary! Free event! All are welcome!

Jasmine Bayron is a Ph.D. student in Earth and Environmental Sciences at the CUNY Graduate Center. She conducts her research in partnership with the American Museum of Natural History. In addition to being a MAGNET Fellow, she is a science team collaborator on the OSIRIS-Rex Asteroid Sample Return Mission, which is part of NASA's New Frontiers Program of solar exploration missions. Her dissertation research explores the relationships between meteorites that have not experienced any significant heating events since their formation and asteroids with highly absorptive surfaces.

NB: Our photographer will be taking photos of this event for our website. If you attend this event and do not wish to have your photo posted to our website, PLEASE let us know by emailing [masked] and we will accommodate. 

In the event of heavy rain, this event will be canceled.

Please do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.

The Officers of the MSNH
results.name: Geology of Manhattan Skyscrapers with Geologist Jasmine Bayron

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sunday 1-3pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is of no cost, but there is a suggested donation of $10 or whatever you feel like contributing. The money collected would go to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Hello ladies,

I had full intentions of posting this yesterday, but the way our first meet-up was set up... let's just say Readers & Shakers had a very successful brunch (and maybe bottomless mimosas were involved). No worries for those who couldn't attend, I wouldn't start a club for super-women and then penalize you for being busy, super, women. Lookout for some useful club FAQ'S on our discussion forum and I'll soon recap our brunch on my blog, www.1stnoelle.com. In the meantime, your homework is to fill out the "introduction" box in your profile and to...

SAVE THE DATE for a delicious pow-wow on our March read: #Girlboss by Sophia Amoruso (available wherever books are sold).

The venue is DT-UT (www.dtutcafe.com) located on the Upper East Side. Vintage couches, reclaimed wood, and good strong coffee... girl, we're in there! Check out their impressive beer & wine selection on their website and they also offer sandwiches, soups and pastries. (They promised to keep the music down during our visit.)

Directions: 4, 5, or 6 train to 86th Street


Parking: Nah

Hope to see you all there.

Xo,

Noëlle 

The first thing Sophia Amoruso sold online wasn’t fashion—it was a stolen book. She spent her teens hitchhiking, committing petty theft, and dumpster diving. By twenty-two, she had resigned herself to employment, but was still broke, directionless, and working a mediocre day job she’d taken for the health insurance.


It was there that Sophia decided to start selling vintage clothes on eBay. Eight years later, she is the founder, CEO, and creative director of Nasty Gal, a $100 million plus online fashion retailer with more than 350 employees. Sophia’s never been a typical CEO, or a typical anything, and she’s written #GIRLBOSS for outsiders (and insiders) seeking a unique path to success, even when that path is winding as all hell and lined with naysayers.

#GIRLBOSS includes Sophia’s story, yet is infinitely bigger than Sophia. It’s deeply personal yet universal. Filled with brazen wake-up calls (“You are not a special snowflake”), cunning and frank observations (“Failure is your invention”), and behind-the-scenes stories from Nasty Gal’s meteoric rise, #GIRLBOSS covers a lot of ground. It proves that being successful isn’t about how popular you were in high school or where you went to college (if you went to college). Rather, success is about trusting your instincts and following your gut, knowing which rules to follow and which to break.

A #GIRLBOSS takes her life seriously without taking herself too seriously. She takes chances and takes responsibility on her own terms. . She knows when to throw punches and when to roll with them. When to button up and when to let her freak flag fly. 

As Sophia writes, “I have three pieces of advice I want you to remember: Don’t ever grow up. Don’t become a bore. Don’t let The Man get to you. OK? Cool.  Then let’s do this.”
results.name: Discussion of our March Read: #Girlboss

results.description:
This is a hike of exploration and fun of one of the closest trail rock scrambles to NYC but also one of the most rewarding in this park.  We will be taking on about 700 vertical feet and 4-5 miles, including the Giant Stairs, a rock scramble, and negotiate nearly a mile of walking along a jumbled rock field near the Hudson River.   

Roshi and I are bringing her child (age 7) to get him trail ready and invite others to bring their children/teens for this adventure.  

If you are bringing a child you should have had some experience to help guide them, and also be able to take them out early if needed even by reversing direction. 

Giant's Stairs is a hike and rock scramble, use of your hands to make progress is needed at times however it is not rock climbing, no rope is needed.

The views are fantastic and the reward well worth it.  

Please use this for directions

https://goo.gl/maps/feHJpHiqD3A2

Children/teens Welcome: Always (if they are capable, if event is appropriate). Children, including underage teenagers, should be RSVP'ed as a guest their parent, guardian or responsible adult; drop me a message and I will put your child (or underage teenager) in as your guest if guest function is disabled.  This does not mean that this is a children's level hike, or if it's a activity that it child appropriate - it is not unless stated so above, but some children are more then able to do a adult level hike and attend events that are not normally well suited for many children such as meditative events. 

Guests: Adults need to sign up directly and may not go as guests. Guest function, if enabled for this hike, is only for children (and teens who have not reached the age of majority).  

No Shows/ short notice canceling/waitlisted/ not helping out such as with car shuttles: Known 'No shows' may be waitlisted, and / or excluded from the event if there is a max number of hikers set.    Repeat short notice canceling will also be noted for consideration for this as well as things like bypassing the car shuttle location.   No-showing / short notice canceling prevents others from attending if the event is full.  Bypassing the car shuttle start location is taking advantage of others (also see 'Arriving Late:  Don't do that' section).   Make sure you sign in, you would not want to be accidentally marked as a no-show, additionally frequently a spots are reserved for those who are known to attend and be on time.

Arriving Late: Don't do that, you may be on your own.  If you are late, we can only wait if it would be advantageous for the group to wait, so don't be late.   We will try to get you back on track, but those mornings are very hectic and my first responsibility would need to be to those hikers that have arrived.  You may not get to hike with us, additionally we may not have room to get you back to your vehicle at the end if that is required.

End of Hike Time: Ignore the Meetup end time, that is my suggestion for every meetup you attend, not just mine,  that is unless you know the event host uses that.  The reason is that Meetup assumes a end time and if the event organizer does not change it it just gives out a standard one.  Hikes normally move at 2mph, bushwack sections and scrambles at 1 to 1.5 mph, and any car shuttle set up time if needed for this event. so if the millage is specified one can easily figure out a rough estimate.  Larger groups sometimes move slower.

Dogs: I request No Dogs

Recommended Smartphone apps to assist meeting up:

Glympse:  Easy to send my location if you get dislocated, by having this app installed you can also add yourself  which allows me to note your location and give advice of how to rejoin the group.  

Waze:  For getting to the meetup location, it allows the good will of others to assist your drive (GPS app with warnings from other users).

The use of Apple Maps have proven itself unreliable and I can not recommend it.  

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. 

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. 
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Here is our schedule:

1:00 to 1:30

Introductions and Discussion

1:30 to 2:30

Working Session

results.description:
FUTSAL ON SUNDAY AFTERNOONS

MUST RSVP ONLINE

Full refunds will be issued only when reservations are cancelled 24 hours before start time (Saturday 1pm) AT LATEST

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time is 1pm and will run until 3:30pm. 


Gym floor, so wear flats. 1 flight upstairs from entrance door.

No goalies, soNO GOALKEEPING. The area marked with blue tape in front of each goal is called the "Box". Players cannot interfere with or touch the ball inside own Box while defending. Braking this rule results in a penalty shot without a goalie from either opposing corner. Players in pocession inside opponent's Box results in loss of possession. Team in possession can enter own box freely. All players are allowed to "reach" inside opposing Box to retrieve, re-direct, pass,  or score, provided that, in the process, no contact is made with the floor inside the Box. 


We will play 8-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 


Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

                       ~~~~@🔸☢🎱⚽️⚖⚽️🎱☢🔸@~~~~

                                  🔹🔶🔷🔵📛🔵🔷🔶🔹

FUTSAL DOMINGOS POR LA TARDE

HAY QUE RESERVAR EN LINEA

Re-enbolso de su pago se permitirá solo si se cancela 24 horas antes del evento (Sabado 1pm) AL MAS TARDAR.

Podras reservar para jugadores multiples hasta que se llenen los cupos.

Comenzamos a las 1pm y jugamos hasta las 3:30pm


Se juega sobre piso de gimnasio asi que usen zapatos de "indoor"

No hay porteros, asi que NO SE PUEDE PORTEREAR.  Ningún jugador puede tocar o interferir con la trayectória del balón mientras éste se encuentre dentro de su Cuadro en defensa. Violación de ésta regla resulta en penal sin portero desde cualquier esquina opuesta. Atacante ingresando al Cuadro opuesto equivale a pérdida de posesión.  Equipo en posesión puede ingresar a su Cuadro libremente. Cualquier jugador puede re-dirigir, pasar, sacar, o anotar el balón dentro del Cuadro opuesto siempre y cuando su pié no haga contacto con el piso dentro del Cuadro. 

Se jugaran partidos de 8 minutos (ganadores siguen vivos). Habran 3 equipos de 5 jugadores (4 mas 1 cambio). El primero en anotar 3 goles gana el partido. Ganadores deberan seguir ganando para continuar vivos. Empates consecutivos se definirán por moneda.

Barridas estan Absolutamente Prohibidas

Por favor entiendan que para mantener este grupo acivo deberemos prohibir cualquier tipo de pelea o altercado. Todo aquel o aquella que pelee sera excluido (a) del grupo permanentemente. 

Asi que Vamos a Jugar!   Para cualquier consulta, por favor contacteme atravez de meetup.com.

Volunteers are needed to help sort and pack food pantry donations for local senior citizens.  Bread of Life provides food to families and over 17 church & government food pantries and shelters throughout southern Westchester County.  Come be a part of this great organization for the day!

About Bread of Life:

Bread of Life is a Rye, NY based not-for-profit organization committed to serving our neighborhood. It is the only food rescue organization, which also has its own on-site food pantry. We pick up locally and deliver free of charge to neighborhood food pantries, soup kitchens and shelters, serving over 9,000 hungry weekly. Bread of Life receives its food supplies from various sources, but one unique source is donations by local businesses of excess food that would otherwise be discarded as waste.  Bread of Life’s beneficiaries are not only physically hungry, but are also in need of assurance that their lives are matter.

**If you plan on volunteering with your child please include them in your rsvp as a +1 and let me know their name and age in the comments section.  All minors must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.  Thanks!**

results.description:
This, our first meetup, is on the nature of self. Where and how we find our ourselves relating to existence and the multi facet domains of the Self Experience or the 'Phenomenological'. A brief lecture will open up this meeting to discuss spiritual self practice - how this is defined and how it facilitates our being state; both consciously and unconsciously. We will then begin expeditions into the nature of Sound through vocal toning and mono-tonal singing. Depending on the group, we will then journey into meditation and/or free motion interpretative dance to enhance the ecstasy of the true self experience and bliss consciousness to our multidimensional nature and true expression.

First Degree

April 3, 2016  The Magick of the Guardian Angels and The Archangels

o   Working with specific Angels


o  Cleansing and Consecrating

o   Setting up Sacred Space

o   How to work with them

They act as divine messengers or guides. Delving into the history of angelic magick. Specifically, focus on the archangels of the Tree of Life and those of the four directions - Uriel, Gabriel, Michael and Raphael, learning now to work with each through ritual to manifest change in your life and understand your own angelic nature and true purposes in our lives.

$30 in person/$33 via paypal - PLEASE bring your receipt to class.


Academy of Pagan Studies offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Starlight Vision Series and much more, such as tarot, pendulum use, candle craft, magickal herbs, spell craft, runes etc.

What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.

Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, and now our newly formed private FB group just for our students to converse, further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment.

The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!

We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy*. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.

We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished so far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Circle and do hope that after reading you will decide to join us as a Academy Student and member of The NYC Wiccan Family Temple.

We strive to provide a comprehensive selection of training programs and as such offers many other Elective Craft courses and training opportunities for seekers of knowledge and magickal expertise. We encourage you to visit our CURRICULUM PAGE & CRAFT CLASSES PAGE for a complete list of current and future programs.

We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

WE ARE THE MOST COMPREHENSIVELY TAUGHT WITCHCRAFT ACADEMY WITHIN THE NEW YORK CITY AREA.

IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO FIND OUT FURTHER INFORMATION REGARDING THESE CLASSES, PLEASE GO TO www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.org YOU WILL FIND REGISTRATION INFORMATION, PRICES AND OUR FULL CURRICULLUM. YOU CAN JOIN IN THESE CLASSES AT ANY TIME, AND CATCH UP WITH THE CLASSES YOU MISSED NEXT TIME IT COMES AROUND.

IF YOU HAVE NOT DONE SO, PLEASE DO BRING YOUR APPLICATION FILLED OUT WITH YOU WHEN YOU COME TO CLASS. ALSO, BRING A NOTE BOOK AND PEN OR PENCIL.

There is a one time fee per year of $25.00 registration fee.

If you pay online please bring a receipt of payment as we do not always have time to check paypal the day of the class, or we will expect you pay at the class or gathering.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT: 
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.org
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org 
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com 
www.romanctichandfastings.webs.com

results.description:
</a>

Hi Everyone,

Our first 1-day Tournament of the season is here!! RSVP while there are spots available!!

Get plenty of touches on the ball and a chance to win 1st. place championship medals!

See details below:

How long will the Tournament last? 

Approximately 3.5  hours depending on the amount of teams registered.

What are the rules and level of play? 

- 7vs7 (includes the goalkeeper). All teams will have 2 to 3 substitutes. 

- CO-ED (no minimum girls required on field) 

- 6'x12' size goals. 

- Level is intermediate to advance. If you played at a college level or similar, you would be considered Advanced. 

- No slide tackles.

-Only turf shoes, indoor shoes or running sneakers.

-3 points for a win, 1 for a tie and 0 for a loss. The teams in the Final Round games are decided by points, goal difference then goals scored.

-We'll keep track of scores. The goals are full size, so if you are a goalkeeper please let us know. Otherwise, teammates will rotate being goalkeeper.

-Everyone will be randomly placed on a team. If you would like to be placed with a particular team, please let us know in the comment section when you rsvp on the top right corner; we will try to accommodate everyone. Also, if you would like to bring your own team, please RSVP for you+9 and pay the total via paypal.

How do I join? 
There are 2 ways to join:

1. The first way to join is as a free agent. To join as a free agent please rsvp on this page and we will place you on a team. If you would like to be placed with a friend on the same team, please let us know. We will try to accommodate everyone :)

2. The second way to join is as a team. If you would like to register your team please rsvp on this page for you+ 9 guests and pay the total amount via paypal.

How will the tourney work? 

- We are looking to register 3 to 4 teams. The format varies depending on the amount of teams registered. See this link for the format: <a href="http://files.meetup.com/526560/Tournament%20Formats.pdf">Tournament Formats

What's included? 
- Hired referees 
- Permit fees 
- Tournament and website administration

- Medals for 1st place winners

What are the prizes? 

- Easch player in the winning team receives medals and gains bragging rights :)

What should you bring?


-Please use cleats or turf shoes and lots of water.

-A white t-shirt, a red t-shirt and a blue t-shirt.

What is the refund policy? 

-if the tournament is cancelled you will receive a refund.

-if you change your RSVP 48 hours before kickoff, you will receive a refund

If you have any questions about getting there please e-mail or all us at[masked]

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Fee:Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for the next game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :).

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
The Stilt-Sands are destroyed, and a terrible leviathan has awoken to plague the Ten Isles once more. All that remains of hundreds of sails and thousands of sailors are two ships and three hundred souls. Precipice Port is a fortnight away, the only destination for hundreds of miles of ocean, and you must reach it. Not all is as it seems amongst the sailors and refugees, however. Someone or something has slipped aboard, and its intentions are surely murderous. Can you reveal the hidden evil before it is too late?

Fortnight of Fear is the fourth chapter for the WildPig Exclusive Campaign "Sailing Against the Wind" by Noah Anderson. New and returning players are welcome. Characters are 7th level, with a limit of 8 players per session. There will be time for character creation a half-hour before the first session. Seats are limited, so please register ahead of time.

results.description:
CMNYC, in partnership with group member and Cuddlist CEO Adam Lippin, is hosting its 3rd cuddle party of 2016! Come join us for an easygoing, safe and spirit-lifting introduction to the power of positive physical touch!

Steps to attend:


1) Read and understand the code of conduct, to which there are no exceptions.

2) RSVP here on Meetup

3) Pay the required attendance fee by credit card via EventBrite at: 

Please pay in advance. Walk-ins are not permitted.

This event is for Men that want to Cuddle Other Men.  All who identify as Male are welcome.

All other rules of Cuddle Party APPLY. 

Tom and Adam will be hosting a Men's only Cuddle Party at Big Buddha Studio on Sunday afternoon, Feb 28th 31st from 2:00 to 5:30 PM.

You MUST purchase a ticket at EventBrite to be sure you are registered to attend this Meetup. The Meetup announcement is serving *only* as an announcement and an easy way to communicate.

There is lots of information about Cuddle Parties on the official Cuddle Party website (www.cuddleparty.com), so if you are curious, be sure to check out the FAQ section and some of the articles too.Cuddle Party has been around since February 2004. If you are coming to the Cuddle Party, PLEASE arrive at 2:00 PM to check-in and change into your Cuddle Clothes so we can start the Welcome Circle by 2:30PM.

Sorry - but after the Welcome Circle begins, no late arrivals can enter

As a reminder, these are the Cuddle Party rules.

1) Pajamas (or cuddle-clothes) stay on the whole time.

2) You don't have to cuddle anyone at a Cuddle Party, ever.

3) You must ask permission and receive a verbal YES before you touch anyone. (Be as specific in your request as you can.)

4) If you're a yes, say YES. If you're a no, say NO.

5) If you're a maybe, say NO.

6) You are encouraged to change your mind anytime you want.

7) Respect your relationship agreements and communicate with your partner.

8) Get your Cuddle Lifeguard On Duty or Cuddle Caddy if you have a question or concern or need assistance with anything during the Cuddle Party.

9) Tears and laughter are both welcome.

10) Respect people's privacy when sharing about Cuddle Parties and do not gossip.

11) Arrive on time.

12) Be hygienically savvy.

You MUST purchase a ticket at EventBrite to be sure you are registered to attend this Meetup. The Meetup announcement is serving as an announcement and an easy way to communicate, but RSVPs here don't count.

The cost is $25

Get tix's here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mens-only-cuddle-party-tickets-22466147853

WHAT TO WEAR: Athletic Wear/Yoga Clothes/Pajamas. 

WHAT TO BRING: Just bring your smiling self.

Your Cuddle Host (that's me) will provide light snacks and beverages.

Looking forward to Cuddling with you soon,

Adam & Tom

www.cuddlist.com is a proud sponsor of Cuddle PartyNYC

Please leave a message or message me if you have further questions etc

results.description: Jaime Ceballos está al final de su adolescencia; pronto deberá decidir el rumbo que tomará su vida. Por lo pronto, su percepción del mundo es que no tiene lugar definido en él. Quiere ser puro, pero su sangre hierve. Se debate entre la moral cristiana y los impulsos físicos de su ardiente juventud; entre la jerarquía familiar y sus ansias de independencia; entre su pequeño mundo de pueblo chico y el horizonte infinito que vislumbra; entre el pecado y la salvación. La vida, entonces, pone a Jaime ante verdades desnudas que lo harán cambiar radicalmente.

Given that we are in the fasting period of  the Church, we would have as theme for this meetup Fasting in the Orthodox Church. Please join us for a fasting lunch at Pancoan Society Hippocrates restaurant and talk about fasting. They have among other food, Fasting food, for those that are fasting.


The prep lecture is from St Nicodemos Publications website. Please see link:

http://www.saintnicodemos.org/content/spiritual_combat.php


Please go to 02. Fasting and dealing with thoughts. This lecture is part of the Spiritual Combat theme by Orthodox Theologian Mr. Constantinos Zalalas. 


Looking forward to the meet up!


PS: Some on us will attend Orthro & Liturgy (8 am - 11:30 am) at St Irene which is on[masked]rd Av, just a few blocks before the Restaurant we are meeting for lunch. You are welcome to attend and stay for coffee during fellowship after the service.

This Event:


The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where fellow Python developers and learners can come and asks questions and/or code with some company! This event is free. 


Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, through wooden door to the right, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!

results.description:
Brooklynites and other New Yorkers! Come out to Ange Noir Cafe and play some Magic the Gathering, whether you are new to the game or an experienced player. I bring a bunch of cards and some pre-made decks, so we always have enough stuff for all. Feel free to bring your own decks (Commander aka EDH, Modern, Standard, etc.) along if you want. And invite friends ... the more the merrier.

***The given time-slot can be shifted or extended to fit schedules or we want to play longer but please let me know a little in advance so we can schedule properly.*** 

*UPDATE REGARDING FINANCIAL INPUT: we have now gone to a yearly dues format, which if everyone in the group pays, we will have more than enough to cover the cost of being on Meetup. If not everyone pays, it may have to increase, but only slightly (right now at $2/yr.) The real purpose of why this group is here is to provide a non-financially demanding option for learning and playing/practicing the game.
results.how_to_find_us: I will try to have a little sign, but more or less just look for people with Magic cards and not laptops in front of them ;-)
results.name: Sunday Funday Magic the Gathering in Brooklyn

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Agricola, Tzolkin, etc.) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. In addition, many take a long time to teach (Alchemists runs about 30 minutes, Kanban's teach ran 1 hour last time).  Among the shortest games we play are Codenames and Splendor.  If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game. Towards the late evening, Avalon often happens.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.

Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, the card keys for the bathrooms are available from the front desk.  As a courtesy, please check to see if anyone else in the group needs to use the keys before returning them to the front desk.
results.name: Sunday Marathon in Flushing

results.description:
There's a long-established mini-chain of Afghan kabab houses in New York. Perhaps you've eaten at one; I have, many times, over the decades. In the past year I've heard some good things about this much newer, family-owned restaurant...


http://www.aryagrillkabobhouse.com/


...and it's high time we put it to the test. 

I'll put together a tentative menu which we can fine-tune after discussion at the restaurant (Qorma murgh or qorma gosht? Kabuli palau or zereshk palau?) As always, we'll order and eat family-style, and split the bill evenly (adding an extra $1 each to help cover the cost of maintaining our group on Meetup). Please bring cash, small bills if you have them. 

Transportation: Arya is less than a half-mile walk from the Auburndale LIRR station (weekend/off-peak fares will be in effect for travel within NYC). If you prefer, take the 7 train to Flushing and pick up the Q28 bus, which will drop you mere steps from the restaurant's door.
results.name: Afghan afternoon in Bayside, Queens

results.description:
Disclosure Network New York Date: Sunday, April 3, 2016                                                            

Location:   CAP 21 Studios, 18 West 18th St., (Between 5th Ave. & 6th Ave., South Side of Street), elevator to the 6th Floor, Room 608, NYC 

Time:   2pm-4pm, Please be on time, as late arrivals may disrupt the meeting. Enter the room assigned at 2pm. Ask the Welcome Desk person for “Nick Curto's room assignment” if you need help in finding the room. Please be on time, as late arrivals may disrupt the meeting. Enter the room assigned at 2pm. 

Topic: “ATLANTIS: THE LOST CONTINENT” 

Featured Guest Speaker: HERCULES INVICTUS 

Program (Live Event): A panoramic overview of Plato's ancient account and the lore that has accrued around it over the span of many centuries. Are some ancient myths actually Star Maps revealing the secret location of Atlantis? Is America the New Atlantis? Are we currently undergoing an Atlantean Cycle? Are we the Atlanteans reincarnated? Are Atlantean intelligence from other planes or planets secretly controlling or guiding us? These and many other questions will be addressed. Bio: Hercules Invictus has been exploring the fringes of our reality throughout his entire life and has been sharing his experiences publicly for over four decades. He founded, among other things, the Regional Folklore Society of Northeastern PA and the Center for the Study of Living Myth in NJ. For more information please visit his website:  http://www.herculesinvictus.net 

Please plan to attend what is bound to be one of the most interesting DNNY meetings to date and invite your interested friends to join us.

Meeting Details: Admission $10 per person. Children 12 and under admitted free. Our treasurer will collect your admission fee in the meeting room door before the program begins. R.S.V.P. now to guarantee you one (1) reserved seat! (30 seat venue room limit.) Provide your full name, e-mail address and cell phone number. E-mail: [masked]  

(Questions: Contact: Nick Curto,       DNNY Director/Co-Founder: Phone:[masked]) 

3 Important Notes: 1. No food or beverages are allowed in any rooms of the venue except bottled water that may be brought into the venue. You can also purchase chilled bottled water at the Welcome Desk in the Lobby for $1. 

2. Please silence your cell phones when entering the meeting room. 

3. No photos may be taken or sound recording is ever allowed at any of the DNNY meetings.    

Visit: www.dnny.info
results.how_to_find_us: www.dnny.info
results.name: Reserve Sunday, April 3, 2pm-4pm - DNNY Meeting!

results.description:
As art inspires since prehistoric times, new doors to The Beautiful can open at ANY time.

We invite you to see for yourself:

Join us at the Metropolitan Museum of Art for a wide ranging walk. We'll highlight some of the most beautiful, inspiring and eye opening art ever created! Bill already has some thought-provoking highlights in mind and YOU may suggest your favorites to share...

Enter the Museum at the less crowded ground level entrance near 81st Street and Fifth Avenue. It's slightly downtown from the grand steps of the main entrance. Once inside, keep walking straight south past the coat check to meet us by 2:45 at the seating area beyond the elevators.

If you're delayed, call Bill at [masked] for our location... somewhere in the wilds of 5,700+ years' global art (though <a>the oldest specimen doesn't look a day over 5,600</a>... :) http://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/324917

BE ADVISED in advance, this museum limits its collection to art from planet Earth :) Actually, that may not true - some pieces may represent altered states if not alternative planets! - http://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/pre-columbian-art-maya-toltec-head-of-the-god-of-rain-dated-news-photo/152201510

We offer this event FREE. The Museum has a pay what you wish policy. You can give as little as one cent, through we hope you'll offer more for this august institution.

Some of us may go for snacks and/or dinner after the Museum closes. You can also call Bill around 5:00 for our decision where.
results.name: ART to Change Your Life and World!

results.description:
Come have a nice 6 mile hike across the Brooklyn Bridge.

We'll meet at Madison Square Park at 23rd St and Broadway, (nowhere near Madison Square Garden), between the fountain and the "Shake Shack", and run a zig-zag course through interesting parts of Manhattan and across the Brooklyn Bridge. If Madison Square Park is filled with some event, we'll meet right at the corner of Broadway & 23rd.

Realize that if I want to meet you, I am not able to fall back and walk with you, because everyone in front of you will stop and wait for me.  I'm stuck at the front.  So I can only get to know you if you walk at the front and join in the conversation.

In Brooklyn, we'll end the hike at an (undisclosed) and affordable Polish-American restaurant for dinner in Brooklyn Heights for those interested.  Those not interested can continue a few blocks down the street to the 2, 3, 4, 5, & R subways home. We expect to be starting dinner at 5:30pm.

<< Note: >> There will be NO bathroom breaks. If you need to use a restroom along the way, you will have to drop out of the group and find one. There is a deli on the corner of 23rd and Broadway, if you go there before the hike and buy a coke or something, you can use their bathroom.

We don't do head counts. If people disappear, too bad - it just isn't practical to go looking for them. By coming on this walk you assert that you are competent, if necessary, to find your own way home.

This event is provided free of financial charge in exchange for attendees relinquishing their right to litigate, and by attending, you agree that you and any guests participate at your own risk, and that you will not take any legal action against the organizers of this group for anything unfortunate that may happen during this outing. There is especially a risk that you will get separated from the group and lost, and if that happens the responsibility will be yours. We will be crossing a lot of streets, and you may get hit by a vehicle, especially if you jaywalk. If you see others in group, including the leader, jaywalking, that does not guarantee that it is safe for you to do the same. The liability waiver that you are agreeing to by attending can be read at http://www.bluejacket7.com/legal/WalkingWaiver.doc
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be between the fountain and the "Shake Shack".  I look like my picture, plus a mustache.
results.name: Brainy 6 Mile Brooklyn Bridge Hike
