results.description:
FREE EVENT!
Come and experience Namaste's NEW Spiritual Book Club!

Our first meeting will be October 4th at 3PM and ending at 5PM at Namaste Healing Center and we will be discussing the POWER OF NOW by Eckhart Tolle.

So even if it's your first time reading this great classic or your tenth, come in next Sunday to be inspired and share your insights with like minded Souls.

The new Spiritual Book club will be lead by Jane Dowd Oosterom.  

Jane has just returned to New York from the Netherlands where she had the great experience to lead the Spiritual Book Club at the American Book Center in Amsterdam.  

Jane's passion is teaching and facilitating meditation groups and has a vast spectrum of experiences from a career on Wall Street, a masters in Holistic Ministry and the gift of being a wife and mother.  

Following her passion, she is very excited for the opportunity to create a space where you can share your insights and help shed light on the path leading to your authentic Self.

Here is a great free tour that may interest you.  Please note this is an un-hosted/no-host event, guests will attend on their own as unfortunately I'm unable to make this tour.  I am just posting this through our Meetup site to help promote this program for our friends at the Smithsonian.  

Stop by and you will no doubt meet other members of our Meetup group.

When

Sunday, April 3, 2016, 3 – 4 PM

Categories

Gallery Talks & Tours

Sponsor

American Indian Museum

Venue

American Indian Museum Heye Center

Event Location

2nd fl. visitors desk.

Cost

FREE.

Related Events

Gallery ToursDetails

Museum Ambassador Carlos Molina provides a tour of the Alexander Hamilton U.S. Custom House,home of the National Museum of the American Indian in New York.Tour highlights include a discussion of the history of the site,architect Cass Gilbert,viewing the Collectors office,with Tiffany woodwork;Reginald Marsh murals;and the 140 ton Rotunda Dome by Raphael Gustavino.

Please direct any additional questions to the Smithsonian and check their calendar beforehand to make sure this event is still scheduled.


http://www.si.edu/Events/Calendar/?trumbaEmbed=filter3%3D_%26-index%26filterfield3%3D11223#/?i=6

Thanks!

Robert

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Monday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Tuesday, an email will be sent, listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance or read and mark up electronic comments.

Stories can be any length up to approx. 7,000 words. Flash fiction welcome.

You can submit your story to me (Marcy) directly, or submit to Dropbox per the Procedures (see below). My email is [masked].

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. Read through our Short Story Group Procedures for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure to make sure critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, so writers leave with a clear idea of what to do next with their stories.

We also spend time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know!

Flash pieces: If there is time (and there usually is), we can critique one or two last minute flash pieces that weren't submitted. Best method is to print out a copy for each participant. We will read the story there and give on-the-spot critiques.
results.name: Marcy's Short Story Meetup

Please join us on Sunday for meditation instruction and sitting practice. Developed for beginners as well as experienced meditators, this afternoon session will include guided instruction by an experienced teacher, and discussion and opportunity for questions and comments. More details:http://www.theidproject.org/events/2015/05/03/sundays-weekly-introduction-meditation 

Recent scientific research suggests that meditation practice is an effective means to lessening stress and depression, boosting bodily immune and respiratory functions, increasing happiness and cultivating compassion and joy within one's life.

results.description:
The NYC Muslim-Jewish Solidarity Committee has been invited to attend a performance of the highly acclaimed one-man play Wrestling Jerusalem.

Set in America, Israel and Palestine, WRESTLING JERUSALEM follows one man’s journey to understand the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Aaron Davidman’s solo performance is a personal story that grapples with the complexities of identity, history and social justice. Giving voice to 17 different characters – men and women, Jews and Muslims, soldiers and farmers, intellectuals and ordinary citizens – the play sheds light on one of the most entrenched conflicts of our time.

We've been generously offered $15 tickets (Usually $35) for the April 3, 3:15 performance at the 59E59 theaters.
Order your tickets here: http://www.59e59.org/moreinfo.php?showid=236 and MAKE SURE TO USE THE PROMO CODE WJMJS43.

WRESTLING JERUSALEM is a play that seeks to build bridges of understanding about the complex challenges of the Israeli/Palestinian conflict. The 90-minute performance will be followed by a post-show discussion.

Visit http://www.wrestlingjerusalem.com/ for more information about the play.

* The NYC Muslim-Jewish Solidarity Committee did not take part in the production of Wrestling Jerusalem and is not responsible or endorsing any of the content.
results.name: WRESTLING JERUSALEM

****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 15-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
IT IS HAPENNING AGAIN (and for longer)! 


For those who are just hearing about THE ZERO JUDGMENT CARDIO DANCE PARTY (or who want a refresher), here is the story:


I have had some trouble finding a form of exercise that feels right for me. I don't like the pressure/seriousness/aggression of competitive sports. Solo forms of exercise just seem so dreadfully boring and repetitive to me. And I don't like being told what to do/having to follow specific instructions for long periods of time, which rules out most group exercise stuff I've been exposed to. So, I've decided to do these little event-experiments to see if there might be alternative forms of group exercise for me and people like me who aren't totally satisfied with the exercise options out there right now (or who maybe just want to try something new). The goal is to create a space for people who want to exercise NON-COMPETITIVELY in a GROUP SETTING with an emphasis on SPONTANEOUS CREATIVITY and SELF-DIRECTED SELF-EXPRESSION.

To be crystal clear: disparaging/judgmental attitudes of any kind will not be tolerated at this event. The idea is to create a safe space for people to have fun, get exercise, and be themselves. In terms of what events will look like, we will basically be doing an (interactive) warm-up, some stretching, and then going straight into the dance party! There are no rules for the party, only guidelines. One guideline is to try to root whatever movements you are doing in some sort of heart rate raising action, such as running in place, jumping, etc.... Another guideline is that if at any moment you are really feeling the music/your movements, you may shout "CHANNEL!" and anyone who wants to will look at you and then, if they want, mimic/channel your movements in some way.

**NOTE: People who are not sure if they feel comfortable moving creatively/dancing in front of others are more than welcome to just run in place//do jumping jacks//anything else! There are no rules saying you have to dance/move creatively the whole time, or even any of the time, if you don't want to!**

**ANOTHER NOTE: People are being invited to this event in many different ways so the number of RSVPs the event has here is basically meaningless. We had 10 people come last time, so it will probably be in that ballpark.**

THAT IS ALL FOR NOW FOLKS TO BE CLEAR THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO ANYONE AND EVERYONE WHO IS INTERESTED AND IS BEING HELD IN THE SPIRIT OF PROMOTING MENTAL/PHYSICAL WELLNESS FOR ALL HUMANS! PLEASE FEEL FREE TO TELL YOUR FRIENDS AND ALSO LET ME KNOW IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS! I HOPE TO SEE YOU THERE!

-Josh K.
results.name: ZERO JUDGMENT CARDIO DANCE PARTY #2 !!!

results.description:
Hi Health Nuts,

Let's climb!

Time: 3:30pm

Address: Brooklyn Boulders @ Corner of Degraw st and 3rd Avenue Brooklyn (575 Degraw st)

Cost: Day Pass and full gear is $39

If you don’t plan on getting belayed and just want shoes to boulder, it is cheaper without needing harness and chalk. See below…

DAY PASS: $28 (Students $22)

GEAR RENTALS:

Shoes – $6

Harness – $6

Chalk Bag – $2

Full Gear Kit – $11 (saves $3)


BRING A LOCK or else you’ll have to carry your valuables. Large lockers are located in the very back of the gym. When in doubt just keep walking till you are as far away from the front desk.


First, if you come on time it will be easy to find me. I will be standing right there when you first walk in with a red shirt, my asian smile, short hair, and tattoo on left forearm. My friend Johanna who is big curly hair and my partner Jennifer who has long black hair down to her butt, will also be wearing a red shirt.


But sometimes and we’re late so, here is my number, call or text me[masked], and search for my red shirt.


HEADS UP on logistics…

When you first come in there is TWO lines.

• If you haven’t been in Brooklyn Boulders ever, go on the line that people are filling out the waivers on the ipads at the desk. Then, go on the LONG line, which is to sign in, pay, and get your gear.

• If you’ve already been to Brooklyn Boulders before you don’t have to fill another waiver, so just get on the LONG line to sign in, pay, and get your gear.

If you would like, we'll go out to eat and drink afterwards at The KBH for dinner. 

for the love of fitness,

Mo [masked])

results.description:
NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ Frederick Douglass Playground


                                 Check our Facebook page:

              facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer 

                          NO CLEATS OR PLASTIC STUDS ALLOWED

</a>

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nzhrn3ldY4U

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 7 on 7, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 9:00 am on Sunday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

1-First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

2-Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

3-No power shots allowed.

4-If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

5-If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.


6-Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location:

Frederick Douglass Playground


Take the 1,2 or 3 RED Line Train to 96th street Station and walk 4 blocks down, to 101st Street and Amsterdam Ave. or the 1 RED Line Train to 103rd Street Station and walk 1 block.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S. 

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes(No CLEATS), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.50 when you RSVP. This $9.50 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Royale for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                       <a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz/lions-head-tavern-new-york">Lion’s Head Tavern 

                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Crafting of the Witch: The Kitchen Witch’s Herbal Soap Making

The History

The making of your soap from scratch

The many methods of soap making

Using essential oils and herbs

Making magickal soaps

Creating your own recipe

Soaps with a purpose

Reasons to make your own soaps

Coming in handy…

$40.00 per class - Supplies are included in cost: you will be able to walk away with soaps you made and created your own recipes for.

Until around 1916, making soap at home was commonplace. Using wood or plant ashes and leftover animal fats, families produced their own soap for cleaning their clothes and themselves.

It has become a lost art for many, but many of us have enjoyed making our own soaps from scratch.

Have you ever browsed through a shop and wondered how all those lovely soaps, were made? Perhaps you’ve already tried your hand at making them and wish to refine your technique? This workshop is for you! Get ready for some creative fun with experienced instructors and hands-on learning.

In recent years, back-to-the-landers and simple-living adherents have revived the homemade soap-making process — but it’s not only in favor with those who leave the big city for rural life or those with an anti-commercialist bent. For anyone interested in living as self-sufficiently as possible, it makes good sense to make your own soap.

If you’re ready to start making soap at home — and reaping its many benefits
results.name: Crafting the Witch: Herbal Soap Making

On Sunday please join us, CLASSICAL FOR ALL, to celebrate the second anniversary of our classical Sundays at CAFFE VIVALDI.

Our intimate and donation based concerts reached hundreds of New Yorkers and we are proud to become the only independent weekly classical music series in New York City. This week we went through the repertoire we performed since 2014 and published it on our blog, check it out and let us know how many of these pieces you heard live from Emir Gamsizoglu;)

http://classicalforall.com/2016/03/24/caffe-vivaldi-repertoire-2014-2016/

On Sunday, Emir will play a delightful selection from this small (!) repertoire. One of the pieces he'll perform is something that you can't hear anywhere else by a New Yorker composer from George Gershwin's time. Emir will make a world premiere recording of this piece in the next few weeks.

Tickets $20 (Suggested price) - Get them online to guarantee your seats;

For 40+ years WFMU DJ Irwin Chusid has tried—and failed—to launch a calypso revival.


His campaign returns to Union Pool in Brooklyn on Sunday, April 3rd, when he spins a two-hour calypso set from 4-6 pm.


Come celebrate four decades of failure with platters by Mighty Sparrow, Lord Kitchener, Duke of Iron, Mighty Zebra, Wilmoth Houdini, Two Gun Smokey, Lord Melody, and others. Union Pool stocks the following rum: Sailor Jerry, Malibu, Gosling’s, Bacardi, and Flor de Caña. (Irwin highly recommends 1, 3, and 5.)


Irwin has invited The Mighty Sparrow (who lives in Queens) to attend. If Sparrow makes it, no rum for Birdie. Buy him a Bud, his drink of choice.


The party continues when WFMU’s Dave the Spazz commandeers the turntables at 6 pm.

results.description:
All you love is gone. The Stilt-Sands, a floating city you have called home since birth, was torn to pieces before your eyes. Ensorcelled before the disaster, you could do nothing to save anyone but yourself, watching the horror as if it were nothing but a bad dream.

Your refuge is the Salty Cormorant, an odd amalgamation of pirate and Navy vessel. There, you came fully back to your senses, and are filled with nothing but rage and pain. And you aren’t the only one. You, and the other 300 survivors, have been robbed of home and health, and there are others who would see it righted, or avenged. You are told that you sail for Precipice Port. A fortnight cannot pass soon enough. Until then, you will find out everything the crew of this strange ship knows, to find some clue about the terrible beast He. However, you are not alone in this pursuit. The evil that trapped your minds has followed you, and it is not done with you yet. 

Stilt-Sand Survivors is the first chapter in the new WildPig Exclusive Campaign "Vengeance at Sea" by Noah Anderson, set in the “Ten Isles” setting developed by Noah Anderson in association with the WildPig community. All players are welcome. Characters are 1st level, with a limit of 8 players per session. There will be time for character creation a half-hour before the first session. Seats are limited, so please register ahead of time.
results.name: D&D 5E: Vengeance at Sea Chapter 1 - Stilt-Sand Survivors

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/

results.description:
In preparation for our upcoming food tour of Spain I thought we might try one of New York's finest Spanish restaurants. Andanada is a Michelin Star Spanish Restaurant that takes you to different regions of Spain through their most famous dishes by Chef Manuel Berganza. He combines traditional Spanish cuisine with an innovative cooking that remains faithful to the flavors of Spain. Andanada refers to the highest seating area in the bullfighting arena, one of the most traditional events in Spanish culture. Andanada offers a real Spanish experience through their tapas that are intended to be shared, just like in Spain, along with main courses and paellas and a variety of desserts.  I'm in!

Their menu looks amazing and will definitely get me in the mood for my upcoming trip. I'm not sure I'm going to want to share some of my tapas! You can view their dinner selections here. http://www.andanada141.com/menu/dinner-menu/


I hope you will join me for a wonderful evening wine, food and spirited conversation and give our members a wonderful send off to Spain! Buen Provecho!
results.name: Andanada - A Taste of Spain

results.description: In this event, with Cheryl Anne Morse - 'shamanic dreamer' and artist - will guide us through our past life memories. Let's release whatever karmic burdens are preventing you from moving forward with joy and clarity. Let there be no impediment to your succeeding in life! Have you ever wondered about your life before this birth? Whether your beliefs embrace the reality of past lives or not - you can bring your open mind and curiosity for exploring life's secrets. Keep it simple and enjoy the discussion with like minded people. Cheryl has been doing past life regression in the form of guided imagery for over ten years now. She's been researching the topic for her own healing for 30 years now. Her approach is simple and effective. There will be time afterwards for a cup of tea and some Q & A. NOTE: There is a fee of $25 for this event. In Cheryl's words: "Past Life Regression is a Shamanic deep trance state of consciousness in which you receive images and/or sensory input, which give information about your past lives.This information can enter the mind stream in small bits or in a straightforward stream of consciousness storyline. Past Life Regression is a way of obtaining insights from such sources as your higher self, inner wisdom and the wisdom of the universe. Often, such insights are extremely valuable and healing in regard to your present life situation, providing highly relevant background information to help you move forward on your current life's journey"
results.name: Past Life Regression

venue.name: Levity Live Comedy Club (4th floor of the Palisades Center Mall)

results.description:
CONFESSION TIME: Wayne Brady is one of my favorite improv actors in the industry. I squealed when I saw that he's going to be within a 3-mile radius from me.

You guys, I'm so excited @#%@%@%@%

---------------------------------------------------

WHAT IS THE LEVITY LIVE CLUB?


At the Levity Live Comedy Club, renowned comedians such as Kevin Nealon and Susie Essman have graced the same stage as up-and-coming comics including Elliot Chang and Sam Morril.

---------------------------------------------------

WHO IS WAYNE BRADY? (Besides being one of the best improv actor EVER)

Wayne Brady is a comedian and actor known for his work on TV's Whose Line Is It Anyhow, The Wayne Brady Show and Don't Forget the Lyrics.

Born in 1972 in Columbus, Georgia, Wayne Brady auditioned for the British comedy series Whose Line Is It Anyway?, and he was cast in several episodes and later starred in the American version as well. In 2001, The Wayne Brady Show first aired, and although the show earned two Daytime Emmys, it was canceled in 2004. Brady returned to host 2007's Fox network game show Don't Forget the Lyrics and in 2009 took the reins of the reboot of the game show Let's Make a Deal.

After touring with his own live stage show, Brady returned to the small screen in 2007 to host Fox's network game show Don't Forget the Lyrics. Brady has since made appearances in multiple television series, including How I Met Your Mother, Everybody Hates Chris and the animated series Sophia the First. In 2008 he released the Grammy-nominated album A Long Time Coming, and the following year he took on hosting duties of a new version of daytime game show Let's Make a Deal, which entered its sixth season in 2014.

---------------------------------------------------

**EVENT DETAILS**

HOW TO BUY TICKETS: Purchase your ticket here: http://levitylive.com/event.cfm?cart&id=433901. Note that buying your ticket in advance is YOUR responsibility. I highly recommend not waiting until the week before to purchase your ticket!


COST OF THE EVENT: $30/ticket, $15-25/person for food (variable)

The Levity Live Comedy Club requires a two-item minimum food and/or drink purchase per person. Check out their menu here: http://nyack.levitylive.com/FOOD--DRINK.

TIME: According to the internet, the earlier we get there, the better seats we will have. So even though the event itself is at 7PM, lets meet at 5:30PM at Chipotle, which is right next to the Levity Live. Depending on how many people RSVP, we can get dinner reservations.

PARKING: The best entrance is via TheEATery or Target.

Come join me swoon and laugh at him! #fangirlinghard

---------------------------------------------------

UNRELATED TIP: Check out Levity Live groupons at https://www.groupon.com/deals/gl-levity-live

Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leaders - Joanne & LD)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 5:45pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
I’ Trulli Ristorante
122 East 27th (Park and Lexington)
Sunday, April 3rd
5:45 optional drinks, 6:45 dinner
$77 3-course, gl of wine, tax and tip.

Hi, please RSVP here and then prepay on our website or by contacting me directly. The link to pay is http://thesinglegourmet.net/event/itrulli/
ALL of our events are prepaid and we average 25-40 people. We do not take cash at the door as the restaurants need an accurate headcount and seating is assigned via tables and demographics. With such a large group, it is just the way restaurants will accept us. We are a membership only organization, but allow meetup members to attend some of our events to meet new faces. To see more of our events and to join, please go to www.thesinglegourmet.net Thank you.

Antipasta

arugula parmigiano lemon
bufala 
buffalo mozzarella · pickled winter vegatables
polpette

secondi piatti

local black bass · root vegetables
pollo 
organic chicken · potato purée · french beans
brasato 
braised short rib · farro · peas
orecchiette 
in a rabbit ragú
ravioli per olivia
ricotta · pistachios

dolci
cioccolato chocolate cake · vanilla panna cotta

Opened by restaurateur Nicola Marzovilla in 1994, I Trulli Ristorante is one of New York City’s landmarks of fine Italian dining. TripAdisor Recommended-Certificate of Excellence. Its menu celebrates the cuisine of the Marzovilla family’s homeland, the region of Puglia. The pastas are handmade daily by owner Dora Marzovilla. Zagat rated 23 for “Rustic but sophisticated, this Kips Bay Southern Italian purveys a trulli special Puglian menu.” New York Magazine review, “This is pretty much the only game in town when it comes to faithful renditions of Apulian regional dishes (Apulia is the heel of Italy's boot). The chef brings this rustic cuisine into sharp focus, and provides a welcome relief from typical Southern Italian red-sauce monotony.” Michelin Guide states “Warm, ambient, and widely appealing, this precious restaurant is known for crafting Italian food with a light touch. Neither young nor hip, it's a neighborhood stalwart that still lures locals with its sublime covered garden and charming dining room of white walls and flickering candles. Then there's the menu, which is unabashedly pleasing.” Our menu includes entrees such as black bass, braised shot ribs, organic chicken, home-made pastas and much more.
results.name: I'Trulli-menu

The first practice is free and we love getting new players! Please let the coach on deck know if it's your first time with us and feel free to message Alex Barclay ahead of time if you have any questions. You will need to bring a swim suit appropriate for water polo, a towel, goggles and a lock. If you would like to practice with us regularly, you must become registered with US Water Polo at the silver level and pay our annual membership dues. 

We ask that any practice participants have some prior experience playing water polo and be able to swim a hundred yards in a row in less than two minutes. If you have a swimming background and are interested in learning water polo, please read the pdf below thoroughly and contact Alex Barclay. The coaching is typically geared to an intermediate level of play and we do work on basic skills at every practice. Everyone should be familiar with the basic rules and concepts of the game, as outlined in this pdf: 

http://www.tnya.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Polo_Beginners.pdf

Practices typically include a swim set and some conditioning at the beginning, drills, and scrimmaging for the last 30-45 minutes (it's also ok to sit out and watch for the scrimmaging portion if it's your first practice). The first and third Sundays are geared towards scrimmaging and the second and fourth are more focused on skills and/or conditioning. Bob or Jeff are the typical coaches. We strive to create a positive and welcoming environment and do not tolerate any unsportsmanlike conduct. There are at least four tournaments we compete in each year and practices will adjust in the weeks before the tournaments to prepare participating players.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk in. Pool is straight ahead. Tell the desk you're there for water polo.
results.name: TNYA hosts All Level Water Polo

Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

You can meet the group on the steps to the church following mass and walk over together or you can meet the group at the bar.  It is easy to find us.

The Parlour is a very casual Irish Pub.  Grab a seat at the bar or you can sit at a table to eat and drink.


Pay as you go for food and drink. A full menu is available

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last?

Usually around 9ish

results.description:
Sunday Evening at Heights Meditation is a great way to either end your week or begin your week (or both!) with others similarly-minded, those seeking clarity of mind and open-heartedness in their everyday lives.

The Sunday evening meeting normally begins with some chant as a means to center the self and lighten up. We like to think of it as a kind of spiritual singalong, and who doesn't like a singalong? We use several easy-to-learn and different Sanskrit texts and leave it to members to choose a chant they'd like the group to use on a particular evening. If you have never chanted before, come along and try out this wonderful spiritual tool. It doesn't matter if it seems strange to you--the point is precisely to buck oneself out of a sense of 'ordinary' life--or if you think you are completely atonal. You will probably derive a lot of benefit from doing chant, and it can lastingly help you forward in life.

After the chanting ends, we immediately go into silent meditation for 20-25 minutes. Whereas chant tends to focus and energize the body and mind, silent meditation tends to quiet and calm the mind. It's a perfect counterpoint to the chanting.

As you can see, then, the Sunday evening meetings are a kind of dual spiritual exercise: of energizing and focusing the mind (chant) and then relaxing and calming it (meditation).

Come along to this or our other meetings if you feel you'd like to live a happier, calmer life and be able to live fearlessly through the cares and worries of modern life. If you can find a way to slow down and live more mindfully, you are well on the way to being an agent of joy and serenity in your own life and the lives of those living around you.
results.how_to_find_us: A or 1 Trains to 190th Street, south entrance to the church. Look for signs posted on the doors!
results.name: Meditate Together Sunday Evenings

results.description:
Support group offering healing from toxic or unhealthy relationships allowing you to take back your life and make healthier choices within a unique format utilizing more than just talk.

In this meetup, we offer more than just talk. This group is a safe and supportive environment for sharing fun, experiential activities that will facilitate healing and help you develop a deeper connection to yourself, which is the key to creating health in all your relationships.


Some things we will experience together include: deep honest sharing, meditation, role playing, educational readings, structured exercises and various other fun activities.


Some of the questions we will explore at the next meeting will be: 

What or who are you looking to draw closer to you?

What or who are you attempting to let go of?

Toxic or unhealthy relationships can be experienced with intimate partners as well as with friends, parents, siblings, children or work relationships. Come share about the effects of unhealthy relationships in your life. We will also share about what a healthy relationship looks like and how we can begin to have a healthier relationship with ourselves.

Meet others struggling with the same issues and learn to: 

Attract people who are available and capable of treating you with the love and respect you deserve 

Gain confidence and make healthier choices

View your relationships in a new and different perspective

Group will meet 1-2x month on Sundays 7:15 PM - 8:30 PM 

Introductory Rate $10 per Session

Facilitated by a Certified Addiction Recovery Coach, Certified Addiction Peer Advocate, Life Skills Coach and Independent Health Coach

This week's special-bring a friend get half off the next session.

This group is all about support, sharing and encouragement. 

Please come join me and lets support each other.

Bio Info-I wanted to share more about myself and why I created this group. I know firsthand the difficulties in letting go of a toxic relationship. For me, my mind was saying one thing - to let go - but my heart was saying something else. Even though I knew in my mind the relationship I was in was toxic, my heart just could not break the ties and I was determined to do whatever it took to hold on. Thankfully, with the support and encouragement of like-minded community, like this group, I was able to let go and move onto healthier relationships. Today, I no longer need an intimate relationship to make me feel whole. I became a certified addiction recovery coach and created this group to share all that I have learned and to create a space for us to connect.  In this group, we will support one another in making healthier choices, which attract healthier relationships, and be in community with people, just like you & me, who are looking to heal from toxic relationships and take back our lives.

results.name: Heal From Toxic Relationships

results.description:
Webinar:   Why TPP is a Feminist Issue  with Terry O'Neill, President of the National Organization for Women


 Guest Organizer and Moderator: Elizabeth Warren

 Register at http://tradejustice.net/callreg - you MUST register to receive webinar login info!  

Today, Sunday April 3rd, 7:30 PM

(see below for times in other time zones)

ADDITIONAL PRESENTERS 

- Nick Semanko, Senior Legislative Assistant to Representative Louise Slaughter, will talk about the new letter signed by 19 NY Congressional Democrats to President Obama opposing TPP and about Rep Slaughter's International Women's Day article, "Supporting women includes opposing TPP." 

 - Margaret Flowers of Flush the TPP and Popular Resistance will talk about actions following the May 18th release of the US International Trade Commission TPP report. 

 - Kit Jones of Fort Worth MoveOn Council and the Texas Progressive Allies Coalition will speak on the the anti-TPP resolution that Texas Senate District (SD10) just passed, which will be presented to the Texas State Democratic Convention in June. 

 - Adam Weissman of Global Justice for Animals and the Environment and TradeJustice New York Metro will discuss two new letters by members of Congress vs. TPP, new reports on TPP's potential economic and environmental impacts, upcoming events, and volunteer opportunities with TradeJustice Alliance.  


WHY TPP IS A FEMINIST ISSUE 

"There have been two established patterns with free trade agreements: they tend to export jobs abroad and depress wages. According to the Economic Policy Institute, the United States displaced 682,900 jobs following NAFTA alone, which puts even more pressure and competition on U.S. workers trying to find employment. Free trade agreements also tend to discourage unionization and increase competition with international workers, which in turn, makes wages lower and worsens working conditions globally. These problematic trends will have the most negative impact on low-income workers, whose jobs are vulnerable and whose wages are low. Women make up two-thirds of these jobs. Trade Agreement is a Feminist Issue – This makes the Trans-Pacific Partnership a feminist issue. When wages are lowered, this disproportionately affects women who are still subjected to gender-based pay discrimination and persistent patterns of low pay in occupations dominated by women – especially women of color — such as retail, food service and day care/nursing home and home health care attendants. Additionally, similar consequences in job markets and wages in the 12 TPP countries will negatively impact women and low-income workers in those nations. (see, http://now.org/resource/fact-sheet-how-the-tpp-will-hurt-women/ ) 

 The Trans-Pacific Partnership will put moderate and low-income women at risk, further cheating them out of the better wages, benefits and the job security that they deserve. On these grounds, the National Organization for Women opposes “Fast Track” and the Trans-Pacific Partnership Agreement, and strongly urges memb ers of Congress to vote against “Fast Track” and to oppose the TPP. Globally, the TPP could severely restrict women’s rights and resources that have been infringed upon through past trade agreements, including essential medicines. Drug companies have been allowed to add stipulations to the TPP that will increase the strength (length) of patents and other related protections. With t hese protections, drug companies will be able to further monopolize the pharmaceutical market, and will inevitably raise the price of drugs in all twelve countries affected by the TPP, even though their production costs will stay the same. Also, if a small number of drug companies monopolize the market, there will be less pressure for innovation research that produces more effective drugs. Another controversial and deeply troubling aspect of the TPP is its inclusion of Brunei, a country that just last year passed horrific anti-LGBTQIA and anti-women legislation. Under these new laws, a penal code calls for the stoning of people who engage in same-sex relationships, the jailing of people who have aborti ons, and fines or imprisonment for women who give birth out of wedlock. A trade agreement that supports a country with such barbarically restrictive laws cannot call itself “free.” Under provisions believed to be in the TPP, the United States would have less power to influence which nation is allowed to remain a TPP partner." Excerpted from NOW's "Free Trade and Feminism – How the TPP Will Hurt Women" by Marandah Field-Elliot http://now.org/resource/issue-advisory-free-trade-and-feminism-how-the-tpp-will-hurt-women/ 

ABOUT TERRY O'NEILL


Terry O’Neill, a feminist attorney, professor and activist for social justice, was elected president of NOW in June 2009. She is also president of the NOW Foundation and chair of the NOW Political Action Committees, and serves as the principal spokesperson for all three entities. O’Neill oversees NOW’s multi-issue agenda, which includes: advancing reproductive freedom, promoting diversity and ending racism, stopping violence against women, winning lesbian rights, ensuring economic justice, ending sex discrimination and achieving constitutional equality for women.

O’Neill’s feminist activism began in the 1990s, fighting right-wing extremists in the Deep South, including David Duke. She has served as president of Louisiana NOW and New Orleans NOW and as a member of the National Racial Diversity Committee. She is a past president of Maryland NOW and served on the NOW National Board twice, representing the Mid-South Region [masked]) and the Mid-Atlantic Region [masked]). O’Neill was NOW’s membership vice president from 2001 to 2005, when she oversaw NOW’s membership development program as well as finances and government relations.

A former law professor, O’Neill taught at Tulane in New Orleans and at the University of California at Davis, where her courses included feminist legal theory and international women’s rights law, in addition to corporate law and legal ethics. She has testified before committees in the Maryland House of Delegates and has written federal amicus briefs on abortion rights for Louisiana NOW, Planned Parenthood and the American Civil Liberties Union.

O’Neill is a skilled political organizer, having worked on such historic campaigns as Hillary Clinton’s campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination, Barack Obama’s presidential campaign, and the campaign leading to the election of Louisiana’s first woman U.S. senator, Mary Landrieu. She also worked to elect women’s rights supporters to judgeships and the state legislature in Louisiana, as well as the successful campaign to elect former Maryland NOW president and NOW National Board member Duchy Trachtenberg to the Montgomery County (MD) Council. O’Neill holds a bachelor’s degree in French with distinction from Northwestern University and a law degree magna cum laude from Tulane University. She has one child, a daughter who is a proud feminist.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization that meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless.

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

THIS EVENT IS FOR MEAL DISTRIBUTION: 

Volunteers gather on East 11th street for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers distributing food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT: 

10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday night and would be thrilled to extend up to 8 distribution spots to NYC Volunteer Opportunities members each week. 

TO JOIN: RSVP here or feel free to check out 10,000 PB&Js group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs

CAN'T ATTEND BUT WANT TO HELP?

Here's the link to 10,000's Wish List: https://goo.gl/qwXAY7
results.name: Volunteer with 10,000 PB&Js

facebook.com/groups/therisenyc

----------------------------------------------

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Just for fun!

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.

Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

Rising star pianist Kariné Poghosyan, Pianist returns to the Puffin to present music by Schubert and Liszt. Concert will begin with Four Impromptus, Op. 90, followed by the grandiose Wanderer Fantasy. Second half of the program will explore the intriguing connection between the two composers with selected Piano Transcriptions of Schubert songs by Franz Liszt. These delightful German Art songs by Schubert become true virtuosic piano works in the hands of the Hungarian master Franz Liszt. Program also includes Liszt’s Transcendental Etudes and his renowned Hungarian Rhapsody No. 12.
$10 Suggested Donation

Due to inclement weather forecast for Monday April 4th, we will most likely postpone the event until next week, Monday April 11.  Please check facebook.com/harvesttable or twitter (@harvesttablenj) for updates.  You can also call[masked]-8183.

Start the week off right on the right foot--come run or walk with us! Walking or running just 30 min/day can alleviate high blood pressure, diabetes, stress, anxiety, and many other health issues, not to mention, it will help you lose weight and get your beach body ready for summer! Join us after work (~5pm) on Mondays, starting April 4th. Meet at Harvest Table Fresh Food Eatery to stretch and hydrate, run/walk for 30 min, and get 20% off your lunch on Tuesday! It's healthy & fun, and it will set the tone for your workouts for the rest of the week. Everyone welcome. BYOSneakers :) For more info, call[masked]-8183. <a>www.harvesttablenewark.com.</a> Meet @ Harvest Table-- 127 Halsey St. Newark, NJ 07102

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
Come join Bi+ and Bi-friendly people from the greater NYC Area in a lively topic-oriented discussion at BiRequest's famously open, non-judgmental, safe space. If you can't make it to the meeting, feel free to join everyone afterward around  "eight-fifteenish" for dinner.


2016 Scheduling Change:  Starting in January 2016, we're adjusting our discussion meetings to accommodate our late shift workers and evening class students.. Hopefully if you have class on (the first) Monday, you can make it on (the third) Thursday of any given month.    

About us: Thanks to the dedication and hard work of many good bisexual folk, BiRequest continues the work of hosting biweekly discussions and monthly social gatherings serving the New York City metropolitan area; we've been rocking our bi selves since January 1994. We provide a safe space for bisexuals of ever stripe (bi, fluid, queer, pan, omni, sapio, and so many more).  And we welcome bi-friendly people to gather and discuss issues of importance to us.

We're a co-ed group for adults from 18 to 80-plus who meet twice a month every 1st Monday and 3rd Thursday evening at NYC's LGBT Center in the West Village. The meetings are moderated and focused on a discussion topic but not limited to that week's topic.

After the discussion we go to dinner at a nearby, reasonably-priced restaurant for socializing and more informal discussion.  We also have occasional social events such as movie nights, parties, and much more. Join us for a meeting or event and find the community you've been looking for!

People who can't make it to the meeting are invited to join our private online group BiRequest on Yahoo or on our Facebook Page BiRequest on Facebook.
results.how_to_find_us: "check the front desk for "BiRequest" meeting room."
results.name: 1st MONDAY !   BiRequest Meeting

group.name: NYC's Bisexual, Non-Monosexual & Queer Meetup Group

results.description: I always learn something new at the group, like an advanced feature, or a glitch/bug to beware of. The Microsoft Conference Center, is free of charge, To RSVP, please send an email to: LindaEwen at nyc dot rr dot com, with your first and last name. We plan on meeting on the 1st Monday of every month, but occasionally there are changes. You should receive an email, if there's a change. I suggest you print out any email response you receive, even though it's not required. The Conference Center's security department, requires your first and last name, so please include your full name, within the body of your email. A photo ID is mandatory. Sometimes, the map on this meetup link above, is incorrect, so please write down the address. If you don't get an email back from anyone, within a day or two, please send a 2nd request.It's OK, to be half an hour early and use the free coffee machine. Try to go early, if it's your first time, in case you are not registered properly. If you arrive, and the the security personnel informs you of a registration problem, don't be alarmed, they will assist you. Please be patient. For those who sent their first email request, on the day of the event, this process may take half an hour, and the cut off time for confirmation is 7:00 PM.

results.description:
ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!! Turf shoes and indoor shoes are ay-okay.  

Permit Disclosure: We have a permit.

PLEASE BRING A WHITE SHIRT, A DARK SHIRT & A BRIGHT COLORED SHIRT

Game Host - DT

Co-leader - Braulio

Location -We're playing outdoor at John Murray Playground in Long Island City.

PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 5:45pM!! Teams will be picked from this time.

This session will begin at 10am sharp and and late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game. We will play two 40 minute games with 10 minutes for half time.

The game format is two 7v7 games, running simultaneously. Winners and losers of the first game will play against each other in the second game.

This game is to raise funds for Lionsraw, for more information please speak to Ben or click on this link... www.lionsraw.org

Rules:

Fun Play 
No Sliding 
Goals after half point only. 
Kick-ins.. no throw ins. 
Corner kicks. 
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect PS2G plays clean soccer! This means no cursing, insulting, complaining, arguing or fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style or if you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

***BRING TURF SHOES OR SNEAKERS & A DARK, WHITE & A BRIGHT COLORED SHIRT*** 

AGAIN - NO CLEATS ALLOWED!

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free.

http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

[masked]
results.name: Monday 545PM Soccer @ LIC (2 x 7v7 games 1 hr) for PS2G

results.description:
Speakers for this awesome event are:

Dr. Mohamed Latid, founder of CX University - www.cxuniversity.com

Dianne Devitt - The effect of Scent on CX - www.senseupsummit.com

Richard Shapiro - The Endangered Customer - www.tcfcr.com

Dana Farbo - Mobile CX in Retail - www.farbo.com

Hosts Livestream to speak about their video streaming platform - www.livestream.com

Dana Farbo and I are very excited that Laura Marciano, a Customer Experience Meet-up member and Head of Customer Operations at Livestream has offered their event space for our next meet-up. They will be live-streaming the event, which will be wonderful and also providing complimentary refreshments. What else could we ask for? There will be a short presentation by Livestream by either Laura or their CEO, Jesse Hertzberg. In addition, there will be one or two speakers from the Customer Experience Meet-Up Group. They will be announced soon.

Livestream, which is located at 195 Morgan Avenue, Brooklyn is only a 5 minute walk from the L train which you can pick up at Union Square Station. It's definitely worth the trip to see their event space and learn first hand about their exciting business (see company description below). We can probably share some Uber rides going back into Manhattan at the end of the evening. 

Livestream isn’t just the greatest company on the planet, it’s also the #1 cloud service to broadcast your event live. We make it easy for anyone to bring their event to life online. Customers like SpaceX, NBA, RISD, Tesla, IMG, 92Y, Marvel, and the World Economic Forum trust our platform to reach their customers around the globe. Our team of 150 is located in five offices on three continents. Learn more at http://www.livestream.com.

results.description:
RSVP on Facebook.

Learn about webscraping and automating tasks using the web driver, Selenium. This workshop will be taught by a software engineer at Handy, Rakesh Ranjan Sukla. Please bring your laptop. 

Requirement: Basic knowledge of Python and HTML web elements. 

Install Selenium - `pip install selenium`

Speaker: Rakesh Ranjan Sukla

--

What is Selenium?

Selenium is a webdriver: it takes control of your browser, which then does all the work. Hence what the website “sees” is Chrome or Firefox or IE; it does not see Python or Selenium. That makes it a lot harder for the website to tell your bot from a human being.

Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

results.description:
***NOTE*** This group is currently full and we are not accepting any new players.


INTRODUCTION:

Until just days ago, most members of our party were blissfully unaware of the Keys of Power and their creator, the Aramago. The suddenly, they were tasked with ferrying one of these mysterious items and the courier carrying it to somewhere it would be safe.


They learned quickly that numerous were those with interest in what they possessed. Their mission was immediately fraught with danger and the party was running for its life. Then, just as quickly as it had started, it was over. The adventurers became separated from many in their group including Melrick, the wizard that had hired them to protect his journey.


They passed through an alien realm they soon became certain was the dark realm known as the Shadowfell. Their stay on the plane of shadow was short-lived, however, and they soon found themselves back in the natural world. But they were very far from home and a number of their comrades were not with them.


What will Robin, Meline, Trask, Poe, Zyle, and Malako do now? Do they try to reunite with their mates and finish their mission? If so, how will they go about finding them? These are questions they all ponder and one of their number does so along with the realization that they’ve arrived at his homeland. A homeland he had left nearly two decades prior swearing to only return when he had made his fortune.


BACKGROUND:

“In Pursuit of Power" is one of two, biweekly games I am running in the Central Jersey D&D MeetUp group under the banner of “Adventures in Azocar”. It meets on the first and third Thursdays of each month. We may also have additional meetings if there’s a fifth Monday in any given month but mostly, this will probably be kept open for make-up games.


I am looking for a group of players willing to commit to the schedule I propose; players whose attendance will not be an issue. These players also need to be ready to be involved in a long-running game. This game will run in parallel with the 

“Keeper of the Keys” game with my hope being both groups can meet for a massive gaming session every now and again.
results.name: In Pursuit of Power - An Azocar Adventure

results.description:
Dear Grassroots Alliance Members,

Please join us for a special NYC Grassroots Alliance event  "BREAK FREE NEW YORK: A FORUM ON FOSSIL FUEL RESISTANCE" and also invite others to attend.  This is a great event for people who are looking for how to get involved in climate action.

This April 4th Forum will provide you with all the information you need to take back to your communities and organizations to help mobilize for  "Break Free New York" on May 14th.   

On May 14th 2016, people from all over the NE will converge on Albany to take a stand against fossil fuel extraction and to demand a halt to “bomb trains” and the build out of infrastructure for fracked gas: <a>www.albany2016.org.</a>

The May 14th Break Free action in Albany will be both a mass rally that we hope will engage a wide range of concerned citizens, and also a mass invitation to non-violent civil disobedience, for those who are ready to be arrested to drive home the message that we must STOP the use of fossil fuels now.

Come and find out what is planned for the day in Albany and how to get involved.  Speakers:
Marilyn Vasta, 350NYC
Kim Fraczek, Sane Energy Project
Jeremy Cherson, Hudson Riverkeeper
Gary Shaw, Indian Point Safe Energy Coalition.

The Albany event is part of a global action to Break Free from fossil fuels.  Find out more about USA and global actions at www.breakfree2016.org   Join the global wave of resistance to keep coal, oil, and gas in the ground. 

RSVP on Meetup

NYC GRASSROOTS ALLIANCE INFO:

We prefer not to take time out of the meetings for event announcements. If you have an event coming up, please CREATE AN EVENT HERE AT THE MEETUP SITE, or bring flyers for the literature table.

In order to be added to the listserv (which is separate from this meetup) or gain permission to post events on this meetup, you must attend at least one meeting in person and represent a group that hosts events of interest. Non-relevant or commercial events will be deleted at the discretion of the group organizers.
results.how_to_find_us: Social Room, basement
results.name: Grassroots Alliance Forum: Break Free New York

results.description:
In this course, we will build an ASP.NET Core application from scratch. Along the way we will learn about middleware, controllers, views, and models. We'll support SQL Server using the Entity Framework and user registration with the Identity Framework. We'll also see novel techniques for working with front end frameworks like Bootstrap and JavaScript libraries like jQuery. By the end of the course, you'll have everything you need to start building applications with the ASP.NET Core framework.

About the Author: Scott has worked on everything from 8-bit embedded devices to large scale web sites during his 15+ years in commercial software development. Since 2001, Scott has focused on server-side and web technologies, like ASP.NET, ASP.NET AJAX, Windows Workflow, Silverlight, and LINQ. Scott is also a speaker at national conferences like VSLive!, as well as code camps and user groups near his hometown of Hagerstown, MD.

Scott has been recognized as a Microsoft MVP since 2005, and has written or co-authored several books on Microsoft technologies. Scott founded the site OdeToCode.com in 2004, and joined Pluralsight in 2007.
results.name: ASP.NET Core 1.0 Fundamentals Week 1 of 5

results.description:
Seven  years ago, the first meetup of Wired New York Group took place. There have been over 2,000,000 meetups since then. Most of them have been partially brilliant. Some have been entirely adequate. And now ArtForward has grown to more than 5,000 members. And Wired New York Group has grown to about 1,700 amazing members. So true!

This event is to celebrate the Meetup groups, and the birthdays of organizers Edward & Andru. And they're thirsty, like every Monday! So a biergarten celebration is in order. Spritzenhaus has beverages and food and a fireplace. There's vegetarian options, too. Something for everyone!


http://www.spritzenhaus33.com/. Although this place is in Greenpoint, it's a very quick walk from the L-train stop at Bedford Avenue, or jump on the B-62 bus.

No discussions of art, sculpture, photography, music, or prose will be tolerated! Here are the wolves that will come to eat you if you don't show up at the Spritzenhaus!
results.name: Celebrate Pisces Birthdays & the 7th Anniversary of Wired NY

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

    facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:

results.description:
Please join us for a special NYC Grassroots Alliance event: "BREAK FREE NEW YORK: A FORUM ON FOSSIL FUEL RESISTANCE". This is a great event for people who are looking for how to get involved in climate action so invite others to attend & help spread the word.

This April 4th Forum will provide you with all the information you need to take back to your communities and organizations to help mobilize for "Break Free New York" on May 14th. On May 14th 2016, people from all over the NE will converge on Albany to take a stand against fossil fuel extraction and to demand a halt to “bomb trains” and the build out of infrastructure for fracked gas: www.albany2016.org.

The May 14th Break Free action in Albany will be both a mass rally that we hope will engage a wide range of concerned citizens, and also a mass invitation to non-violent civil disobedience, for those who are ready to be arrested to drive home the message that we must STOP the use of fossil fuels now.

Come and find out what is planned for the day in Albany and how to get involved.
Speakers:
Marilyn Vasta, 350NYC
Kim Fraczek, Sane Energy Project
Jeremy Cherson, Hudson Riverkeeper
Gary Shaw, Indian Point Safe Energy Coalition.

The Albany event is part of a global action to Break Free from fossil fuels. Find out more about USA and global actions at www.breakfree2016.org Join the global wave of resistance to keep coal, oil, and gas in the ground. RSVP on Meetup
results.name: BREAK FREE NEW YORK: A FORUM ON FOSSIL FUEL RESISTANCE

results.description:
Join us for dinner at the Whole Foods in Jericho on the first Monday of every month at 6:30 pm. What a great way to start off the week!

This VLI gathering is a casual event. Show up at 6:30, or later than that. It's fine to drop in when you can. The store closes at 10.

The food bar is vegan-friendly (vegan items are clearly labeled, ingredients are listed).  You pay by the weight of your food. (A typical total is $10-11.) Please fill your bowl with vegan fare and skip the non-vegan stuff, in keeping with VLI event guidelines. Thank you!

(At VLI meetups, the food is always vegan, and everyone is treated with kindness. In other words, we expect everyone to enjoy a vegan meal together, even if you or your guests don't think of yourselves as vegan yet.)

Want to go greener? Whole Foods offers durable bowls, but not durable utensils. So you might bring utensils for yourself. You could bring your own water bottle, too.

RSVPs: even though this gathering is more casual than other restaurant outings, we still ask that you keep your RSVP up-to-date. That way, we know whom to expect & how many seats to save. Thanks!

Hope to see you!
