results.description:
MY DEAR FRIENDS, DUE TO THE BIG RESPONSE TO OUR FIRST MEETING, I WAS FORCED TO FIND ANOTHER PLACE THAT WOULD ACCOMMODATE ALL WHO WANT TO COME!  I WAS FORTUNATE ENOUGH TO FIND THIS CONVENIENT PLACE BUT THEY WERE BOOKED FOR TUESDAY NIGHTS.  SO MONDAYS IT IS!

PLEASE, FORGIVE THE INCONVENIENCE BUT I DID NOT WANT TO TURN AWAY ANYBODY.  I HOPE YOU CAN STILL COME AND FIND YOUR PEACE!

Come and relax and allow the energies of your silence bathe your body and mind with peace! Based on Chopra's teachings and meditation techniques, we will introduce one main thought or intention for the evening, and will suggest mindful ways to incorporate that centering thought into our daily everyday life. Then we will sit in meditation for about 20 minutes.
I will give a very simple introduction to the practice of meditation and very easy to follow instructions that will guide you into an effortless practice. So if you are new, you will fit right in with the group, and if you are an experienced meditator come, learn something new or refresh something you have not experienced for a while and enjoy the energy of the group as it takes you into deeper levels of stillness. Meditation as we will practice it, will train you into more focus and clarity so that you have more choices in your life. It will lead you to be less reactive and more active into what happens in your world. It will provide the "spaciousness" from which you can make better, healthier, happier choices. Meditation is a basic tool to a happier more creative life and when it is paired with the intention to mindfully install new habits and behaviors patterns in how you think and act, your life becomes a much more pleasurable one. Happiness or joy becomes the overriding force of your life no matter what. Come and try it!
A $10 contribution is encouraged but not required. Nobody is turned away.
results.how_to_find_us: 123 4th Ave. 2nd Floor. Two blocks south of UNION SQUARE.

results.description:
Meeting Agenda: We have reserved the room starting 6:30 pm. Discussion about this month's  book will begin promptly at 7:00.  Please come early if you would like eat and socialize first. You are welcome to attend even if you have not read the book.

Dues: please remember to bring $1 for dues, so we can maintain the meetup.com site, thank you!

Book Notes: Notes will be provided by Barbara/Nora, who nominated the book.



Book Description:

From GoodReads.com

In this bestselling and “charming debut” (People) from one of Sweden’s most successful authors, a grumpy yet loveable man finds his solitary world turned on its head when a boisterous young family moves in next door.

Meet Ove. He’s a curmudgeon—the kind of man who points at people he dislikes as if they were burglars caught outside his bedroom window. He has staunch principles, strict routines, and a short fuse. People call him “the bitter neighbor from hell.” But must Ove be bitter just because he doesn’t walk around with a smile plastered to his face all the time?

Behind the cranky exterior there is a story and a sadness. So when one November morning a chatty young couple with two chatty young daughters move in next door and accidentally flatten Ove’s mailbox, it is the lead-in to a comical and heartwarming tale of unkempt cats, unexpected friendship, and the ancient art of backing up a U-Haul. All of which will change one cranky old man and a local residents’ association to their very foundations.

Book Details:

Paperback: 337 pages
Published: May 5th 2015 by Washington Square Press
(first published August 27th 2012)
Original Title: En man som heter Ove

The University of Wisconsin cartography team is joining GeoNYC and The New School to share a sampling of the many approaches Wisconsin take to mapping. In this whirlwind tour, you'll visit how to run a creative space, herd migration, automate pattern recognition, and manage clients. All with maps that glimpse our creative spaces. Come listen and collaborate with the talented and determined UW students that actively participate in the varied world of cartography. This event is being presented in partnership with the Studley Graduate Program in International Affairs at The New School.

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Monday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  This group meets at the dining tables directly in front of the bowling lanes. There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

results.name: Monday Night Board Games at Dave & Buster's!

venue.name: Rosicrucian Cultural Center of New York City

results.description:
Practicing Mindfulness in the City -  The city of New York has an energy unlike any other. Perhaps you live here  or maybe you are visiting for a few days. What do you see, sense, hear, feel as you walk the streets, ride the bus or train, visit the parks, enter large buildings, tour the many historical landmarks? Are you taking notice  of the people around you?  How are you interacting with them?  Are you noticing their interactions, their transactions? Besides what you do here, who are you being while you are here? 

Mindfulness  is "...the energy of attention. It is the capacity  in each of us to  be present one hundred per cent to what is happening within and around us." (Thich Nhat Hanh).

In this week's series, we will  talk about what mindfulness means to us and how we can build  more of this energy into our daily lives. Each day we will practice mindfulness exercises in the session and in the city and will  discuss the contribution this process brings to our lives.

Each session will take place between 6:30 and 7:30 pm each evening

This workshop is designed and facilitated by Human and Organization Development Specialist and Certified Life Coach, Soror Patricia Downes who will take participants on a transformative journey. 

The workshop will include questionnaires, mini lectures, individual and group exercises, meditations and large group discussions.
results.name: Practicing Mindfulness in the City

results.description:
Beyond Faith is a support group for young people under 30 who are currently, or have in the past, gone through the often difficult process of leaving Christianity. Beyond Faith is for the person who doesn't quite fit in with the pack, a person whose ideals and beliefs do not jive with their peers, family members, or loved ones. This can be a tough journey, especially for those whose family and friends are unsupportive of their doubts and lack of belief. Our group aims to create a safe space of support, community, inclusiveness, and encouragement on this journey away from Christianity and towards a reason-based worldview. For some, just the idea of entertaining serious doubts about faith can be dangerous and overwhelming, and Beyond Faith seeks to ease the process and create a warm, welcoming and optimistic environment for like-minded folks on the same path.


Beyond Faith is open to any young people who identify as atheist, agnostic, Humanist, or who are having doubts about Christianity. We are open to any and all denominations of Christianity. Beyond Faith is a safe space for women, people of color, LGBTQ people, and those who are differently-abled. Because of this, the facilitators and participants of this group will be expected to keep member identities, meeting locations, and content confidential to protect everyone involved.

In order to ensure the confidentiality and safety of our group members, please email [masked] with the following questionnaire for the location details.


New Member Questionnaire:
In an effort to ensure all members of this group are respectful and open to others, we ask that you fill out this short questionnaire so the organizers can tailor the group to its members. We have a zero-tolerance policy for evangelism at our meetings; people attending for the sake of evangelizing will be asked to leave. We do this in an effort to protect our members and ensure that our group is a safe space for all attendees.

This is NOT an application, all serious members will be invited regardless of answers to the questions below.

1. Why are you interested in Beyond Faith?

2. Can you tell us a little about yourself (including name/age/where you're from), and how your experiences have brought you the point you're at now? [You only need to share as much as you are comfortable with]

3. Do you define yourself as any/all of the following: atheist, agnostic, humanist, nontheist, or any other term?

4. Where would you consider yourself on your journey out of Christianity and into atheism/agnosticism/nontheism/etc?

 

Please feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions. You are welcome and encouraged to bring friends and family members that you think may benefit from this group as well. We look forward to having you!

 

As there is limited space, we ask that you only attend if you are under the age of 30. If, however, you are older than 30 and are very interested in attending, or have attended our discussions in the past, please send us a private message and we may be able to work something out.
results.name: Beyond Faith: An Ex-Christian Student Support Group

A Screenwriting Workshop With Award Winning Screenwriter Jacob Krueger

Whether you’re a young writer picking up the pen for the first time, or an old pro looking to inject new life into your writing, this exciting eight week workshop will teach you a whole new way of looking at the fundamentals, and help you integrate your artistic goals into your real world life. results.description:
Since its loss 100 years ago, the wreck of Titanic has captured the fascination of people worldwide. In 2005, Kohler explored the iconic shipwreck looking for clues to explain the tragic sinking. The search for answers led Kohler to dive on Titanic's sister Britannic, which in a strange twist of fate, also sank surrounded in mystery. Kohler has spent the last decade unraveling the final Mystery of the Last Olympian.

About the Speaker:

Richie Kohler’s passion for maritime history has led him to explore some of the most challenging shipwrecks in the world, but it would be the identification of a mystery WWII German U-Boat detailed in the best-selling book Shadow Divers by Robert Kurson that catapulted his diving career into the world of television and documentary filmmaking. Kohler co-hosted the long running History Channel series, Deep Sea Detectives, and worked on film projects for Paramount Pictures, CBS, PBS, National Geographic the Discovery Channel and Universal Studios. In 2005, he headed an expedition to the world's most famous shipwreck, RMS Titanic, and most recently Kohler joined legendary underwater explorer Dr. Bob Ballard aboard his research ship, EV Nautilus, documenting deep water shipwrecks in the Gulf of Mexico. This work was featured in the National Geographic/NOVA documentary film, Nazi Attack on America.

Kohler led his first expedition to HMHS Britannic for the History Channel in 2006 and returned again in 2009 on the National Geographic team. In the summer of 2015, Kohler returned to the HMHS Britannic leading an Explorers Club flag expedition and working with the Russian Geographical Society, successfully solved one of the mysteries surrounding the great ship's loss.

Richie will be signing copies of his new book, Mystery of the Last Olympian, after his presentation. He may have limited copies to sell on-hand; we suggest you purchase a copy in advance here  http://www.mysteryofthelastolympian.com/ if you want to make sure you have a copy for him to sign.

Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

results.description:
In this workshop, you'll start with a working prototype of an Internet-connected device. You will learn how to modify it to do something cool. Monitor the weather. Track your dog. Turn the lights on from miles away. Chances are, you've heard the buzzword "Internet of Things". Is it a revolution, just hype, or somewhere in between? Once you know some of the technologies involved, and understand their capabilities and limitations, you'll decide for yourself.

Topics discussed:
Arduino and "open hardware"
The cell-phone network, GSM
Satellite communication, GPS
Node.js and Express
Ubuntu Linux on Amazon Web Services
Finding resources. Open source, well-documented examples which help you with your project

You will get:
A SIM card with one month of messaging service from THINGCONNECT.
An experience hacking and modifying an IoT demo.
Coffee and doughnuts from The Donut Pub to fuel our exploration.

Prerequisites:
Participants need to bring a computer with the following installed:
The Aruino IDE
An SSH client

The kit:
We will use a pre-assembled kit; purchase is optional. The kit contains the following:
Adafruit FONA808 GSM+GPS module
Passive GPS Antenna
GSM/Cellular Quad-Band Antenna
Adafruit Metro Mini Arduino-compatible microcontroller
1200mAh battery
USB cable - A/MicroB to program and charge the kit
"Full-Sized" 830-tie-point breadboard
Pelican 1060 waterproof case

Workshop cost: $25

Purchase of preassembled kit (optional): $115
results.name: Learn how to build an an internet-connected device.

This Meetup is full, waiting list is open.

Note: Soirées cinéma are for members only!

C'est un film très original et comique.

"LES FEMMES DU 6e ETAGE" (Women on the 6th floor) 2010 Comédie

Réalisateur : Philippe Le Guay


Avec Fabrice Luchini, Sandrine Kiberlain, Natalia Verbeke 

Genre Comédie

Nationalité Français

Sypnosis

Paris, années 60. Jean-Louis Joubert, agent de change rigoureux et père de famille « coincé », découvre qu’une joyeuse cohorte de bonnes espagnoles vit... au sixième étage de son immeuble bourgeois. Maria, la jeune femme qui travaille sous son toit, lui fait découvrir un univers exubérant et folklorique à l’opposé des manières et de l’austérité de son milieu. Touché par ces femmes pleines de vie, il se laisse aller et goûte avec émotion aux plaisirs simples pour la première fois. Mais peut-on vraiment changer de vie à 45 ans ?

Storyline

Paris, in the early 1960s. Jean-Louis Joubert is a serious but uptight stockbroker, married to Suzanne, a starchy class-conscious woman and father of two arrogant teenage boys, currently in a boarding school. The affluent man lives a steady yet boring life. At least until, due to fortuitous circumstances, Maria, the charming new maid at the service of Jean-Louis' family, makes him discover the servants' quarter on the sixth floor of the luxury building he owns and lives in. There live a crowd of lively Spanish maids who will help Jean-Louis to open to a new civilization and a new approach of life. In their company - and more precisely in the company of beautiful Maria - Jean-Louis will gradually become another man, a better man.


<a href="http://www.allocine.fr/films/pays-5001/"></a>

I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at Think Coffee to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person if more than 3 people come to the class and $15/person if 1 to 3 people come to the class.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.

results.description:
Wall Street Share employs a unique model in which we vet private companies, accept promising ventures into our office space, and seek to provide such companies with access to resources that they may otherwise be unable to attain.  Since our inception last year, we have moved 8 companies into the space, invested in 3 of them and provided all of them with valuable introductions and strategic advice.  Please see our website for more information on Wall Street Share – http://www.wallstreetshare.com


We have hosted five meetups thus far, and it’s given us an opportunity to meet and provide advice to some very interesting and creative companies.  Unlike many other meetups, our events take place in an intimate setting in our offices.  It’s an informal forum in which attendees take turns introducing themselves and discussing their business ventures.  We try to make useful suggestions and other attendees frequently provide helpful advice as well.

Our next meetup will take place on Monday, April 4.  Please RSVP and try to be there by 7:00 P.M. if you plan to attend.

We look forward to seeing you!

results.description:
Dev Bootcamp hosts and evening of lightning talks and demos by graduates of many NYC coding bootcamps. The coding bootcamp community in New York City is robust and growing every day. Thousands of people have graduated from coding bootcamps and joined the tech industry in New York City. 


Bootcamp graduates work as developers in a wide range of companies, on many different projects, and in a variety of languages. Join us for illuminating and engaging talks and networking with bootcamp graduates from different programs throughout New York City.

The evening will feature 10 minute talks by: 

Jeff George, Dev Bootcamp, who will discuss drop-in Stylesheets for MVPs. Jeff is a recent Dev Bootcamp grad who has worked as a commercial photographer, elementary teacher, and tropical fish breeder. He's currently developing a web app that make teachers' lives easier.

Stephanie Reaves, Dev Bootcamp, developer at Human Condition Global who will discuss her app Nina, which helps freelancers manage their taxes. 

Fiona Conn, App Academy, a former Nantechnology Phd student, who will discuss her app Happy Camper, an app for finding out about coding bootcamp graduates and the jobs they get after graduation. Currently working at Medidata Solutions, Inc.

Gary Bethea, App Academy, will discuss how Chicory architected their self-managed data ingestion and analytics engine, and how we made the decision to transition away from managed service solutions. Gary studied studied international relations and Chinese and taught English as a foreign language in China. 

Aneury Casado, Fullstack Academy, and software engineer at Moat will discuss a a Chrome extension that hides all the HTML on a page. He was a Business major at Carnegie Mellon University with a specialization in Technology and minor in HumanComputer Interactions.

And more to come!

results.description:
What Do You Believe?

Sura 16 Aya 35

Those who ascribe divinity to other than God say: “Had God so willed we would not have served anything other than Him—neither we nor our forefathers; nor would we have forbidden anything without His sanction.”

Thus also said those who went before them. Yet what is the mission of messengers except to communicate clearly.

This aya addresses four questions that deeply impact everyone’s life:

(1) What do you believe about God?

(2) How do you relate to what you have been taught by the previous generation?

(3) How do you decide what you can or cannot do; i.e., what prohibitions are important?

(4) What is the role of a teacher?

These questions will be discussed in our meeting.

You are welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the meeting.


Our discussions are based on the book 'The Quran and The Life of Excellence.'

  Notice: The attendees will be requested to contribute $ 5 each to help with the cost of renting the meeting room.
results.name: Quran Discussion in Manhattan--What Do You Believe?

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there.
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
A small-group dinner this time—six guys, four wines. 

Australian wine, in the minds of most wine drinkers, is synonymous with the products of the southeastern Australian states: South Australia, Victoria, New South Wales.  And the famous appellations within: Barossa, McLaren Vale, Clare Valley, Hunter Valley, among others.  But two thousand miles to the west lies one of Australia’s best and least-known winemaking regions:  Western Australia. 

Western Australia is the largest of the Australian States—bigger than Texas and Alaska combined.  The northwestern corner of the state is Australia’s hottest region (with temperatures up to 123°F recorded), but viticulture is concentrated in the temperate southwestern corner, which is cooled by the Indian Ocean to the west and the Antarctic Ocean to the south.  The climate here is often compared to Bordeaux, and the wines produced here are often considered more Old World in style compared to their southeastern Australian counterparts.

The center of Western Australia’s wine production was once Swan Valley, to the north of Perth.  Not unlike California’s Central Valley, this is a hot, dry region that lends itself to high-yielding vines and bulk wine production.  But now the focus is on Western Australia’s cooler, more southerly regions, in particular Margaret River and Frankland.  Western Australian winemaking now emphasizes quality over quantity.  Although only 3 percent of Australia’s wines come from here, Western Australia represents 20 percent of the Australian premium wine market, with much of the wine made by small-scale boutique producers.

The Margaret River region is a squared off peninsula jutting westward into the Indian Ocean.  The maritime climate and the granite ridge running through the region contribute to the complexity of Margaret River wines, the Cabernets and Cabernet blends often compared to Bordeaux.  Ageworthy Chardonnays are also made here, and the one made by Leeuwin Estate (which we will be trying) is generally considered Australia’s best.  Also highly reputed are Sauvignon Blanc/Semillon blends (another nod to Bordeaux), as well as Shirazes that in this cool climate achieve more elegance than the stereotypical Australian Shiraz fruit bomb.  We’ll be trying the Shiraz made by Leeuwin Estate, as well as the Cabernet made by Vasse Felix, the founding wine estate of Margaret River.

More than 100 miles to the east of Margaret River is the Frankland River region, the most prolific of the southern regions.  The usual variety of grapes are grown here—Shiraz, Chardonnay, Cabernet—but in this cool, continental climate Riesling particularly excels.  Frankland Estate is the leading producer in the region, and we will be trying their benchmark Isolation Ridge Riesling. 

We’ll be meeting at Flinders Lane in the East Village, a small Australian restaurant with an interesting Asian-influenced menu.  They have a round table that can accommodate six.


http://www.flinderslane-nyc.com/

2013 Frankland Estate Riesling Isolation Ridge (Frankland)  $37

Wine Advocate 92 – The 2013 Isolation Ridge Riesling opens with notes of freshly squeezed limes, orange blossoms and clover honey marked by hints of crushed stones and coriander seed. Light-bodied, dry and showing a great backbone of racy acidity, it finishes long and zesty. Drink it now to 2023+.

2012 Leeuwin Estate Chardonnay Art Series (Margaret River)  $69

Wine Spectator 94 – Amazingly focused, layered and expressive, with pear, lime, guava and floral flavors that meld harmoniously and linger on the creamy finish. Deftly pulls all the elements together into a cohesive whole, lingering effectively and precisely. Drink now through 2022.

Jancis Robinson 17.5/20 – Quite rich and ambitious on the nose. Pretty Burgundian really. Spicy nose. Lots of substance and lots of acidity. A really long-term player - but it no longer has the field to itself! 

2012 Vasse Felix Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)  $38

Jancis Robinson 17+/20 – 94% Cabernet Sauvignon, 6% Malbec. Dark, rich fruit, leafy and savoury. Great intensity and refined if (as yet) grainy tannins. A touch smoky, dry, with finely textured length.  Muscular and red fruits. Racy and delicate. Lots of energy. 

2011 Leeuwin Estate Shiraz Art Series (Margaret River)  $29

Wine Advocate 90+ – Deep garnet-purple colored, the 2011 Art Series Shiraz has a pretty perfume of crushed cherries, black raspberries and roses with hints of star anise, Szechuan pepper and smoky bacon. Medium-bodied with plenty of juicy black fruit flavors and complimentary spices, it has a medium level of rounded tannins and just enough acid, finishing long.

Tanzer 91 – Youthful purple color.  Vibrant dark berry, floral and cracked pepper scents are given an exotic twist by notes of patchouli and candied violet.  Supple and gently sweet, offering juicy blackberry and floral pastille flavors and a touch of olive; in an elegant style, with no excess weight.  Finishes with a kick of peppery spices, smooth tannins and repeating floral and berry notes.
results.name: Western Australia

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
and 12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
Back By Popular Demand:  We are headed to Veganized Pagani!

This italian hotspot LOVED having a restaurant full of vegans and wants to have us back again...and again...and again...(They want to do this EVERY month!) 

We worked hands on with the kitchen for 3 weeks to teach the staff how to turn their menu 100% vegan and the first event got rave reviews. Now we want to invite all those who didn't have a chance to come out the first time!

The dishes are your classic pasta and meat dishes. We've done our best to make even BETTER vegan versions of each dish, including a cashew cheese plate :)

This is our chance to encourage Pagani to make this part of their everyday menu! 

• There is NO entrance fee for this event, however there is limited seating and RESERVATION is required :)

• Call[masked] to make a reservation using CODE WORD: "Veganizer"


About Veganizer:

Veganizer takes each restaurant's menu and serves it exactly as is on the evening of the event, however, it is in vegan form. Veganizer works one on one with the Executive Chef to create a mouth watering one time experience like no other. These events sell out fast because NYC is craving new and healthy cuisine outside of the traditional restaurants that we all know and love. 

About Pagani:

Pagani is an italian hot spot loved by many. The cuisine is italian inspired by Executive Chef Mark Barrett. The menu is very meat and fish centric which exotic sauces. 

About Chef Hadara:

Chef Hadara has a resume longer than most and Veganizer is thrilled to be doing their first event collaboration. She has traveled throughout the entire US as a chef and consultant. Her recipes can be found in Whole Foods, TGIF Fridays and more. Her favorite cuisine is Mexican as she has spent much time studying Latin cuisines. She is also the founder of Rawclates, the raw, organic and vegan premium chocolate company. She is a mother and entreprenuer and anyone who tries her cuisine will love every bite. 

About The Food and Drinks:

Here is the official ALLERGEN STATEMENT for all Veganizer events! 

On the night of the event, here is the menu that will be #OfficiallyVeganized. The food is A La Cart! 

Pagani is a stylish restaurant with a sheek and vintage look.

Some of Chef Hadara's Dishes
results.how_to_find_us: Bleecker and 7th Ave! Take the 1 train to A,C,E to West 4th Street Stop.
results.name: Pagani Goes Vegan...Again, and you're Invited!

results.description:
Tele-Summit. Free online with 18+ Experts interviewed on Breakup/Divorce topics

Tune into my interview on “Healing and Becoming Emotionally Available Again.” which is on April 10.  I join 18 + experts for what to consider when going through a breakup or divorce - or whether to stay in the relationship. (The direct link for registration is below)

We have all experienced disappointment, hurt and heartache which causes us to shut down our hearts. I’ll share valuable insights and techniques on healing and becoming emotionally available again  - to yourself and a potential new relationship when you are ready. Plus, I will be giving  away 3 valuable gifts which can help the process move forward even quicker!

The tele-summit starts April 4 and continues with Expert interviews for approximately 9 days - with 2  interviews a day. If you miss one, you will have a several days to listen to the recordings. 

TO REGISTER:

1, RSVP on our meet up group. Click YES for RSVP.

2. Then click this link     Registration link for tele-summit

Again. my interview on "Healing and Becoming Emotionally Available Again," is on Sunday April 10!!

It’s that simple!  Also, if you know anyone who is considering leaving a relationship or is going through a breakup/divorce - then pass along this information. It will be helpful for them as well!

results.description:
We will be discussing the contents of The World Peace Diet, Chapters 9 and 10: 

• Chapter 9: Reductionist Science and Religion

“There is no religion without love, and people may talk as much as they like about their religion, but if it does not teach them to be good and kind to beasts as well as man, it is all a sham.”—Anna Sewell, Black Beauty.

• Chapter 10: The Dilemma of Work

“When a human kills an animal for food, he is neglecting his own hunger for justice. Man prays for mercy, but is unwilling to extend it to others.” —Isaac Bashevis Singer

The World Peace Diet provides a transformative perspective on the multiple consequences of the food choices we make (or are made for us)—not just in terms of personal physical health, but also environmental health, cultural, economic, ethical and spiritual well-being too.

If you have read the book, this study group will be a good forum for sharing sections that meant something to you, changed the way you perceive the world or the way you interact with the world,

If you have not read the book but are an ethical and environmentally compassionate individual, and would like to explore ways to live more in alignment with your values, I think you will enjoy the discussion and be a valuable contributor.

Remaining chapters will be discussed in the following weeks.
results.name: Let's discuss The World Peace Diet - Chapters 9 & 10

results.description:
Help make freeganism happen in NYC! After brief report-backs on ongoing projects, we will have an open, facilitated discussion on a topic of freegan interest. Bring your ideas and opinions and let's talk! We welcome both those with experience taking part in non-hierarchical consensus-based groups and those participating for the first time. At 9pm, we will end our business meeting and have a brief, newcomer-friendly discussion about freeganism before the trash tour. The meeting is NOT open to media.

Newcomers are always welcome and encouraged to attend our full meeting, but if you ONLY want an introduction to freeganism and to dumpster dive, DON'T sign up for this meeting! See the next one (Freeganism 101 and Trash Tour, later the same evening).

If you arrive at an event and cannot find us, call Janet at (347)[masked]

Welcome to our weekly group meditation. Whether you are new to meditation or have been practicing for years, please join us!

Agenda: 

We will start with some simple exercises, followed by a guided meditation called the Twin Hearts Meditation. After the meditation, an optional Basic Pranic Healing session is offered followed by Q&A and discussion. 

The session is by donation and a minimum of $10 is suggested. These donations will go toward paying for the room and supplies. If you truly cannot afford to contribute, join us anyway.

Please be sure to RSVP. Looking forward to seeing you all there!

results.name: Twin Hearts Meditation and Introduction to Pranic Healing

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Biologically, reptiles don't have complex emotions related to bonding or affection. However, there are some behaviors that us humans might read as affection.

Are there any behaviors you've experienced that make you feel like your cold-blooded scale-y pets are affectionate? Is there anything they do that's just plain cute? If not, what attracts you to reptiles and amphibians?

Cute reptile photos highly encouraged
results.name: Discussion: How humans perceive affection in reptiles

results.description:
YOGA FOR THE NON-YOGIC, ANYONE? Riverstone Yoga will generously host a very gentle fortnightly yoga class series for our group on 3/21, 4/4, 4/18, and 5/2 at 7:30 PM. Price is $25 per class; 4-class series is $100. Please RSVP if you can make it so that we have an accurate count!


*******

Something new! We'll be trying out a runner's yoga class to complement our running routine. The focus will be on core strengthening and stretching -- both for injury prevention and to work muscles groups that are unused or underused when running. 

CLOTHING/EQUIPMENT: Wear clothes that allow for movement. Bring a water bottle and a mat if you have one; if not the studio supplies mats for a fee. 

DIRECTIONS TO THE STUDIO: The studio is located in the Hudson Harbor sales office building across from the Tarrytown Metro-North train station on the river side of the train tracks. Drive over the tracks, turn left at the top of the bridge, right on West Main, right on Orchard and right into the parking lot. The entrance is on the left. 

FEE: $25 per person
results.name: Yoga for Runners

Playing the rehearsal CD in the car, at home, while doing household duties --- helps imprint the tonal relationships in the brain and ear, so your voice knows where to go and when. For when you don't have time to sit down and follow the score visually, it DOES help... subliminal training.

VISITORS: TENOR and BASS voices are needed to balance our strong alto and soprano sections. We have a wonderful fun group of men here at TRS! While it is too late to join up for this spring 2016 season, singers are invited to COME SAMPLE A REHEARSAL anytime... if you enjoy, you can sing in the next singing season (two concerts a year: Sept-Dec, and Jan-May). 

For more information, send a message to Linda D; click on PAGES tab above, and "About Us" at top of lefthand column.

Please: No scented products of any kind (allergies).

Join us for Monday evening inspiration! We'll share a writing prompt and refreshments at Cuppa Pulp Writers' Space. Led by Donna Miele or Writing Beyond the Basic's Jean Marie Donnelly. 

Evening write! easily accommodates both poetry or prose, but we do try to gear prompts toward helping writers explore elements of longer-term projects, most often character development, setting development, and narrative voice. Discussion often incorporates, naturally, other issues we face when working on longer pieces.

We will continue to schedule Monday evening write! regardless of attendance, but will cancel if less than three writers have RSVP'd. (That means that if it's just going to be the leader and one other writer, we will cancel.) So don't forget to RSVP at least one day in advance if you intend to come!

See detailed directions here. Hope to see you!

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

The evening will begin promptly at 7:00 pm. Please be punctual and check-in prior to 7 pm in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Community Circling Practice Night will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6:30-7:15 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7:30-10:30 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

November 2  Beginners 6:30, Everyone else 7:30
November 9  Experienced Circlers only  7:30
November 16 -  Beginners 6:30, Everyone else 7:30
November 23 - Experienced Circlers only 7:30
November 30   Community Circling Night - Beginners and Experienced Circlers 7:30-10:30

-------
results.name: Circling Lab - Mondays

results.description:
Christina Whitehead

Photographing the Fifth Dimension

Several times each year Christina takes a group of students to a New Jersey portal and introduces them to inter-dimensional photography.  As a group initiation, the experience attunes each participant to the process of photographing the fifth dimension, that level of being that is all around us, yet remains largely unseen.

The photos of the students, both of the portal and of other places, tell an amazing story of inter-dimensional as well as intergalactic love and support for the people of the earth and for the earth itself.  Christina’s gift of channeling, awakened through dowsing, enables her to be able to describe the images in detail – in other-worldly terms. 

With approximately 100 photos in the presentation, a broad overview of recorded phenomena is both enlightening and challenging.  These are not photos of graveyards or amorphous misty shapes of the fourth dimension.  These are glimpses of the other side and realities beyond our own.

During this 2 hour presentation there will be time for questions and answers.

About: Christina 

Christina Lynn Whited has been channeling for over twenty years.  She first came to national attention when People Magazine discovered that she was receiving advice from the late James Beard for cookbook based upon an intuitive diet she channeled.  Now, with a clientele around the world, she is best known for her work channeling Mother Mary and for Spiritual Detox, including Soul Path Clearance, the work she performs which clears long-held past life pains for her clients. 

A popular speaker on such far ranging topics as Inter-dimensional Photography, Animal Mysticism, Past Lives, Ghosts, Energy Healing, and Dowsing, Whited has spoken at national conventions, at libraries and to community groups, and taught in Adult Education venues.  She recently became the first recipient of the Explore Life in 5D Grant from Growing Consciousness.

She lives in Western New Jersey where she heads The Circle of Intention School of Intuitive Sciences as well as The Church of All Creation.  She can be reached via her website at www.CircleOfIntention.com.
results.how_to_find_us: Find us in the Meeting Rooom
results.name: Photographing the Fifth Dimension-Christina Lynn Whited

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014 

"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2014

“ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

It was enlightening!!! Every time I practice Bodhi meditation, it feels like my Chi increases more and more! Thank you everyone for sharing this to NYC." Javoski (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013)

"Nan emits healing energy -- the meditation is wonderful" Linda (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Very calming and energizing. I did not have any negative thoughts or worries last night in bed like I always do. I felt my mind was clear. I will definitely go to another class" Dee (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

-----------------------------------------------------------------


Thank you all for participating in your Bodhi Meditation class.

Between May 14,2013 and June 2015 over 3,000 people attended our classes in NYC, Westchester and Long Island.


Date: Mondays

Time: 7:30 - 9:00pm

Class Price: FREE

Year 2016 - Monday night schedule

March 28th

April 4th, 11th, 18th, 25th

May 2nd, 9th, 16th, 23rd

June 6th, 13th, 27th

July 11th

August 1st, 8th, 15th, 22nd, 29th

September 12th, 19th, 26th

October 3rd, 24th

November 7th, 14th, 21st, 28th

December 5th

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you. * Increase self-awareness

* Stronger emotional intelligence

* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated

* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America.

Feel free to ask Nan your personal health questions after the class.

Please arrive early for class intro/setup.

Class basic info:

* Loose fitting clothes is recommended but not required.

* Some people bring their own yoga mat for the seated meditation part. This is not a requirement as we have chairs for everyone.

* Cellphones needed to be turned off during the class.

. http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1
results.name: Bodhi Meditation class in Freeport - Monday

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014


"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2014 “ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

It was enlightening!!! Every time I practice Bodhi meditation, it feels like my Chi increases more and more! Thank you everyone for sharing this to NYC." Javoski (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Nan emits healing energy -- the meditation is wonderful" Linda (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) "Very calming and energizing. I did not have any negative thoughts or worries last night in bed like I always do. I felt my mind was clear. I will definitely go to another class" Dee (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 7:30 PM – 9:00 PM

Day: Mondays

Where: Room #102, Freeport Recreation Center

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520

Contact: Nan, [masked]

 -------------------------------------------------------------------


I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

results.description:
http://static1.squarespace.com/static/560aa0ffe4b0d5465decff4e/t/56f00fdb40261d44674899b1/1458573288025/?format=750w

Hi all!


We hope to see you for Mozart's breathtaking Solemn Vespers at world-renowned Carnegie Hall, featuring the Masterworks Festival Chorus, esteemed soloists, and the full forces of the professional New York City Chamber Orchestra, all led by distinguished Guest Conductor Jo-Michael Scheibe on Monday evening, April 4 at 8:00pm.

Mozart's Vesperae Solennes de Confessore was originally composed for liturgical use at Dom du Salzburg, and was his final choral work created for the cathedral. The title "de confessore" was not Mozart's own, and was later added to his manuscript; suggesting that the piece was intended for vespers held on a specific day of the liturgical calendar of saints.

The setting is divided into 6 movements, each reiterating the opening themes, with the first three psalms scored in a bold, exuberant manner, contrasting with the counterpoint of the fourth psalm, and the tranquility of the fifth. The final Magnificat sees a return to the style of the opening settings.

Guest Conductor Jo-Michael Scheibe chairs the Thornton School of Music’s department of choral and sacred music at the University of Southern California. Scheibe has collaborated with leading musicians such as Luciano Pavarotti, Andrea Bocelli, Kenny Loggins, The Rolling Stones, and Sir Elton John, and is in frequent demand nationally and internationally as a clinician, conductor, and adjudicator for choruses.

**Make sure to reserve your spot early for this concert before seats sell out! Tickets are only $7 each, a fantastic discount (value $110 - Parquet seating)! You can purchase your ticket(s) directly on this event page.

Please note: Once you have booked your tickets, they will be available for collection under your full name (the name listed under your PayPal "Buyer Information" in payment not your Meetup name) at the box office at Carnegie Hall as early as 4pm on the day of the performance. Each individual is responsible for picking up his or her own tickets. Everyone from our Meetup group will be seated together. Remember, this is an exclusive club, we ask that you do not contact the box office at Carnegie Hall. Please contact me with any questions regarding your tickets.

Looking forward to enjoying another fantastic concert together!
results.name: Mozart's Solemn Vespers

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and what we have to offer so you can have the sex life and relationships that you really want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at this event are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Guys, This meetup is to talk about the issues we each face. Some of the things that cause a lot of trouble: Problems with the ex. Harm to the children, and how to reduce it. If you have visitation and not custody, there are visitation problems we all deal with. Everyone pays child support. My idea is to kick around our problems and experiences, and see if that helps in dealing with the issues. I have changed the location for the meetup: at TGI Fridays 826 New Jersey 3 Clifton. This is a pretty nice TGI Fridays, and it is easy to get to.

Please come on time, and bring a friend with you. And please be ready to listen as well as ask questions.  This is a bunch of us who have been through it.  It is a good group!

see you then,

Bob Davies

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

results.description:
Do you own your own business? Are you starting a new business? Are you a very seasoned business professional? Do you want to get MOVING on your 2016 Biz-Goals right now?!


No matter what the answer to any of those questions, we have the meeting for you: New Frontier-26 (Manhattan BNI Chapter 26). We are a group of 37 (and growing!) NYC-based top-notch business-owners and business-development professionals who are all committed to helping grow each others' businesses. We launched less than 7 months ago and will be 80 members by August 1st! That's a promise.


Our Motto: Givers Gain.


The more we give to each other, the more the large group gives back to us! We allow one person per professional-classification (e.g. Social-Media expert, SEO, Graphic Designer, Photographer, and tons more) to actually JOIN our group.....but EVERYONE is invited to visit!


You will get the opportunity to stand and give a short under 1-minute commercial that gives the entire group of members and visitors a simple example of what they should be listening for.  And who they know! We typically have about 10 visitors per meeting, so that's an audience of 45-55 people you're talking to before 9am!


Visitors to our meeting typically walk away with any or all of the following:

• Leads/Referrals on possible new deals

• Contacts in professions they didn't know before but needed, and best of all....

• A full stomach! (Our meetings have delicious hot-eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels, yogurt.....and coffee. Lots and lots of coffee!)


We meet every Tuesday morning (except holidays) from 7am - 8:45am here: Sinigual Restaurant
41st and 3rd Ave
(640 Third Ave)
Manhattan New York, NY 10017


Cost: $20 per Visit (cash or credit-card)


When the structured part of the meeting ends at 8:40, there'll be plenty of time to talk to anyone in an "open-networking" ennvironment afterwards!

If you have business-cards, you can pass them around. We recommend bringing a stack of at least 40! But if you don't have business-cards yet....don't worry! The people who you want to talk with and who want to talk with you....you'll get all the opportunity you need.

That's all! If you're ready to get more accomplished on a Tuesday morning than you ever have before, come visit New Frontier-26, the ultimate Manhattan networking group.

(Note: your office or territory does not need to be in Manhattan to attend....ALL professionals)

results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

The BNI Dream Team. 

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

BNI Dream Team is currently looking for these professions to pass a boat load of business to. 

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Florist, Photographer, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, October 20th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

Plenty of Parking, trains: M & R, Grand Ave station

The cost is $15 which includes breakfast.

Please bring 30 business cards to pass out.

STOP LETTING BUSINESS PASS YOU BY AND TAKE ACTION NOW!

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus.

Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.

• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps.

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!

• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show

• A great profile pic

So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Send us a profile picture too, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast on Saturday (soundboxonline.com). Also check out Carl J and ADG presents where you can find all of our mixes back. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.

Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G.

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]

results.description:
Looking to develop speaking and leadership skills? Ace a job interview? Ignite your career? Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Our membership is 280,000 strong. Our members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 13,500 clubs like Bryant Park Toastmasters Club Membership in Manhattan

Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. At Bryant Park Toastmasters we provide a safe environment to overcome fear, try new speaking tactics, or practice that upcoming sales presentation. Visit our website

MEETING TIME: Tuesday, 12:10pm to 1:15pm

VISITORS WELCOME: In order for you visit our club you need to register to this meeting and RSVP with your FULL NAME  AT MOST  SUNDA. Please arrive by Noon to allow extra time for security check-in.

** PHOTO ID a must!!

** Bring your confirmation email from a Bryant Park club member having added you to the security list is a must!! 


A Toastmasters Meeting always for follows the same agenda:

• Opening of the meeting by the president and presentation of the guests


• Welcoming by the Toastmaster of the Day and presentation of the watchtowers


• Speeches and Evaluations (up to 4)


• Club Business


• Table Topics Session - Guest can participate if they want to


• General Evaluation


• Closing of the meeting
results.name: Bryant Park Toastmasters

results.description:
We will do cold readings of plays in progress and short pieces from 1 to 2pm and then from 2 to 3pm -- if you are an actor pressed for time that day, please let me know if 1pm or 2pm works better for you, and I will try to accommodate your needs! I want you to be able to participate with ease. 

At 3pm, we write til 4pm with a prompt. If you are only coming to write, please come by 3pm so we can start on time without interruptions. If you have paid in advance for the workshop, and you can't attend a writing session, the prompt will be sent to your email, so make sure I have your email. If you have a piece to be read, please try to send it to me via email in advance with a character breakdown to help me with casting. 

You are also free to cast your own piece -- you may not cast yourself in your piece. Give yourself the chance to honor your writing by listening to it as a writer. You may know exactly how you want it done, but that doesn't necessarily help you as a writer. Trust me on this, or ask me about it -- I am happy to discuss it with you. You can also bring in a piece and ask to have it read, and we'll read it cold. 

Please check your piece for time! Each writer gets up to ten minutes of material. This usually means ten pages if you write in accepted format with 12 point Courier font and your pages are not full of monologues. Monologues read longer than a minute a page. So time your work. 

Write Now Workshop is free for actors, but writers pay a fee that I am trying to reduce by 1) opening the workshop up to the community for free as a model for creating community and involvement and offering content to seniors who live nearby and 2) using a space that doesn't cost me a fortune (most of the fees are space fees) and 3) applying for funding as we grow and documenting the way the concept works and 4) having the workshop subsidized by patrons of the arts (already happening so that I can offer it at the current rate). 

The writers fees are currently $35 per session or $30 in advance for 9 workshops at $270 payable by cash or check or paypal to [masked]


Thank you!
Emma
results.name: Read Plays, Respond, and Write!

results.description:
THIS EVENT IS SOLD OUT. Registration at csusa.org required: Members: $10
Non-Members: $20
Student: FREE (Email [masked] for your promotional code) As the music industry continues to adapt to new technologies and formats, its traditional business practices and revenue streams have rapidly disappeared. One area that continues to thrive and propel the industry forward, however, is music licensing. Put together by the CSUSA New York Chapter, this panel features Joseph P. Salvo and Stephen J. Dallas, who will provide an overview of music licensing and give insight about the types of deals and terminology used during licensing negotiations.

New York Chapter Brown Bags are informal discussions on a range of copyright-related topics. In true brown-bag spirit, no food or drinks will be provided, so attendees are encouraged to bring their own.
