results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
Important update: We're sorry but we've had a last-minute change in location for this event! There is an Animal Rights Panel at 7:00PM at NYU that we will be attending just after this, so we've moved this event to Washington Square Park in NYC. We're very sorry for the inconvenience!


More info on the Animal Rights Panel can be found here: 

https://www.facebook.com/events/1697734600501007/

You are welcome to join us for chalking/leafleting and attend the panel with us.  Or just join us for one or the other.  

We will meet at 5:30pm in Washington Square Park near the Arch where 5th Avenue meets the North side of the park.  At 6:45pm we will head over to the Animal Rights Panel which is at the NYU Kimmel Center Room 802, located at 60 Washington Square S between Thompson St and LaGuardia Pl.  If you cannot find us, you can call/text organizer Michal at[masked]-4567.  

Join us for an evening of writing chalk messages and leafleting throughout Washington Square Park! 

Chalking


The #veganchalkchallenge presents a great opportunity to speak out. It's simple, can be done almost anywhere, and it's fun. I like thinking of creative, positive, and sometimes witty things to say with chalk.

That said, creativity and artistic skills are not a requirement! We'll have a list of messages prepared to give you some ideas, and if you aren't quite sure what you want to write/draw, you can assist someone else with their message or opt to just hand out leaflets.


While you can write or draw whatever you'd like, the general formula I like to use is:


• Short and sweet

• Keep it positive! 

• Include a clear vegan message ("go vegan" or "choose vegan") and a url that people can reference to learn more

• Animal rights, environmental, or health focus

Leafleting


Leafleting is another super simple, effective way to spread the vegan message. Some activists from Farm Sanctuary and The Humane League completed a survey at two college campuses where Vegan Outreach leaflets had been distributed over the years, and the results revealed that of the 403 students that had received a leaflet during their academic careers, 7 became vegetarian, 50% changed their diet in some way, and about 20% gave their leaflet to a friend who then also changed his/her diet!

While leafleting may seem daunting at first, it is actually very fun and rewarding. The following are some tips to keep in mind:

• Go to an area with heavy foot traffic


• You can say things such as, "Information on helping animals/the environment", "Help animals", "Learn about where your food comes from", "Would you like/did you get one of these?", etc.


• Smile! Sometimes just smiling and saying hello is enough for people to want to take a leaflet


• Extend your arm all the way out to the person

• Hand leaflet so that it’s easy to reach

• Make eye contact

• If you are nervous, feign confidence. Nervousness passes very quickly. 


• If nobody is taking, try a brief pause. People mimic the actions they see others taking.

While you will encounter people who are dismissive, you will also encounter people who are interested and will have the opportunity to engage in positive conversations. Focus on the good that is going to come out of the experience and don't let folks who seem uninterested deter you.


We'll supply the chalk and leaflets, so you don't need to bring anything.

Because we want a good couple of hours before dusk, our official start time is 5:30pm. I realize that might be early for many folks, so it's OK to come whenever you can. I'll post a phone number to the meetup on the day of the event, so you can text me to find us wherever we are.

We'll chalk until it gets dark, which is around 7:30. Then we can optionally grab a vegan bite at a nearby establishment and discuss how awesome our chalk messages were.

If you are not sure you are ready to leaflet and/or chalk, please feel free to still join us and just hang out and learn. Maybe you'll be ready the next time! 

Note: While we welcome all veg types, this event is about promoting veganism, so please remember to advocate for veganism when chalking and/or speaking to others, even if you are not vegan. 

Let's get out there and be voices for animals!

How to find us:

Washington Square Park north side near the Arch at 5:30pm.

NYU Kimmel Center at 60 Washington Square S (btwn Thompson St and LaGuardia Pl) at 6:45pm.
results.name: Vegan Chalk Challenge and Leafleting

results.description:
This event is currently at its maximum and is closed to new players.

From humble beginnings, a handful of lost souls must rise above their misfortune to achieve greatness.

The uncountable islands of the subtropical Korina Archipelago are the sanctuary for many who have fled from the never-ending wars of distant Altamere. That land, where the life of the common man is cheap and reckless kings all-too-often burn their lives, and kingdoms, out in blazes of glory.

The Korina Archipelago is home to several large city-states, each of which views the others as rivals, but generally coexist, for there are greater threats to their safety. Renegade Altameran privateers, depraved nation-less pirates, demon-worshiping cannibals, horrors from the uncharted oceans, and far worse are reminders for the city-states of the constant dangers that exist outside their walls. 

These dangers are all-too-real, and to whom can one turn to in times of desperation and need when threats arise? Each city-state will defend its own, but outside that, help is not easy to come by. Even the enlightened gods favor all, yet they favor none; those whose prayers and sacrifices are the most persuasive bend their ears for a time. The gods are powerful and wise, but fickle they are, too, and to understand their ways is not the way of man.

This is no place for the weak of heart. Salvation comes from strength and strength alone. The strong survive, the weak do not. This is the tale of the rising of heroes, the elevation of men from what they were to what they are, the making of the great from the small, this is the story of ascension.
results.name: Ascension: The Isle of Dread

results.description:
** This game is currently closed to new players.  We have a full house.**

Part I: Servants of the Elder Eye

Following the fall of the Temple of Elemental Evil, peace was restored to the lands of Central Flanaess... for a time. Now, in the wake of the kidnapping of Prince Thrommel of Furyondy, rumors abound of cultists making their way back into the blighted lands surrounding the ruins of The Temple. With these rumors comes a growing sense of paranoia among the people of nearby settlements, and mysterious disappearances and deaths threaten to throw the lands back into chaos.

This 5th Edition D&D game is great for new or experienced players, and will take characters from level 1 to level 10.

The game will be hosted at Barnes & Noble in Edison NJ.  Sessions should run from 6pm until 9:45pm.


Additional resources: 


Guide to Greyhawk - This pdf gives a brief overview of the campaign world, including new subraces and an expanded list of gods and their domains. 

World of Greyhawk - My website for this classic campaign setting. 


Greyhawk Game - My site for the game, once it starts.

Character Generation Guidelines - This explains some of the basics of character creation for the game.
results.name: The World of Greyhawk - Servants of the Elder Eye

results.description:
Isha Kriya Guided Meditation- 

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.

These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful. 

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on your own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.name: Isha Kriya--FREE Meditation

Dear Fellow Entrepreneur,

Taxes are the greatest liability as well as the biggest source of stress for small business owners. Not understanding your taxes could cost you tens of thousands of dollars in over-taxation, penalties, and lost time in case of IRS audits.

Please join us for this workshop with small business tax expert Rachel Michaelov, EA, NTPI Fellow, and understand your tax obligations. This free seminar will benefit established businesses, those getting started and individuals anticipating going into business. 

Some of the topics that will be covered in the workshop are: 


1. Types of Entities and why some are better than others (C Corps, S corps, LLC’s)

2. Best Practices for Small business owners and how you should keep your books and records.

3. Payroll tax 101: who needs to file, what documents you need to keep as an employer and important tips for hiring employees.

4. Sales tax 101: who needs to collect sales tax returns, when they are due and penalties for not filing sales tax returns.

5. Corporate tax deadlines and Penalties for not filing on time.

6. Most important: Top Tax deductions that you can write off.  Details of business expenses that you can write off and what you need to deduct specific expenses.

We will follow a structured format:

6:00-6:15pm - open networking/registration 
6:15-6:45pm - Workshop  
6:45-7:15pm - Q&A  


Keep Learning, Keep Growing,


Aditi
results.name: Taxes for small business and individuals (Complimentary Workshop)

results.description:
The Safe Access Night event series will bring together patients, advocates, medical practitioners and industry experts in a comfortable setting to learn about the New York medical marijuana program.  

Learn, Network, and take Direct Action!


Featured Speakers

Scott Levenson COO and Co-Founder of Tikun Olam US

Scott is internationally recognized as president and founder of the political consulting firm The Advance group and Chief operating officer and co-founder of Tikun Olam US. Over the past 25 years, he has built one of the leading strategic consulting and lobbying firms in the nation where he has managed more than 250 campaigns and advised over a 100 startups and non-for-profit/for-profit corporations. With 15 years of experience in the medical cannabis industry, he was the driving political force behind New York’s Compassionate Care Act and Senate bill to reschedule cannabis.


Lex Pelger on "Cannabis for Grandma"

Lex Pelger is the host of Psymposia. A drug writer and scientist based in Brooklyn, his current project is called "Anadamide or: the Cannabinoid": a graphic novel about cannabis focusing on the intricacies of the endocannabinoid system, the War on Weed, and the staggering benefits of medical use by the elderly. He graduated from Boston University with a BS in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology before spending a number of years of the road collecting anecdotes of drug use from the Burners to the scientists to the underground medical use. He writes articles about the science of drugs and the anecdotes of their use for publications like Alternet.


Recent article written by Lex:  http://vanwinkles.com/how-cannabis-can-help-prevent-RBD-in-Parkinsons-sufferers

Interested in learning about the medical cannabis program in New York?  

How to Become a Patient 

https://www.health.ny.gov/regulations/medical_marijuana/patients/

How to Become a Registered Physician

https://www.health.ny.gov/regulations/medical_marijuana/practitioner/


List of Registered Organizations to Dispense Medical Marijuana in New York

https://www.health.ny.gov/regulations/medical_marijuana/application/ 

Have new information on the medical cannabis program in New York?  Email [masked] and let us know.  

Legal Disclaimer  

Views or opinions expressed by speakers or sponsors at our local Cannabis Society community events do not necessarily express the opinion or views of the Cannabis Society organization and we do not take responsibility for the views expressed or the actions of speakers or sponsors at our local events. The Cannabis Society does not distribute cannabis.

The Cannabis Society is Growing  

Our group has grown by leaps and bounds these past few years and we are proud to announce that the Cannabis Society is going to continue to grow and develop our ecosystem with groundbreaking events centering around medical cannabis, technology, art, and science. We couldn’t do it without our members and we want to thank you for being apart of this growing organization.

results.description:
As sales development reps, we are taught to qualify for Authority and for Money.  But what about the hard questions about Need and Value to the customer?  Often SDR's are not empowered to talk the other side of the money spectrum - value for the spend - and therefore lose out on the opportunity to close deals faster.

Our speaker Derek Grant will share what he has learned about having the conversation on customer value from his time at Pardot to his experiences selling on value as he leads the sales organization at Salesloft.


ABOUT OUR SPEAKER


Derek Grant leads SalesLoft's sales organization, which is focused on helping sales development practitioners schedule more, qualified meetings. Prior to joining SalesLoft, Derek served as the architect of Pardot’s sales process, leading the organization from pre-revenue startup to $100M exit to ExactTarget (subsequently acquired by Salesforce).  Derek is a native son of Florida and holds a bachelor's degree in communications from Florida State University.


***


THANKS TO OUR SPONSORS THIS MONTH

Hired simply kicks ass if you are searching for your next great sales gig with the next hot startup. Create your personal profile here and land your dream job!

Also thanks to Smartling for providing us their great venue for our events.

results.description:
***Come any time between 6:00pm and 9:00pm, stay as long as you want, or leave when you need to. (Arriving at 7:00pm or 8:00pm is perfectly great.)***


Wassail is a new vegetarian restaurant -- and New York City's first-and-only Cider Bar -- that has taken New York by storm. With glowing reviews in the likes of Bon Appetit, the New York Times, the New York Observer, the Village Voice, and New York Magazine, this media darling and new favorite of food critics and residents alike has been dialing me up and inviting the NYC Vegetarian & Vegan Meetup to go for dinner. And go we shall.

The New York Times (Dec. 2015): "The roots of Wassail’s idiosyncratic obsessions go back to when one of the owners, Ben Sandler, went on a class trip to a zoo at age 14. He was on acid at the time, which did not prove to be a sound decision. When his mind stopped rippling, he swore off meat and illegal drugs for good.

"This helps explain why the menu at Wassail, which he opened early this spring with his wife, Jennifer Lim, is fully devoted to vegetables. (Ms. Lim converted after marriage and is now fully devoted to vegetables herself.) [David's Note: It is Ms. Lim, pictured above with her husband Ben Sandler, who has been calling and inviting our meetup group.]

"Apples roll through Joseph Buenconsejo’s savory courses and Rebecca Eichenbaum’s desserts as well. Luckily, this is not always obvious. Little about their cooking is. What I noticed about a parsnip-apple soup wasn’t the thematic tie-in but the way caramelized onions and pecans broadened the sweet, creamy flavor of the soup.

"Grilled butternut squash was buried under smithereens of nuts and seeds, a kind of exploded granola that added a wonderfully sweet and crunchy dimension to the soft squash.

"I almost always order creamy little potatoes, their red and white skins blistered and blackened over charcoal. Mr. Buenconsejo sends them off in an Eastern European direction with a dill sauce and a lather of tangy goat butter, a treatment that’s both delicate and direct.

"To a salad of cucumber spears and pearls of dripping-ripe melon, Mr. Buenconsejo adds so many elements — macadamia milk, chopped macadamias, sorrel leaves, borage oil — that it almost spins out of control, but it doesn’t."

New York Observer - 5 Star Review (out of 5 Stars): "As for what comes out of the kitchen into the warmly lit space with marble counters and filament light, Mr. Buenconsejo’s menu is hearty. It is also hearthy, which is both hearty and healthy and homey—and vegetarian. I’ve eaten extremely well as a vegetarian restaurant critic but didn’t realize how stifling having to choose was until presented with a menu like this where no choice is necessary."

Bon Appetit Magazine: "It’s hard not to get swept up in the excitement of America’s growing cider resurgence. Unlike beer, wine, spirits or even cocktails, hard cider is a fresh new beverage frontier for many Americans to become familiar with and grow to love. And now, in addition to plenty of new producers hitting the maps, we’ve got a new wave of cider bars to help push the movement forward as well.

"The food program looks similarly delightful, with Joseph Buenconsejo (Hotel Americano, The Lion, Aqua) at the helm and Rebecca Eichenbaum rocking the pastries. Lim says the food is loosely inspired by different cider making regions around the world, but comes together with the slant of New American gastropub with a bit “more finesse.” There isn’t any meat on the menu, but complex presentations of vegetable dishes that pair well with cider will abound. “We wanted to showcase the pairing qualities of cider, and since the spectrum is so wide, that leaves us a huge palette to work with,” Sandler says."

Wassail is all vegetarian but not 100% vegan. However, they will happily veganize most of their dishes upon request. If you are a vegan, please ask your server to have the chef veganize your dish if it is not already vegan.

For those of you who have never attended one of our Meetup events: this is an incredibly friendly & welcoming group. It will be easy to find our group:  just ask any waitperson which tables are for the "Meetup". Everyone pays for themselves. Easy!

Train Directions: Take the F train to 2nd Avenue (exit via 1st Ave. exit) or the J, M, or Z trains to Essex St.

Where to meet: Ask the waitstaff to seat you at the "meetup" tables.

Come see why vegans, vegetarians, and non-vegetarians alike are streaming into this trendy and popular new vegetarian restaurant.


David

***Come any time between 6:00pm and 9:00pm, stay as long as you want, or leave when you need to. (Arriving at 7:00pm or 8:00pm is perfectly great.)***

Tuesday is Arduino night at Fat Cat Fab Lab!

We have lots more Arduinos, breadboards, and parts, so bring your laptop and come join us for a fun hands-on learning experience.

As usual, people are welcome to come and work on their own projects, and we will show new users how to install the Arduino development software on their laptops and get started connecting sensors and output devices. 


We had a great turnout last week when many people focused on Neo Pixel LEDs.  We had several newcomers hook up and program Arduino's for their first time, and quite a few people hook up and program Neo Pixel LEDs.

As announced last week, the focus for the April 5th meeting, will be using sensors to detect body movement and control LEDs in wearable electronics.

PRESENTATION April 5: on how accelerometers work, how to use them to measure human body motion and control LEDs in wearable electronics.


--------------------------------------------------------------

Stewart Newfeld, our Arduino Tuesdays host has a an Electrical Engineering degree from Rutgers University, years of industry experience, and loves to teach and share his enthusiasm for making things. He enjoys ordering those so-inexpensive electronic parts from ebay and Aliexpress and having them show up like little toys two to three weeks later in his mailbox. He is president of Zebra Systems, Inc. where he develops websites with the Joomla Open Source CMS.

--------------------------------------------------------------

results.description:
Join us as we explore how apps for smartphones and tablets are empowering patients and care teams to communicate and share information more effectively. This is part of the ‘mHealth,’ a sub-segment of eHealth which is the burgeoning use of electronic records, computers and IT in the delivery of health care. Why should you care about mHealth? Besides the impact it will have (or already has had!) on you and your family, mHealth is poised to play a big role in the $100B+ Health IT marketplace. What opportunities exist for entrepreneurs to enter this marketplace?

The event will include presentations by three experts, including Dr. Peter S. Tippett, a nationally recognized expert on mHealth and one of the top thought leaders in this area. The experts will discuss mHealth from the cutting-edge perspective of balancing security with the seamless use of the technology across different networks.


Presenters:
Peter S. Tippett, MD, PhD, former Chief Medical Officer for Verizon and renowned Health IT innovator will keynote this event and discuss the unique advantages and challenges of using mobile apps in care coordination and patient centered care.


Robert Conlin, Infrastructure Engineering, Infrastructure Technical Lead from Hackensack University Medical Center will present the HUMC mobile app used for enrolling and engaging patients more efficiently.

Tom Foley, Director, Global Health Solutions Strategy, Lenovo Health

Presentations will be followed by Q&A when attendees can ask the experts questions about mobile technology in healthcare.

Event is free, and food will be served!


Agenda:
6-6:45 p.m. Networking with food
6:45-7 p.m. Welcome remarks and 1-minute pitches from audience
7-7:20 p.m. Dr. Tippett keynote address
7:20-7:40 p.m. Robert Conlin HUMC app presentation
7:40-8:00 p.m. Tom Foley presentation
8:00-8:30 p.m. Q&A session led by Dr. Tippett

Directions and parking info: Park in the Red Hawk Deck on campus, exit the deck on Level 5 and proceed straight up the walkway (soccer field will be on your left). At the new Feliciano School of Business building, turn right and go up the outdoor staircase. University Hall will be straight ahead once you reach the top of the steps. Campus map with directions. (Please note the map in that link is old--the tennis courts shown on the map is where the Feliciano School of Business building now stands.)

Join the conversation on Twitter and Instagram: #MSUmeetup and @FelicianoCenter

Event is presented by the Feliciano Center for Entrepreneurship, DataMotion, Lenovo Health, Hackensack University Medical Center and NJ-HIMSS.

Speaker bios:

Peter Tippett, MD, PhD, is considered a pioneer and foremost authority on health IT – with diverse credits ranging from serving on the President’s Information Technology Advisory Committee (PITAC) to creating the first commercial anti-virus product. Tippett most recently served as the Chief Medical Officer and VP of industry solutions at Verizon. Tippett has led the computer security industry for more than 20 years, initially as a vendor of security products, and more recently as a key strategist. He is widely credited with creating the first commercial anti-virus product that later became Norton AntiVirus. Tippett is frequently quoted and has written many articles and papers on enterprise information technology, health IT and information security. 

Tom Foley has over 25 years of experience in information technology across many industries. His career started as the lead system programmer in the national automation of the UPS telephone center from paper to electronic format; he was also involved in several other innovative initiatives at UPS including the prototyping of the first Package Confirmation device. As well, Mr. Foley served as the Data Network Design Manager during the initial deployment of one of the first national wireless data networks, so he understands mobility from the outset embracing wireless data. For the last 15 years, Mr. Foley has applied his expertise in Health IT, having several leadership roles with leading EHR vendors. Mr. Foley has been involved in several strategic initiatives such as migrating EHR platforms from client server to cloud-based models, rollout of Health Information, Patient Portals/Patient Engagement, and rollout of Direct Messaging to 43,000 subscribers. Mr. Foley is well versed on Meaningful use and related regulatory matters. He is currently the Global Health Solutions Strategy Manager for Lenovo Health, focused on coupling technology with workflows and the different stakeholders across the continuum of care.
results.name: In Your Hands: How Mobile Technology Impacts Healthcare

results.description:
Topic

The future of scalable data processing is event-driven microservices! They provide a powerful paradigm that solves issues typically associated with distributed applications such as availability, data consistency, or communication complexity, and allows the creation of sophisticated and extensible data processing pipelines.

Building on the ease of development and deployment provided by Spring Boot and the cloud native capabilities of Spring Cloud, the Spring Cloud Stream project provides a simple and powerful framework for creating event-driven microservices. They make it easy to develop data-processing Spring Boot applications that build upon the capabilities of Spring Integration. At a higher level of abstraction, Spring Cloud Data Flow is an integrated orchestration layer that provides a highly productive experience for deploying and managing sophisticated data pipelines consisting of standalone microservices. Streams are defined using a DSL abstraction and can be managed via shell and a web UI. Furthermore, a pluggable runtime SPI allows Spring Cloud Data Flow to coordinate these applications across a variety of distributed runtime platforms such as Apache YARN, Cloud Foundry, Kubernetes, or Apache Mesos.

You’ll see live deployment demos on different platforms ranging from local cluster to a remote Cloud to show the simplicity of the developer experience.

About the Speaker

Marius Bogoevici is a software engineer at Pivotal, leading Spring Cloud Stream, and working on Spring Cloud Data Flow, Spring XD, and other Spring projects. Agenda

6:30 pm Registration and Pizza

7-8 pm Presentation
results.name: Stream Processing in the Cloud with Data Microservices

BEGINNER TANGO: Absolute Beginning

Beginner Tango course is meant for people who either never ever danced Argentine Tango, took few classes long time ago or took few lessons quite recently but are not sure what they know or if they are ready for next level.

You will learn basics necessary to progress further. The material is presented in very organized manner allowing smooth progress from class to class. 

Please note that even if you dance other dances like salsa, swing, zouk or any of Ballroom or American Style dances, even if for years you took ballet, jazz, hip hop or any other of solo dances, you need to take the Beginner level class. The axis, the basis for the dance, musicality and partnership is completely different. Taking those 4 classes might be the life changing experience for you. It is obvious that having dance background helps, but it shall also give you enough experience to know that the basic classes are THE MOST IMPORTANT ONES, as they create a base for all your learning experience. What you don’t know will always and always chase you.

 It’s good to take this course to put all your information in order. You gain the necessary vocabulary and learn all the basic movements to be able to easily follow the explanations in higher level courses. Please respect our commitment to excellence. And make it your own.

No partner necessary. Join at any time – though we do recommend starting at the beginning of the cycle (see above for dates). You can take this course as many times as you find necessary for you.

The full course consists of 4 60-minutes classes.
SIGN UP NOW

Let's grab a bite to eat, maybe some drinks, and play some games! Yes, there are games you may never have heard of ... results.description:
There was plenty of politics between 1865 and 1920.  Let's focus on how the political system handled two major wars and one splendid little one.  Reconstruction failed the freed slaves -- now finally African-Americans. Why did Northerners who had suffered so much to preserve the Union and end slavery lose interest and let the South return to its old ways?  Less than 50 years later the US fought and won the First World War.  But again Americans lost interest and let Europe return to its old ways.  We'll try to find out what role our political system had in getting us into to wars and more importantly making and keeping the peace.

Along the way we'll check in with the Mugwumps.  See you in April.
results.name: The Politics of War - Reconstruction, Yellow Journalism and Versailles

results.description:
WHO WE ARE

Killer Snails, LLC is a learning game company that celebrates extraordinary extreme creatures found in nature. Killer Snails (KS) creates intriguing learning games using venomous marine snails as a conduit to explore issues of scientific learning. The exciting venom content encourages players to think analytically about the world around them and the many opportunities and challenges present in scientific exploration to become science changemakers.

We (a scientist, educator, game maker and business person) have completed an analog card game in collaboration with the American Museum of Natural History under our first National Science Foundation grant. We recently received a second National Science Foundation grant to develop a digital version that will include a two sided dashboard providing scaffolded feedback to both players and educators/parents, as well as opportunities for “citizen science” opportunities to develop middle school students as science changemakers.
​ AREAS FOR DISCUSSION

A. Marketing Strategy for Parents & Educators Customer Segments: How can we most accurately prioritize and market the value propositions for middle school parents, science teachers, and administrators in both urban and suburban communities?; Should we narrow our focus more?

B. Differentiation: With a platform that offers both professional development to teachers and education technology for students, how can we best position ourselves to enter the educational market? How do we stand out against our competitors? What are the gatekeepers in the education sector looking for in an ed tech platform?

C. Measuring Impact: What metrics should we consider to measure meaningful impact? Usage, time per game, type of feedback given, activities attended offline?

Spark Workshop with Killer Snails, LLC
with Mandë Holford, PhD, Lindsay Portnoy, PhD, and Jessica Ochoa Hendrix BUS '09

Tuesday, April 5, 2016
Workshop will begin at 6:30 p.m.
Please plan on arriving 10-15 minutes early.

results.description:
South Africa’s constitution guarantees the right to
basic education and a progressively realizable right to ‘further education.’ Despite this promise, South Africa has in recent months been rocked by massive student protests at universities across the country, as protestors
frustrated by the slow pace of democratic transformation have demanded significant reforms within the higher education system. The South African protests have drawn inspiration from the Black Lives Matter campaign in the United States and have, in turn, motivated protests
about the nature of race and higher education at institutions around the world, including Harvard, Yale, Princeton, and Oxford. The South African protestors have, among other things, demanded the reduction or elimination of university fees, removal of colonial symbols from campuses, and increased representation of black scholars among faculty and of African scholarship within university curricula. The panel will discuss South Africa’s recent university protests and how potential legal and institutional reforms might help to democratize higher
education in South Africa and beyond.
Speakers:
DMITRI HOLTZMAN:
Founder of the Equal Education Law Center in Cape T
own, South Africa.
SEAN JACOBS:
Assistant Professor of International Affairs at the
New School, specializing in post-apartheid South Africa and U.S.-African relations. Founder and Chief Editor of the blog
“Africa Is a Country”.
DANIEL MAGAZINER:
Associate Professor of History at Yale University,
specializing in the study of 20th Century South Africa.
SHANDUKANI MULAUDZI:
South African journalist and recent graduate of the
University of the Witwatersrand in Johannesburg, South Africa.
Moderator:
Zoey Chenitz, Chair of the New York City Bar’s Business in Africa Subcommittee
All are welcome!
results.name: DECOLONIZING EDUCATION IN SOUTH AFRICA

results.description:
Dr. William L. Bain, Founder & CEO, ScaleOut Software

Free swag, candy, beer and fun-drinks + more!

A Database Month event http://www.DBMonth.com/database/nosql-data

In today's data centers, the network has become the bottleneck. A key challenge for storage systems, including both databases and NoSQL stores, is how to minimize network traffic when accessing and updating stored data. Standard data access APIs place the burden of implementing data structures on the client and thereby exacerbate data motion between clients and servers.

In contrast, implementing data structures within a storage system can dramatically streamline communication since only incremental changes to stored data need to be transferred. However, building server-based data structures creates several challenges, including how to make this mechanism easy to use, secure, and extensible.

In-memory data grids (IMDGs) have been widely used as distributed, key-value stores for serialized objects, providing blazingly fast data access, location transparency, scalability, and integrated high availability.

Redis has pioneered the use of memory-based, data-structure stores with its support for built-in data structures, such as hashed sets and lists, to provide functionality similar to stored procedures in databases.

This talk describes exciting new techniques which use the power of IMDGs to generalize this concept and enable the straightforward creation of extensible, user-defined data structures held within an IMDG. This session will explore how IMDGs can implement user-defined data structures by leveraging their NoSQL, object-oriented, data-parallel data model.

We will also discuss techniques that lets applications define object-oriented methods which execute within the IMDG to implement a user-defined data structure. Other techniques extends this approach for scalability by distributing stored data across the IMDG's cluster of servers and performing data-parallel operations across the distributed data structure. Several examples will be described that demonstrate both the power of this approach and its ability to reduce network congestion.

Dr. William L. Bain, Founder & CEO, ScaleOut Software

Dr. William L. Bain is Founder & CEO of ScaleOut Software, Inc. and holds a Ph.D. in electrical engineering from Rice University. Bill has contributed to advancements in parallel computing at Bell Labs research, Intel, and Microsoft, and holds several patents in computer architecture and distributed computing.

Bill founded and ran three start-up companies prior to founding ScaleOut Software in 2003. His previous company, Valence Research, developed and distributed Web load-balancing software and was acquired by Microsoft Corporation. As a member of the screening committee for the Seattle-based Alliance of Angels, Bill is actively involved in entrepreneurship and the angel community. Bill is also a regular speaker at conferences around the world.

Swag giveaway + food/drinks at 6:30pm
Power-Networking at 6:35pm 
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

Techie Youth is a 501c3 not-for-profit charity of NYC that provides technology-education, followed by assistance beginning an IT-career, to at-risk youth in NYC & Long Island who are in foster-care and classified as being severely-at-risk of becoming homeless and/or incarcerated in the next 18-24 months.

These kids need YOU, they have nobody else.
Please help them. Learn about Nadine, a student of Techie Youth: http://www.TechieYouth.org/hope
results.name: Using Memory-Based NoSQL Data Structures to Eliminate Network Bottleneck

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't allow latecomers to enter.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.

TIPS AND TOOLS FOR THE PROSPECTIVE HOME BUYER FROM LICENSED BROKERS, A REAL ESTATE ATTORNEY, AND A MORTGAGE BANKER.

On Tuesday, April 5, Out Professionals presents a home-buying workshop for New York singles and couples. At the global headquarters of Compass, you’ll meet Team Martin agents Gary Martin and Sean Guerrier, real estate attorney Manuel Mercader and mortgage banker Tony Jao.

Whether you are a first-time buyer … trading up to a larger apartment … or downsizing to a pied a terre, this OP workshop helps prepare you for whatever challenges the sellers and their brokers may have in store.

Which might be better for you to buy — a co-op or a condo? What can you realistically expect at a board interview?

What does it take to get a mortgage from a bank? How do you become pre-approved for a loan before shopping around for a home? Is pre-approval the same as pre-qualification?

How do you go about choosing a real estate attorney? What is an attorney’s role in your purchase? How soon should an attorney be brought into the process?

For answers to these and other vital home-buying questions, join us on Tuesday, April 5. Between now and then, jot down your own questions for Gary, Sean, Manuel and Tony.

Team Martin’s Gary Martin (upper left) and Sean Guerrier (upper right) collaborate to provide clients with well-researched and insightful views of the New York market and the city’s ever-evolving neighborhoods. Gary and Sean are supported by exceptional Compass technology and the firm’s commitment to integrity and success.

Manuel Mercader, Esq. (lower left) of the firm Mercader Law P.C., is a real estate attorney who has represented buyers, sellers and lenders in both commercial and residential transactions for more than a decade.

Tony Jao (lower right) of Sterling National Bank has been providing residential financing since 2003. As a Mortgage Banker at an FDIC bank, Tony has access to dozens of financial products and can secure the best rates and the lowest fees on a multitude of mortgage programs.

WHERE
Compass, 90 Fifth Avenue at 14th Street (fifth floor). Subway: 1/2/3/F/M to 14th Street; N/Q/R to Union Square.

results.description:
This week I am going to see Miracles From Heaven I will arrive at 7:00 for the 7:30 pm showing. I  have seat D6 If you are coming post your seat #  If anyone wants to grab a snack before or after the movie and wants to organize that feel free to post and I will join you if I can. 


Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie


Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Fri/Sat) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to drive there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!!    Love, Cassie

PS: I am doing this with my friendship group too so if you are S&L do wear your wristbands. These are loads of fun at the movies they glow in the dark!

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

results.description:
The Unwanted Houseguest
A Magrevian campaign for 3rd level characters.

The snows have settled heavy in the north of Magrevia, sweeping down from the Buchen Mountains, and blanketing the open hills and treetops with a deadly field of white. The cold eats at the fingers of men tending their animals in barns, and searching for firewood stockpiled against the winter. It came early this year, and Mother help us all.

The hall sits alone in a clearing, trees approach on all sides but a high stone wall holds them back, cutting a walled garden from the wilds. At shuttered windows a glow speaks of warmth and shelter. From one, the sounds of merriment can even be heard, but there is a tension to that laughter, a strain in the cheer… are the participants forcing this celebration to keep the cold at bay, or is it the cold itself doing the forcing?

The province of Magrevia is a land of dark shadows and deep forests. A century before, the Empire of Thyatis sent its troops, intent on adding the region to its dominion. Today, the Thyatians stay within their outposts, still unable to penetrate the wild lands that surround them. The Magrevian people continue to dwell in the communities that have sheltered them for generations, their doors and windows closed tight each night against the darkness. The Unwanted Houseguest is a storyline for 5th edition Dungeons and Dragons, for characters of 2-4th level. The focus is on solving mysteries, and the challenge of surviving the horror surrounding you.
results.name: D&D 5E: The Unwanted Houseguest - Session 6

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Get ready for SUMMER with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
What’s your body’s password? 

            Login to your body to decipher its language.

Receive a wealth of information teaching you the signs your body gives when it hungers for attention. Your tongue, nails, feet and hands signal changes you physically and/or emotionally are experiencing. 


Is that back pain really just from a bad night’s sleep? With every ache, pain and rash there is a message your body is giving. Listen, Identify and Release. 

 
Learn how stress creates blockages leading not just to emotional affects but ramifications on other areas such as mental processing as well as attributing to physical ailments. Navigate through the mind & body uncovering these intricate connections. Awareness of our bodies is the password to unlocking health and inner happiness. 


Once we identify the source, we can zoom in and dissolve these blockages draining away toxins that had been clogging the pathways to mental and physical wellbeing. Learn a variety of methods to clear the blockages embracing a healthy, happy way of life. 

 
Live Life Empowered!

While it may be easy for us to be grateful when we think things "go our way", the Course teaches us "Everything is for your own best interests. results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
This is the second event in our Debate Series. This event will focus on the topic of decentralization in the context of Bitcoin. If you can't make it to the main event please join us at Live Bait around 9:15PM for a social hour.
As the block size debate rages on, a common question that arises is: what function does decentralization serve in Bitcoin's security model? Said differently: how much decentralization does Bitcoin need to be secure?

To answer this question we must first explore the metrics which define decentralization. Once a general framework for decentralization has been outlined/agreed upon, we can explore varying opinions on threat models for the Bitcoin network. For example: some believe that if Bitcoin nodes were exclusively run in data centers that would provide sufficient security/privacy/autonomy for network participants, while others believe that resource requirements for running a full node should be kept accessible so network participants can run their own nodes and validate incoming block and transaction data without having to trust a third party.

Related questions we will discuss:

• Is node count a good metric of decentralization?

• How accessible should running a node be?

• Why is running a node important (or not)?

• Do you think block size should be purely a denial-of-service prevention measure? (link)

• Do you think they serve an economic purpose (e.g. to "create a transaction fee market")?

• What is the state of the mining network in the context of decentralization? 


Please read the following articles to prepare yourself for discussion (and feel free to submit other articles and questions you feel are relevant to bitdevsnyc (at) gmail (dot) com):

• http://truthcoin.info/blog/measuring-decentralization

• http://bluematt.bitcoin.ninja/2016/01/14/decentralization/

• http://wallstreettechnologist.com/2016/02/05/the-decentralization-myth/

• http://organofcorti.blogspot.de/2014/12/measures-of-network-hashrate.html

• http://www.initc3.org/scalingblockchain/full.pdf


Message from our sponsors: Rise New York is part of a global community of the world’s brightest thinkers and doers creating the future of financial technology. We listen, nurture and oxygenate through our international network of Rise spaces, and connect, co-create, and scale innovation, in partnership with Barclays. Rise New York also houses a world-class event space and is home to the U.S. cohort of the Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars.
results.name: BitDevs Debate Series #2: On Decentralization

Great work being done!  Really wonderful to see member's getting creative with their own web-series, one-acts and short film scripts... and other members raising up to play those roles! 

Bring your monologues, your scenes for auditions, or come ready for cold/warm reads on some of the scenes were casting!  There is no cost and all we do is split the studio rental fee ($5 each) and then get supportive and incisive feedback on the performances.  

We had a great turnout and some incredible people coming out for the first time!   Looking forward to more great sessions to come!


PS... Please let us know if we can help you find material or scenes to prep for the gym. Though preparation is not required and everyone is more than welcome to jump in on a cold read, being familiar or off book with a script can really allow you to challenge yourself and get more out of the gym and your acting. Also, feel free to use the messaging system on our Meetup page to find scene partners or share material with those who have RSVPed to a session.

PPS. We also have a piano for use in Musical Theatre type projects :)

Thanks Everyone and see you soon!

This meetup is held the first Tuesday of each month and has two purposes.

First, it serves as a general networking opportunity for Permies in the area to meet each other and to provide mutual aid. What are you working on and where? What kind of collaborators and skills sets do you want to add to your team? Do you have an idea that you'd like to share just for feedback and exploration?

Second, this is an information session to increase knowledge about the numerous ways that permaculture can be applied in the world, from gardening/farming practices and land stewardship, to regenerative economic systems, community building, and nature connection.

*A $5 donation will be optional for our meetups. Proceeds help sponsor PDC students and other sustainable culture educational projects in the Northeast. The PayPal link sends a donation to Green Phoenix Permaculture, a 501c3 organization.*

results.description:
Gene Murrow and Tom Amessé will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment by Karen Axelrod, Rachel Bell, and Eric Martin!

The sixth and final Playford Ball prep session will also be featured in the dance selection tonight.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance!

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up.

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: English Country Dance with Gene Murrow and Tom Amessé

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>

results.description:
"The Improbability Principle: Why Coincidences, Miracles, and Rare Events Happen Every Day" by David J. Hand

The author is emeritus professor of mathematics and a senior research investigator at Imperial College London. He is a former president of the Royal Statistical Society and the chief scientific adviser to Winton Capital Management, one of Europe's most successful algorithmic-trading hedge funds. In this book he wrestles with the seemingly inexplicable: what the Bible and Shakespeare have in common, why financial crashes are inevitable and why lightning does strike the same place (and the same person) more than once. Along the way, he teaches us how to use the Improbability Principle in our own lives―including how to cash in at a casino and how to recognize when a medicine is truly effective.


This event is hosted by Bob Braine. for information on this month's book, email [masked]. This event is FREE and OPEN TO THE PUBLIC.
results.name: BOOK CLUB: The Improbability Principle: Why Coincidences, Miracles.......

Register at EventBrite: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/cannabis-business-opportunities-medical-benefits-and-legal-overview-tickets-22576610249

Exciting new event hosted by Hacking Health. Come hear about the evolving and growing field of Cannabis therapeutics and other business opportunities in the field. Following a brief overview of the legal and regulatory landscape in NY and around the country, Hacking Health NYC is happy to present 2 amazing people:

Eileen Konieczny, RN
Eileen is President of the American Cannabis Nurses Association and has over 20 years of nursing experience specializing in oncology. As a healthcare provider, Eileen has witnessed her patients struggle with a host of side effects associated with their treatment protocols which “greatly reduce their quality of life”. Her hospital nursing career runs the gamut, high-dose chemotherapy with peripheral stem cell and/or bone marrow transplant rescue, palliative chemotherapy regimens, comfort care, research as well as over-night House Supervisor of a 68-bed acute care hospital. Combining her personal and professional life experiences Eileen has found the unstoppable calling to advocate for medical cannabis. She understands the need to live a happy and full life. Advocating for patients, seeing the whole person, not just an illness or a disease that needs to be treated, is what a nurse does best. Eileen believes in the healing powers that cannabis can provide to those in need.

You can read more about Eileen here:
http://americancannabisnursesassociation.org/Eileen-Konieczny

Michael Zaytsev
Mike is the organizer of HighNY, which hosts monthly education and networking events designed to empower leaders who want to create a more healthy, compassionate world in which Cannabis prohibition does not exist. Featured in The Guardian, Mashable, Inc., NY Daily News, Complex, Village Voice, Crain's New York and more, High NY is the largest community of Cannabis activists, entrepreneurs, and investors in New York. Mike has extensive experience in sales, technology and startups.

You can read more about Michael here: https://www.linkedin.com/in/michaelzaytsev
results.name: The Cannabis Industry: Medical, Tech, and Legal Update

Cost: Members: $5, Non-Members: $15, Student: $7

If enough people are interested, we'll go out to dinner at a nearby diner afterward.


Link to event: http://www.nyas.org/events/...

Modern physics and its leading theories, such as the Standard Model of particle physics, Einstein’s theory of relativity, and quantum mechanics, have been remarkably successful in describing the dynamical history of our universe. Large-scale experiments, such as the Large Hadron Collider or advanced ground- and space-based telescopes, continuously produce new data that extend our knowledge of the world. Nevertheless, our understanding of some physical concepts that seek to explain our universe—dark matter and dark energy, quantum gravity, supersymmetry, and the cosmological constant—remain unresolved. Cosmologist Neil Weiner, physicist Vijay Balasubramanian and selected other speakers will explore whether there are limits on our ability to learn about the universe and obtain evidence to verify prevailing theories, where those limits might be and what their significance is for our worldview, and whether humanity, when facing these limits, may once again invoke "God of the gaps"—the notion that divine intervention plays a role in natural phenomena that science is presently unable to explain.

* Reception to follow.

Featuring Vijay Balasubramanian, PhD

Professor of Physics, University of Pennsylvania

Neal Weiner, PhD

results.description:
The New York Review of Science Fiction Readings
presents a launch party for
Clockwork Phoenix 5
hosted by
Mike Allen
featuring readings from
Rob Cameron
C.S.E. Cooney
Carlos Hernandez
Barbara Krasnoff
Sonya Taaffe
Shveta Thakrar
A.C. Wise
Tuesday, April 5th -- doors open 6:30 p.m.
$7 suggested donation
The Commons | 388 Atlantic Avenue
(directions & links below)
This April we will shower you with great writers (and an editor), celebrating the launch of the latest in a critically-hailed series of anthologies. Funded by a successful $12,000 Kickstarter campaign, Clockwork Phoenix 5 continues Mike Allen's mission of showcasing beautifully-written, difficult-to-categorize stories of the fantastic. It's the largest and most ambitious volume in the Clockwork Phoenix series to date, containing 20 stories by 21 authors. A starred review in Publishers Weekly proclaimed that "all the stories afford thought-provoking glimpses into alternative realities that linger, sparking unconventional thoughts, long after they are first encountered."

Mike Allen is editor of Mythic Delirium magazine and the Clockwork Phoenix anthologies, and author of the short story collections Unseaming and The Spider Tapestries. A Nebula Award and Shirley Jackson Award finalist and winner of three Rhysling Awards for poetry, he lives in Roanoke, Va., with wife and co-editor Anita, two mischievous cats and a neurotic dog. He posts about his writer exploits at http://descentintolight.com/, his editor exploits at http://mythicdelirium.com/, and combines the two at @mythicdelirium.

---
Rob Cameron (SPIDERCAM!!!) is an elementary school teacher and writer living in Brooklyn. When he’s not writing stories, organizing events for the Brooklyn Speculative Fiction Writers, or producing the Kaleidocast, BSFW's audio magazine podcast, he is rock climbing, dragon boating, and working on his Buddha-like glow. C.S.E. Cooney, (csecooney.com & @csecooney) is the author of Bone Swans: Stories (Mythic Delirium 2015), the title story of which is a Nebula Award nominee and will feature in Paula Guran’s Year’s Best Science Fiction and Fantasy Novellas. She is the author of the Dark Breakers series, Jack o’ the Hills, The Witch in the Almond Tree, and a poetry collection called How to Flirt in Faerieland and Other Wild Rhymes, which includes her Rhysling Award-winning poem “The Sea King’s Second Bride.” A graduate of Columbia College Chicago’s Fiction and Theatre departments, Cooney works as an audiobook narrator for Tantor Media. Her alter ego Brimstone Rhine has put out two EPs: Alecto! Alecto! and The Headless Bride, which can be purchased on Bandcamp.

Carlos Hernandez is the author of the short story collection The Assimilated Cuban's Guide to Quantum Santeria. He's also a college professor and a game designer interested in new media and new narrative forms. @writeteachplay

Barbara Krasnoff is pleased to be represented in Clockwork Phoenix for the third time. She has otherwise sold over 30 pieces of short fiction to a wide variety of publications and is working on a novel. Barbara is also the author of a YA non-fiction book, Robots: Reel to Real, and is currently Sr. Reviews Editor for Computerworld. She is a member of the NYC writers group Tabula Rasa, and lives in Brooklyn, NY. Her website is http://BrooklynWriter.com.

Sonya Taaffe’s short fiction and award-winning poetry has appeared in multiple venues, including The Humanity of Monsters, Genius Loci, and Dreams from the Witch House. Her most recent collection is Ghost Signs (Aqueduct Press). She is currently senior poetry editor for Strange Horizons and once named a Kuiper belt object.

Shveta Thakrar is a South Asian–flavored fantasy writer, social justice activist, and part-time nagini. Her work can be found in Flash Fiction Online, Interfictions Online, Clockwork Phoenix 5, Mythic Delirium, Uncanny, Faerie, Strange Horizons, Kaleidoscope: Diverse YA Science Fiction and Fantasy Stories, and Steam-Powered 2: More Lesbian Steampunk Stories.

A.C. Wise's fiction has appeared in Clockwork Phoenix 4, Clarkesworld, and Shimmer, among other places. Her debut collection, The Ultra Fabulous Glitter Squadron Saves the World Again, was published by Lethe Press in October 2015. Find her online at http://acwise.net.

---
The New York Review of Science Fiction Reading Series [NYRSF Readings] provides performances from some of the best writers in science fiction, fantasy, speculative fiction, etc. The series usually takes place the first Tuesday of every month, but maintains flexibility in time and space, so be sure to stay in touch through the mailing list, the Web, and Facebook.

As always, The Brooklyn Commons Cafe will see to your wining, dining and other worldly needs; and the Jenna freebie table will offer books and goodies, as will the raffle for any who donate.

After the event, please join us as we celebrate the launch of Clockwork Phoenix 5 at the cafe, which now has a special menu for us as well as table service.

Jim Freund is Producer and Executive Curator of The New York Review of Science Fiction Readings. He has been involved in producing radio programs of and about literary sf/f since 1967. His long-running live radio program, “Hour of the Wolf,” broadcasts and streams every Wednesday night/Thursday morning from 1:30-3:00 AM. Programs are available by stream for a few months after broadcast. (Check http://hourwolf.com, or join the Hour of the Wolf group on Facebook for details.) In addition, Jim is Podcast Host and Post-Production Editor for the twice-consecutive Hugo Award-winning Lightspeed Magazine.

The Brooklyn Commons Cafe at 388 Atlantic Avenue is an open and collaborative movement building space, only minutes away from the Hoyt-Schermerhorn and Atlantic Avenue subway stops in downtown Brooklyn. The Commons provides resources to the progressive community including affordable office and meeting spaces as well as an event venue that can host anything from parties and benefits to forums, performances, films and workshops. If you are interested in meeting or event space, please contact them at [masked].

More complete (and graphically pleasing) info at http://hourwolf.com/nyrsf/NYRSFr_160405-CP5/

---

Doors open at 6:30 -- event begins at 7

results.description:
What up ya'll back again with another banger! Tortaria opened up a few years ago to bring you some delicious tortas tacos and later a great bar. I have been watching this place grow and improve over the years and I am still impressed. One of my favorite things there is an eggplant torta. Breaded fried eggplant with pickled jalapeno, onions, chihuahua cheese and other delicious bits. It's a magic sandwich that is not commonly found in a Mexican torta but it works and is very unique.

All of their stuff is made fresh to order including their guac and they have great aqua frescas, and a bad ass tequila bar with cocktails that are on average about $10 or less. WHOA! Overall the menu is very affordable and they have vegetarian options,  great specials and featured items all the time.

Come on through and get some of this USQ goodness. Note: this spot does NOT take reservations so you will need to be there on time as I try to hold down a spot for us. I am (was) keeping the number low on this one based on the size of the spot. See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Come in, it's a small spot, you should see me trying to hold down a spot for you all. Be on time as this place gets really crowded.

results.description:
Ever want to learn the art of Clay or know how to use but need a place to work? You found the right place.. We offer: hand building

, slab work, coils, pinch pots, wheel work, painting and glazing.
Classes are on going. You can come with a project in mind, or get inspired the second you walk into our studio. You can make plates, mugs, vases, sculptural pieces, gifts, planters. We also offer painted pottery options for those of you who would like to paint only.
Wynne Noble the ceramic artist of Noble Plateware is teaching the class. Her handmade work which combines function, form & color to bring food to elevated heights. Meticulous care is taken so that each piece extends an unspoken invitation to look and look again. When paired with taste and touch, it delivers a true sensory experience. 


http://nobleplateware.com/ Classes are $195 for FOUR classes. This includes all material, clay, glaze, paint, tools, etc.. and all firing costs. (You will need more than one class to complete a project.)

What is motivating you to do something innovative? Are you in position to start a company and what unknown struggles come with that?
