(SHORT WALK FROM CITY HALL)

HudsonPlay - 189 Brunswick St, Jersey City , NJ 07302 - View Map

SJC GREEN DRINKS +ART- LET'S GET SOCIAL !

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/green-drinks-art-lets-get-social-tickets-24046086492

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

SJC's Monthly EAT, MEET, TALK Meetings take place on the first Tuesday evening of each month at City Hall at 7pm in Caucus Room #204.

Please RSVP at the Eventbrite link provided, so we get an accurate headcount and have enough food on hand for those joining us for the EAT part of the evening !

RSVP here

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/sjc-monthly-meeting-eat-meet-talk-2016-tickets-15259260860

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

SJC has been focused on this topic since we launched back in 2011 - the idea of collaborative neighborhood models where people recycle their food scraps has always made sense to us. Yes, there is a need to accommodate different rhythms folks have around this opportunity and of course, consider how we AS A CITY can scale up to recycle food waste locally, but we have to start somewhere and no better time than NOW !


Tonite we will spotlight two opportunities -

Gardeners - learn about the experience – failures and successes – of El Sol Brillante who managed through a challenging period of getting their compost system structuring. Using a combination of traditional composting and bokashi methods, they now recycle 5 Tons (10,000 Pounds !) of food scraps each year.

Residents, Food Service Operations, Schools – Community Compost Company offers a service where they will pick up your food scraps for a reasonable fee, e.g., Residential bi-weekly service is only $19 / month, and is a viable option if you are not the DIY type or are affiliated with a community or school garden program. They backhaul your scraps to Hudson Valley Farmers !

Urban landscapes such as ours can gain great benefits in balancing our ecology by growing the health of our soil and utilizing compost to help us filter pollutants, manage stormwater and avoid the use of chemical fertilizers. In addition to diverting food waste from landfills to reduce dangerous greenhouse gas emissions, adding composted material to tree pits, rain gardens, community and school gardens, parks and even green roofs, will create a healthier living environment for OUR people, pets, wildlife, streetscapes and waterways.

COMMUNITY COMPOSTING IS THE ANSWER !!
DIY, JOIN A GARDEN PROGRAM, SUBSCRIBE TO A PICK UP SVC

—————————————————————————————---

If you are interested to join one of SJC's Working Groups, these monthly meetings are the place to jump in - this is a BIG agenda and more hands on deck are needed !

If you are interested to get more involved, please take our Welcome Survey - is very quick and will also put you into our system so you can receive all of our notifications.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

These EAT, MEET, TALK programs provide an opportunity to network over delicious local fare, listen to relevant Community Org / Expert Presentations and be included in a discussion about SJC Business & Project activities.  All are welcome and is a great way to plug-in to the sustainability movement in Jersey City.

Standing Agenda:

7pm - EAT and network with other like-minded folks interested in a greener, cleaner Jersey City.

7:30pm - MEET with JC Community Leaders, Municipal Officials and Field Professionals about VARIOUS Sustainability Topics important to Jersey City stakeholders; opportunity to get educated !

8:30pm - TALK with SJC Committee and Project Leaders for updates on our activities and learn how you can plug-in as a volunteer and / or gain our support for initiatives in your neighborhood..

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please note our 2015 SJC Green Drinks +ART events will now be held quarterly – venues TBA, stay tuned !

<a href="http://sustainablejc.org/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/Culinary-Conf-Center-logo.gif"></a>

results.description:
This NOW TUESDAY night gaming session will be constructed deck open gaming, with the games being seated in a first come first seated format. So the first four people to show up start a game, then the next four people start a game, and as players are ousted a third game starts, etc.

We'll be playing two hour rounds from 7pm through about 11pm. Having the games with a time limit means we are more likely to get more games in and you can try out more than one deck in a night.

If you'd like help with deck construction, players are often more than willing to give advice, lend cards for the evening and do other assorted friendly things to help another player in between rounds. Also, playing in person is a great way to meet other players you can later meet up with on your own to discuss the game more later over email or phone.

If you have questions, feel free to message me or Adam on here and we'll gladly answer.

 

See you there!

Ray

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

Join like minded crowd of ecologically conscious folks at the fabulous new HudsonPLAY space, Brunswick Center 189 Brunswick Street, downtown Jersey City, 7-9pm, Tues Nite April 5th.

Sustainable JC is swapping out our usual monthly meeting at City Hall for a Pre-Earth Day Celebration - come get to know us and we want to get to know YOU ! 


We're a diverse group of neighborhood stakeholders from across Jersey City, who are really interested in assuring our future is a sustainable one - we're an advocacy group working on an array of community demonstration projects and can use more hands on deck. 


Tell us what you're working on or what you'd like to see happen in your neighborhood or citywide - join a team or we'll help you build one of your own.  Green Civics is what we're all about and we're making our tools, teams and resources available to community leaders who want to make their neighborhoods better.  Let's Get Social !

$5 gets you thru the door with discount ticket for the Health Bar Cafe; open mic and info tables will put in touch with what others are doing (all around you!) and BIG SCREEN Artists-Share-Their-Work will expand your mind.  Special Performance planned - carve out a couple of hours, come enjoy :-)

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!

IMPORTANT: RSVP ON EVENTBRITE AS WELL https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-new-agnosticism-and-its-spiritual-implications-a-five-part-series-tickets-22126521020

After the talk concludes, Sunday Assembly people are invited to get together at Toast 125 (3157 Broadway, New York, NY 10027) to eat and chat about the evening.


Scientific and technological progress have transformed the intellectual landscape, changing the way we understand the universe and our place in it. How—if at all—can spiritual thought adapt to this new and challenging context?

In this five-part series, Robert Wright outlines a new spiritual world view that is not just compatible with modern science but deeply informed by it—and by developments in technology and social science as well. He also explains why a “new agnosticism” is taking shape—an agnosticism open-minded enough to accommodate a flourishing of different “spiritual but not religious” worldviews.

results.description:
“Anything you want to ask a teacher, ask yourself, and wait for the answer in silence.” ~ Byron Katie 

Our stress is caused by our stressful thoughts about life, not by life itself.  That is wonderful news!

The Work can support you in any difficulty or transition. If you would like to  do The Work or learn about this radical self-inquiry  and how to apply it in your life, please join me.  You will find peace and freedom on the other side.


All topics are welcome.


The Work consists of  four questions and turnarounds:


The four questions are:


1) Is it true?


2) Can you absolutely know that it’s true?


3) How do you react, what happens, when you believe that thought? 


4) Who would you be without the thought?

Turnarounds: Could the opposite be as true? Turn the statement around to the opposite, to the self, and to the other. This is a way of experiencing the opposite of what you believe.

www.thework.com


Byron Katie videos:

https://www.youtube.com/user/TheWorkofBK


Look forward to seeing you!


Olga Berg

Certified Facilitator of The Work

www.olgaberg.me

Guest Teacher

Carl Chimon Viggiani, Sensei

We are fortunate to have Carl Viggiani, Sensei visit with us.

Carl is a Dharma Heir of Robert Kennedy, SJ, Roshi.

Carl began formal study of Zen Buddhism with the Japanese Teacher Eido Roshi in 1987, later moving to Dai Bosatsu Zendo, Eido Roshi's monastery in the Catskills, where he lived and practiced until 1993. He continued with Daido Loori Roshi at Zen Mountain Monastery, and with Roshi Robert Kennedy at Morning Star Zendo in Jersey City.

results.description:
INTERMEDIATE TANGO: Learn with understanding

Prerequisite: Beginner and Pre-Intermediate courses.

Intermediate Tango course introduces cross system, back and forward ochos, giros/molinetes/turns to left and right in parallel and cross systems as elements necessary to built strong tango vocabulary for free improvisation, but also to understand and be able to execute more advanced elements such as sacadas, boleos, ganchos, volcadas, colgadas and alterations taught in Pre-Advanced and Advanced classes.

Main focus is placed on circular and rotary movements requiring pivoting and isolations as well as ability to disassociate individual movement from that of your partner. Close embrace is introduced and practiced as well as customs and etiquette of a Milonga (Tango social).

You will learn back and forward crosses, back and forward ochos and the difference between the two, giros to the left and right from front or back ochos, paradas and barridas, plus famous sandwich and mordida steps. The material is presented in very organized manner allowing progress from class to class.

Intermediate course consists of three 4 weeks courses (Int-1, Int-2, Int-3) . Each class is 60 minutes. Intermediate courses can be taken in any order, but we encourage completing each course from the beginning to the end for full understanding of mechanics of the movement and ability to use it freely.

If you took classes elsewhere and you feel confident that you can follow the material presented, you are welcome to join this level at any time. Please make sure you are able to execute the following:

Walking in open embrace
Baldoza
Walking outside partner left and right
Basic to the cross in parallel systems
Forward ocho
Ocho cortado
Reboud
Double time

If you are not sure which level you belong to simply come to the class. The teacher will talk to you after your first class and will suggest the best way for you to proceed to make your learning process the easiest and as fast as possible.

No partner necessary. Join at any time and continue growing, but please respect the other students and the teacher. If the material is too difficult for you to follow  the material presented consider starting at lower level or taking few private lesson to catch up with the rest of the class. We don’t want you confused and we don’t want to slow down the class.

We offer two intermediate classes during the week. Both classes are teaching exactly same material. So if you miss your class – you welcome to come to other class to catch up. We also encourage you to take 2 classes a week. This way you can practice the material and allow all the movements to become natural for you.

Each course consists of 4 60-minutes classes.

SIGN UP NOW

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description: Based in part on Cheever’s adolescence in New England, the novel follows the destinies of the impecunious and wildly eccentric Wapshots of St. Botolphs, a quintessential Massachusetts fishing village. Here are the stories of Captain Leander Wapshot, venerable sea dog and would-be suicide; of his licentious older son, Moses; and of Moses’ adoring and errant younger brother, Coverly. Tragic and funny, ribald and splendidly picaresque, The Wapshot Chronicle is a family narrative in the tradition of Trollope, Dickens, and Henry James.
results.name: The Wapshot Chronicle by John Cheever

You don't have to be a genius to participate in this Trivia Night! Come  out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition! Test your skills as New York Social Network Founder Dave Cervini hosts a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. We will have special sections set aside for NYSN members to meet and team up.  Pay as you go for food and drink. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round! We will rotate everyone to new teams after each round (unless you have a  team already)

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but The Firehouse is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? The Firehouse is known for it's wings. But they also have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7:15pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stay and socialize and other head home.

How do I get there? It is near the corner of west 85th and Columbus Avenue.  The B,C stop a block away at CPW and 86th and the #1 stops at B'way and 86th.

You don't have to be a genius to participate in this Trivia Night! Come  out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition! Test your skills as New York Social Network Founder Dave Cervini hosts a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. We will have special sections set aside for NYSN members to meet and team up.  Pay as you go for food and drink. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round! We will rotate everyone to new teams after each round (unless you have a  team already)

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but The Firehouse is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? The Firehouse is known for it's wings. But they also have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7:15pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stay and socialize and other head home.

How do I get there? It is near the corner of west 85th and Columbus Avenue.  The B,C stop a block away at CPW and 86th and the #1 stops at B'way and 86th.
results.name: Fun and Easy Rotating Team Trivia Night at The Firehouse Tavern: FREE EVENT

results.name: Tuesday Trivia at Paragon in Clark

results.description:
Everyone said they had a good time, so let's do it again.

If you're  looking to get out and try something different, may I suggest coming out and playing Trivia Quiz.

We have had a very nice group of regulars that have been participating and are always looking for more people to join us.

It is free to play and there is no Meetup fee for this event. So give it a try.

And if you're coming right from work The Garth Road Inn does serve food...very Reasonable and Good.


The Garth Road Inn has been serving the Scarsdale community for many years.  It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.



**There will be a prize for the winning team!**


And there will also be bonus questions where a team can win stuff!!


Bring your friends or you can join other Meetup members to form a team.

It's a great opportunity to use all that information you have acquired over the years.  *_*



There will be an entertaining mix of questions!

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

There are 5 rounds
Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!


****All are welcome to attend!****


And there are always people from the Pub itself playing, we will be joining in on the FUN!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Mike when you arrive.

results.description:
All are Welcome  RSVP

Creative images to be shown at Nutley High School The best creative slides from across the nation will be shown and judged at the April 5 meeting at Nutley High of the Tri-County Camera Club. Creative images reflect altered reality, such as an imaged distorted in a reflection or by computer software. Even more creative are images that bring together different subjects, such as, for example, a face reflected in sunglasses worn by the moon.    These creative images come from camera clubs across the country, and often from clubs overseas. They have already won ribbons in their own club, and so represent some of the best creative work being done by amateur photographers worldwide.  The competition is sponsored by PSA, The Photographic Society of America, to which Tri-County belongs. It will be held in the Teachers Cafeteria of Nutley High School at 8 pm Tuesday April 5. The cafeteria is located toward the rear of the school. Free public parking is available.
results.how_to_find_us: Teachers Cafe -  entrance side parking lot
results.name: Apr 5  - Tuesday PSA Creative contest Display  & Judging

results.description:
The Wednesday's Level 1 salsa class Cycle ends on March 30th. The new cycle will begin the week after but it will be on Tuesdays. That is, I will be starting this new level 1 (absolute beginners) Salsa class cycle (12 weeks) on Tuesday April 5th. This class will be for people who have never done any Salsa dancing before or for people who only have a little bit of experience. You do not need to bring a partner since we rotate during class. I will be teaching salsa on2 new york style, which is what is danced in New York. 

Please join the official meetup for this class. I will be adding future schedule there, not here. is: http://www.meetup.com/Salsa-Classes-for-Absolute-Beginners/

if you are interested in this class. Please join and RSVP in the official meetup for this class. I will be adding future schedule there: http://www.meetup.com/Salsa-Classes-for-Absolute-Beginners/events/229446230/


sample of my dancing:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ep-cNukVLJo

Anyone can learn this no matter your age, body type, race, religion, etc. This dance will give you confidence and enhance your social life further. A better/alternate way to keep up with updates, room changes, tips, videos, and in contact with other students is to join the facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

Tentative Location: Pearl Studios, 500 Eighth Avenue New York, NY 10018

Room: 1212 (12th Floor)

Fee: $15 per class (cash only). You do not pay in advance. you pay when you take a class only.

Time: 8pm-9:30pm.

Here is a partial preview tentative syllabus for the first 6 weeks out of the 12:

During each week, the following concepts will be taught along with the material when necessary:

(Posture) (Weight Shifting) (hand rotation) (spotting) (pacing) (balance) (distance control) (musicality) (timing) (body coordination) (body isolations) (etc)

Week 1 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Basic Step, Basic variations, upper body movement, Body isolations and coordination exercises, Timing, Music

Partnerwork: Open Hold, Close Hold, Hand placements, Correct Frame, Correct Tension

Week 2 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Previous class review, Right-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Leading The right-turn, Following the right-turn

Week 3 (semi open house - only those who know the material taught on weeks 1 & 2 can join. A special class will be offered for those who want join the cycle and need to catch up)

Footwork: Previous class review, Left-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Cross-Body-Lead and Follow.

Week 4 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 1 and 2 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Cross-body-Lead combined with Inside Turn, Turn Combinations

Week 5 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 3 and 4 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Open-Break Step

Week 6 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 5 and 6 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Walk-Around Turn

Week 7 - 12

More fundamental footwork and partnerwork (Variations)
results.name: New Beginner Level 1 Salsa Class Cycle (April 5th)

results.description:
If you are learning English or if you are a native speaker of English, join us for relaxed conversation and to make new friends! All levels are welcomed!

This meetup is for:
-Students that want to improve their speaking & pronunciation
-New arrivals to the U.S.
-People looking to make new friends, discuss and learn about language & culture

Topics we are open to discussing
-Weather
-Hobbies
-News
-Politics
-Anything you want to talk about

Aspects of English we focus on
-Speaking: Pronunciation, Accents
-Listening: Definitions, Vocabulary, Synonyms
-Slang, common ways Americans express themselves

Please only sign up if you are serious about attending, we remove members that do not honor their RSVP!
It will be $2 to join. Also, Please support the venue by purchasing a coffee or something to eat when you attend.

Write what your native language is in the comments section!
results.name: ESL English Practice Night!

results.description:
Learn & Sweat Bhangra sessions are for you 

- if you love to sweat it out to heart pumping music


- if you think fitness doesn't mean lifting weights

- if you want to learn and groove to energetic Bhangra while burning serious cals.

The class begins with a warm up, high energy and high fun, this Bhangra class combines the strong, festive moves of traditional Bhangra dance with a follow-me fitness-class style. 

Each week participants also have the opportunity to learn a more in-depth piece of Bhangra choreography to a popular dance floor hit. 

If you love Bhangra music and you’re looking for a fun, unique way to keep fit, join us to sweat it out while partying to the beats.

No previous dance experience is necessary - just bring in your smile! Our Instructors are professional, friendly, and open minded. So come on in and let swag emerge!

Wear comfortable clothes and shoes.

The drop-in price is $20 and can be paid here on meetup, or head over to our website www.nycbhangra.com/nycbhangra/signup for other options to pay.

Checkout our BEGINNER BHANGRA classes too!
results.name: Learn & Sweat BHANGRA

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

This class will be for people who have never done any Salsa dancing before or for people who only have a little bit of experience. You do not need to bring a partner since we rotate during class. I will be teaching salsa on2 new york style, which is what is danced in New York. 

sample of my dancing:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ep-cNukVLJo

Anyone can learn this no matter your age, body type, race, religion, etc. This dance will give you confidence and enhance your social life further. A better/alternate way to keep up with updates, room changes, tips, videos, and in contact with other students is to join the facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

Tentative Location: Pearl Studios, 500 Eighth Avenue New York, NY 10018

Room: 1212 (12th floor)

Fee: $15 per class (cash only). You do not pay in advance. you pay when you take a class only.

Time: 8pm-9:30pm.

Here is a partial preview tentative syllabus for the first 6 weeks out of the 12:

During each week, the following concepts will be taught along with the material when necessary:

(Posture) (Weight Shifting) (hand rotation) (spotting) (pacing) (balance) (distance control) (musicality) (timing) (body coordination) (body isolations) (etc)

Week 1 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Basic Step, Basic variations, upper body movement, Body isolations and coordination exercises, Timing, Music

Partnerwork: Open Hold, Close Hold, Hand placements, Correct Frame, Correct Tension

Week 2 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Previous class review, Right-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Leading The right-turn, Following the right-turn

Week 3 (semi open house - only those who know the material taught on weeks 1 & 2 can join. A special class will be offered for those who want join the cycle and need to catch up)

Footwork: Previous class review, Left-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Cross-Body-Lead and Follow.

Week 4 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 1 and 2 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Cross-body-Lead combined with Inside Turn, Turn Combinations

Week 5 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 3 and 4 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Open-Break Step

Week 6 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 5 and 6 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Walk-Around Turn

Week 7 - 12

More fundamental footwork and partnerwork (Variations)
results.name: New Level 1 Salsa Class Cycle (April 5th)

If you are new to the city, recently out, just looking for friends, or whatever experiences brought you to us – we offer a safe space where we can mingle and talk about our experiences as an LGBT person in New York City. We hold our meetings on the First Tuesday of every month from 8-10 PM at the Brooklyn Pride Center. 

We recommend this 20Something Meetup to anyone who is looking for a more casual space to explore their sexual/gender identity. There will be light refreshments. Bring friends!

Suggested donation of $5 to benefit 20Something. No one turned away for lack of funds

results.description:
Register at http://www.GirlTalkandCocktails.com to get login details to our LIVE online event. Don't worry, if you can't make it you'll get access to the replays.

 Live weekly, Tuesdays at 8PM (ET)

This week, our amazing guest is Makenna Johnston, talking about Integrating Love into Your Already Fabulous Life! Here's some info about Makenna, believe us, you won't wanna miss her!

If Tibetan philosophies of non-attachment made passionate love to high-level business acumen with a hefty dash of bodymind connection, and raised their resultant love child on a steady diet of craft beer, traditional foods, mountain living, yoga, and snow skiing you’d have, Makenna Johnston. Fondly known as MakJo 

MakJo is a passionate coach & thought leader for visionary leaders–entrepreneurs, creatives, and otherwise.  She coaches visionaries into stepping into their embodied leadership and calling in their visions for a better world.  MakJo doesn't mess around, she walks her talk.  And in 2015, she and her wife followed a lark/hunch/intuitive pull and found a team to purchase Julia Child's summer home in Provence as part of her bigger vision for a better and more human world.  

She's mighty tall. Mighty fun. And mighty into kimonos (and manatees). She probably likes you a lot, and don't be surprised if she asks you to be her best friend.
results.name: Makenna Johnston is on Girl Talk & Cocktails this week!!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Introduction to Apache Apex - The next generation native Hadoop platform. 

Apache Apex (incubating) is a next generation native Hadoop big data platform. This talk will cover details about how it can be used as a powerful and versatile platform for big data. 

Presenter : Pramod Immaneni Apache Apex (incubating) PPMC member, committer and senior architect at DataTorrent Inc, where he works on Apex and specializes in big data applications. Prior to DataTorrent he was a co-founder and CTO of Leaf Networks LLC, eventually acquired by Netgear Inc, where he built products in core networking space and was granted patents in peer-to-peer VPNs. Prior to that he was a technical co-founder of a mobile startup where he was an architect of a dynamic content rendering engine for mobile devices. 

Please register for Introduction to Apache Apex - The next generation native Hadoop platform: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/982726273838015748

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar.
results.name: Intro to Apache Apex - The next gen native Hadoop platform for ingest+transform

results.description:
People ask me how I can speak seven languages all the time.

It's simple...

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!


Join me at Starbucks whenever you'd like to study hard, practise conversation, and share good energy.

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

Whatever you're learning, good, daily study habits will make you fluent. 

Try it out!
results.name: Let's Get Fluent! Language Study at Starbucks

results.description:
Are you looking for a way to grow your business? Would building relationships with professionals in other industries help your career?

If the answer is yes, you may want to consider visiting BNI Platinum Chapter 14! We meet each week to discuss our businesses and ways we may be able to help one another. Our members work in a wide array of industries including: financial services, real estate, legal services and many more!

Our members are focused on fostering relationships with one another which naturally lead to business referrals over time.

We welcome visitors to come see what we are all about!

Where: Ruth's Chris Steakhouse
148 W 51st St, 2nd Floor
Between 6th and 7th Ave's

When: Wednesday mornings (7am-8:30am)

To see a list of our members and more about our chapter visit our web page at http://bit.ly/1MgHufC

*If you have been to a BNI chapter before, you know that we are only allowed to have one person per profession. If you see that no one fills that role, then you should be welcome to come! However, if you notice a potential conflict of interest our members will work with you to see if our chapter would be a good place to visit or if it would be better to visit another one of the BNI chapters.

If you are interested in visiting our chapter please reach out to one of our visitor hosts:
Brett Sigler - [masked]
Beverly Stacy - [masked]
Roger Rojas - [masked]

results.description:
Do you like getting up early and starting the day with inspiring conversations or even better: pair programming on your pet project? This is your meetup! :) 

Skip the morning run and instead meet us between 6:30 AM and 8:30 AM bi-weekly to chat, code and have the first coffee together to start the day off with developers or other software professionals who care about the quality of the code and passionately looking for ways to improve themselves. 

The venue: There is a Starbucks open from 5:30 am and behind it the lobby of The Lexington NYC hotel, which is a pretty cool space, they have free, fast wi-fi, plenty of seating and a lot of sockets in the wall :) I asked, and we are allowed to gather so don't be shy and have a look around. There are seats downstairs and on the mezzanine as well, upstairs, where the restrooms are too. See you there!

results.description:
Does the recent market volatility make you afraid to look at your 401(k) statement?  Join us on Wed April 6th and listen to Michael Dilella, an Investment Advisor with MetLife Solutions Group explain how to use stock market volatility to work for you instead of against you.  Mr. Dilella will discuss how market declines are natural and  not always a bad thing.  Also what the power of perspective is and the advantages of dollar cost averaging will be discussed.  Michael  understands every client is unique and every financial plan is tailored to what you need.  He has been an investment advisor since 1981 works with a team to bring the highest quality financial planning and many years of financial planning and investment management experience.  They develop trusting, long term relationships as a team with the goal of helping you succeed and achieve your personal objectives.


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.  Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on April 6th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

results.description:
After our highly successful and well attended last roundtable, we are going to try it again.  This time, in NYC. 

The overall subject for both is……

YOUR INTERNAL STAFF (Sales, Recruiters, Admin)

Topics have been suggested by you, the Meetup Group Participants who came to the last round table breakfast in November.  Topics have practical meaning, can be influenced & changed by you, and will have an impact on your business.

PLEASE come prepared not only to hear what others do, but to offer up how you do things as well.  This will be an interactive give & take……..and you may walk away with some great ideas!

 Training Programs

How are you training your internal staff?
Does your company support and train consultants?
Does training increase retention, improve performance, yield results?
Round the Table: Please come prepared to answer “Would you allow your staff to determine which training programs they would attend?”

Compensation Plans for Sales/Recruiters

Individual or team plans?

Does your plan reflect company values (is your plan designed to achieve your desired results?)

What do you think is the proper ratio of total comp between fixed salary & performance-related commissions?

Round the Table:  Please come prepared to answer “How much should a ‘strong’ salesperson make?  How much should a ‘strong’ recruiter make?”

Motivational Techniques for Internal Staff

Comp or time?

Company lunch?

Can you make it fun?

Do internal contests still work?

Round the Table:
Please come prepared to answer “What are your two best motivational programs  your staff appreciate?”

We are hoping for a lively discussion amongst peers.  Are you in?

Byte Academy accepts applications on a rolling basis for all courses which start every 4 weeks.

results.description:
IBM® Cloudant™ database service delivers high availability, elastic scalability and innovative mobile device synchronization. The Cloudant JSON cloud-based data service allows mobile and web developers to quickly and easily store and access the rapidly increasing amount of mobile data using an application programming interface (API) that is significantly easier to use than alternatives. Increasingly, developers have embraced NoSQL databases because of their flexibility, and JSON has become thepredominant NoSQL database technology for mobile and web app developers. This session consists of both presentations and hands-on lab exercises.


To guarantee your seat, register HERE and receive a confirmation. 


This session introduces Cloudant and how it differs from other data management platforms. Key features are described, including Cloudant Query, MapReduce and integrated Lucene Search along with RESTful HTTP API. 

Agenda  

• NoSQL landscape  

• Database as a service  

• JSON primer  

• Cloudant dashboard

• Replication

• RESTful APIs  

• Primary indexes

• Cloudant query  

• Secondary indexes or MapReduce  

• Search indexes Accessing Cloudant from an application

This event is free. Complimentary refreshments including continental breakfast and lunch will be provided.  For your convenience, registration and continental breakfast begins at 8:30 a.m. The session starts at 9:00 a.m. and ends at approximately 5:00 p.m. 

To guarantee your seat, register HERE and receive a confirmation.

Leader: Dave Hogenauer,[masked]
Meet: 10 AM at Locust Grove, S. Mtn. Res., Millburn. We will hike to Maple Falls, and if lucky, see the large display of Dutchman’s Britches and other wild flowers. The Falls is little known, because there is no trail to them. Therefore, this involves a moderately difficult bushwhack. We will take that slowly. About 3 miles. Hiking boots required. Bring water and a snack. Watch this site on the morning of April 6 for any last minute changes/cancellations.
If this is your third trial meetup event with the TSR Meetup group, we now ask you to join our TriState Ramblers Club for $15 for a yearly membership. By paying the club membership fee you will have a FULLER SCHEDULE of hikes, bike rides, and canoeing events 6 DAYS a week, all year long. Visit our website at tsr.nynjtc.org for an application and schedule preview.
DIRECTIONS:
From east of the park (westbound) on I-78: Take exit 50 B "Millburn" "Maplewood". At the end of the ramp, you must go right. Drive through 3 traffic lights, not counting the one at the end of the ramp. At the fourth light (Millburn Ave.), turn left. Drive to the second traffic light (the road makes a turn to the right and becomes a one way street called Essex Ave.). Turn right onto Lackawanna Place, go under the RR tracks, and you come almost immediately to Glen Ave. Across the street and a little to the right is a drive way entering the park with a sign "Locust Grove".
From north of the park:
Locust Grove: Coordinates: N40° 43.65', W74° 18.24' From the North, go south on Brookside Drive to Glen Ave. (traffic light). Turn left on Glen Ave. and go 0.3 miles to Locust Grove parking lot on left, opposite NJ Transit train station.
results.name: HIKE - Maple Falls/S. Mtn. Res., Millburn

results.description:
This presentation will cover IOT Ingestion and Analytics using Apache Apex, a next generation native Hadoop plaform for stream as well as batch processing.

Internet of Things (IoT) devices are becoming more ubiquitous in consumer, business and industrial landscapes. They are being widely used in applications ranging from home automation to the industrial internet. They pose a unique challenge in terms of the volume of data they produce, and the velocity with which they produce it, and the variety of sources they need to handle. The challenge is to ingest and process this data at the speed at which it is being produced in a real-time and fault tolerant fashion. Apache Apex is an industrial grade, scalable and fault tolerant big data processing platform that runs natively on Hadoop. In this webinar, you will see how Apex is being used in IoT applications and also see how the enterprise features such as dimensional analytics, real-time dashboards and monitoring play a key role. .


Presented by
Pramod Immaneni, Principal Architect at DataTorrent, and PPMC member Apache APex

Ian Gomez, Audience Marketing Manager at DataTorrent

Register for IOT Ingestion & Analytics using Apache Apex - A Native Hadoop Platform at: https://www.brighttalk.com/webcast/13685/191501
results.name: IOT Ingestion & Analytics using Apache Apex - A Native Hadoop Platform

At least 20% of individuals with celiac disease continue to have symptoms on a gluten-free diet. Other estimates show that more than one third of celiac disease patients have altered gut motility or “IBS-like” symptoms. While continued gluten ingestion is the most common cause of persistent symptoms, a dual diagnosis of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is also common. Join our next Ask-the-Dietitian Webinar with Registered Dietitians, Janelle Smith and Nancee Jaffe, to learn more!

What: Celiac Disease and IBS Ask-the-Dietitian Webinar

When: April 6, 2016 at 3pm EST

results.description:
UBERFest:  Arizona 2016

Who wants to join us in Arizona for some real (wet) canyoneering?!

The only fee for this trip is a $30/person non-refundable fee which includes camping.   (If you cancel anytime after you sign-up, you forfeit your $30 as a cancellation fee.)  Because canyoneering is inherently dangerous, this event is ONLY open to people with professional canyoneering training, preferably from Uber Adventures, or significant canyoneering experience!  (if you're not sure if your training or experience qualify, give me a shout before you sign-up!)  Because this event is SOCIAL, we will rely on experienced people to allow rookies in their groups while descending some awesome, wet & friendly canyons!

If you want to go to this event ... get the Uber Adventures training and become a competent participant and valuable team member!

CAMPING: I've reserved a large group campsite near Globe, AZ.  It will hold 100 people (though fewer cars)!  This campsite has water, fire rings, covered pavilion/picnic area, restrooms and showers!  The GPS point for the entrance to the Grapevine Group Campsite near Roosevelt, AZ is:  <a>[masked], -111.049206.  </a>Our Loop is called:  ____________________.

CARPOOL!  DO IT!  Parking is always an issue in campgrounds.

You're also responsible for your own travel, and your own meals ... except!...  Let's have a Mexican-style potluck on Saturday evening at 6:30pm. Keep the contributions of a Mexican theme and bring your sombrero!  Let's make it a party, as well as a meal!  (Maybe we should call this one UBERFiesta!) So, bring things like chips, salsa, beans, rice, flan, Dos Equis, Corona .. etc!  Don't forget to bring a means to heat-and-serve-and clean your dish. Also, you are responsible to provide your own plate, cup, spoon, knife, fork .. etc.

These are some of the canyons you should try to find beta for:  Barnhardt, Big Kahuna, Waterslides, Parker, The Jug of Salome Creek, Punchbowl, ZigZag, Minnow, Christopher Creek, ETC ETC ETC!  MOST of these canyons will require a wetsuit as the water will be frigid, even if the weather is not! (think melting snow runoff)  If you're going to rent one, get a 4/3 and wear a rain shell over the top to keep the wind from evaporative-cooling you. (Leaders:  PLEASE DON'T POST YOUR PLANNED CANYONS ON HERE, but keep me in the loop of your plans!  We will have sign-up sheets at the campsite.)

P.S.  I'm limiting the RSVP's to +1 ... if your +1 hasn't taken a 3-day basic Technical Canyoneering Course from UBER Adventures or doesn't have SIGNIFICANT CANYONEERING EXPERIENCE, they need my permission or should not be attending.
results.name: UBERFest: Arizona 2016

The Young Professionals Engagement Committee of OutRight is happy to invite you to an evening of great music, networking, and happy hour drinks at Bamboo 52 on Wednesday, April 6 -- featuring a very special activist, Kevin Schumacher (formerly known as Hossein Alizadeh) who leads OutRight's efforts in the Middle East & North Africa. 

Kevin Schumacher has led OutRight's efforts to work with and support a variety of groups across the Middle East, including in Iran and Iraq, and serves as the main person documenting the atrocities committed by ISIS. This work was central to the first UN Security Council Meeting on LGBTIQ issues, which focused on the brutal deaths of alleged gays depicted in ISIS propaganda. Schumacher received his M.A. in International Relations from Tehran University and has worked at OutRight since 2006.


[Also, join OutRight in the countdown to our annual gala - A Celebration of Courage (https://www.outrightinternational.org/coc2016) being held at the UN this year, and get to know how you can get involved in OutRight's work with LGBTIQ people across the world.

Get your tickets to the gala NOW! Go to Outrightinternational.org/CoC2016]
results.name: OutRight's Countdown to Celebration of Courage

results.description:
A movie for Mothers and Daughters and those who love them! Lets' break up the week and enjoy more of the 2016 Film Fest and an early dinner within walking distance of the theatre.  One stop parking! 

Scroll down for meeting times and ticket purchase info. Get your tickets ASAP as these shows usually sell out and come early to get a good seat as there  is always a line at the film festival shows. 

LOOK AT US NOW MOTHER

wednesday, April 6 , 7:30PM
Regal Cinemas

Hudson Valley Premiere
Country: USA
Language: English
Year of Release: 2015
Running Time: 86 minutes
Directed by Gayle Kirschenbaum
Genre: Documentary
Speaker: Gayle and Mildred Kirschenbaum, Director and Mom!

After decades of conflict, a mother and her only daughter seek to salvage their abrasive relationship in this unflinching and intimate examination of family dysfunction and forgiveness.

Emmy-winning filmmaker Gayle Kirschenbaum first opened up about her relationship with her mother Mildred in a 2007 short film, My Nose, which followed her mother’s crusade to pressure h to have plastic surgery. Though lighthearted, the film generated a more serious conversation about childhood humiliation, eventually prompting Kirschenbaum to document the emotional fallout still haunting her. Compiled from personal home movies and photos, plus diary entries and interviews both nakedly honest and bitingly funny, LOOK AT US NOW, MOTHER! invites audiences on the bumpy road of Gayle’s self-discovery and reconciliation. As cameras roll and the formidable Mildred grudgingly submits to counseling, long-held feelings and family secrets are bared, and a mother-daughter bond is transformed.

Describing herself as an accidental therapist, Kirschenbaum’s raw and intensely personal approach exposes a touching search for acceptance, and inspires hope for healthier relationships for families everywhere.

Not for singles only.


SCROLL DOWN FOR EARLY DINNER OPTION 

The theatre is located at the New Shops at Nanuet center at the intersection of Rt. 59 and MIddletown Rd. in Nanuet, NY. This is one night only with guest speaker the Director and her Mother so will most likely sell out so it is strongly suggested you get your tickets ahead of time to guarantee your seat.  Come early to get a good seat as there is always a line!

FOR MOVIE ONLY MEET IN THE LOBBY 7:00 for the 7:30 movie / TICKET LINE / LOOK FOR MEETUP SIGN.  I SUGGEST BUYING YOUR TICKETS ON LINE TO ASSURE YOUR SEAT AT: http://jccrockland.org/film-festival/ and click on Look at Us Now Mother for April 6th at 7:30

Since Wendesdays in the Spring and Summer tend to be the most popular times. I am going to put in a few new  ground rules, so by RSVP-ing "yes" you hereby state you have read the following stipulations and will abide by them. We are setting the RSVP limit to 26 but do not be disheartened to join the "wait-list".  Those who RSVP"yes" are given a definite spot in the game if they arrive before or EXACTLY at 5:30. If you have been "wait-listed" and arrive before or at 5:30 and slots are open, you are given a spot. For those who do not RSVP and just show up must wait until 5:30pm and depending upon the order you showed up in and if the conditions mentioned above are not met, you will be allowed to play to make it so the teams are 13 each. If you have RSVP-ed and do not show up by the time we kick off and teams are full, you will be put aside.  for those who show up late, I will set some cones aside so you can play a smaller game against anyone else who shows up late. If you don't show up at all and RSVP-ed "yes", you will be warned 3 times and after that every time I see your name on RSVP you will be put as a "no". I know this is an issue for some of you but please understand in all fairness we don't want a game of 14 v 14, the field does not have enough space.

 If you have any gripes about this please message me and we can talk but in all likely-hood I will not make an exception.

Hack, hack, hooray! Come and be inspired by the stories behind hacks people build. We have invited two speakers from NYU's Interactive Telecommunications Program - Nicole He and Ross Goodwin to talk about what inspires them to continuously build and work on interesting projects, and the joy she gets from building these hacks.

--
Speakers: Nicole He (http://nicole.pizza/) and Ross Goodwin (http://rossgoodwin.com/). Nicole He has worked on a few notable projects such as The True Love Tinder Robot (that "will find you love, guaranteed" and Soylent Dick, a phallus made out of Soylent that ejaculates Soylent when you type self-validating praise for Soylent into the browser. Ross Goodwin works primarily with machine learning, natural language processing, & other computational tools to realize new forms & interfaces for written language. His notable projects include word.camera which uses neural networks (via Clarifai) to extract concept words from images and expands those initial words into sentences and paragraphs, Fiction Generator, which generates novels according to user-defined parameters using content scraped from various lit websites.

All Tech@NYU events are covered by a strict anti-harassment policy: http://techatnyu.org/anti-harassment

Topic: Bring Your Daughter to WIT Day!

[masked]
Phone:[masked] x66194

Register Here:   http://tinyurl.com/zzt7bz8 

OUR SPEAKERS: 

Cassidy Williams – Software Engineer/Developer Evangelist at Clarifai


Cassidy Williams was one of the youngest females to be highlighted in Glamour Magazine’s ‘35 Women Under 35 Who Are Changing the Tech Industry’ , and was also featured in the documentary ‘Big Dream’ (www.bigdreammovement.com), which focuses on women who are breaking barriers and overcoming personal challenges to follow their passion in science, math, computing & engineering. 
Cassidy is an avid public speaker and has done so at meet-ups, hackathons, and events such as the Grace Hopper Celebration for Women in Computing, The National Center for Women and IT Summit, The U.S. Department of Labor’s Diversity in Tech Event, TEDx Des Moines, at The U.N., and The U.S. Science and Engineering Festival. Learn more at: http://www.cassidoo.co/

Nancie Williams – GM, East Region at Microsoft

Nancie Williams has been with Microsoft for the past 13 years and during her time at the company, her career has spanned senior sales and management positions across all of Microsoft’s customer segments, both within the United States and abroad. Currently Nancie is General Manager of the East Region sales team for US SMB&D charged with delivering Microsoft services and solutions exclusively through partners. Earlier in her career Nancie spent 17 years in Silicon Valley working with both established organizations and start-ups (e.g., Oracle, Verity and Documentum) growing sales teams in multi-million and multi-billion dollar operations. She thrives on the challenge of growing a business. Nancie is based out of Charlotte, North Carolina.

results.description:
The Schomburg and the Maysles Cinema present the documentary James Baldwin: The Price of the Ticket, directed by Karen Thorsen. An emotional portrait, a social critique, and a passionate plea for human equality, this film is a vérité feast. Without using narration, the film allows Baldwin to tell his own story: exploring what it means to be born black, impoverished, gay and gifted - in a world that has yet to understand that "all men are brothers." 

The film also includes a rich selection of original footage: scenes from Baldwin's extraordinary funeral service; explorations of Baldwin's homes on three continents, including France, Switzerland, Turkey and Harlem; plus on-camera interviews with close friends, colleagues and critics. Witnesses include his brother David; biographer David Leeming; writers Maya Angelou, Amiri Baraka, William Styron, Ishmael Reed and Yashar Kemal; painter Lucien Happersberger and entertainer Bobby Short.

https://vimeo.com/121483194

The documentary has not been shown in Harlem since 1989 (at the Schomburg then as well) and this is the first time the remastered version is being shown publicly in Harlem anywhere.  

Q&A with director Karen Thorsen, James Baldwin's nephew and Harlem's own Trevor Baldwin to follow the screening. More speakers TBA.


Our Meetup


The group will meet Daniel at the Schomburg Center at 5:30pm, seating for the event will likely start around 6:00pm, with the start of the event at 6:30pm. IF YOU RSVP TO ATTEND, PLEASE TRY NOT TO BE LATE AND CHECK THE NOTIFICATIONS SECTION THE DAY OF FOR ANY POSSIBLE CHANGES/ANNOUCEMENTS. The event will fill to capacity and we'll need to gain entrance together as a group. If you arrive after the group has entered, there will be no way to guarantee entry or seating.


As always, if you're running late, need further directions, or have any questions, please give Daniel a call/text to 774.275.3646.

Directions to The Schomburg Center:

Train: Take the #2 or #3 trains to 135th Street. The Schomburg entrance is between 135th & 136 streets, on Malcom X Blvd. (Lenox Avenue).
Bus: Catch either the M7 or M102 to 135th Street and Malcolm X Blvd.

About The Schomburg Center

The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture, a research unit of The New York Public Library, is generally recognized as one of the leading institutions of its kind in the world. For over 80 years the Center has collected, preserved, and provided access to materials documenting black life, and promoted the study and interpretation of the history and culture of peoples of African descent.
results.name: Free Documentary - James Baldwin: The Price of the Ticket @ The Schomburg Center

Let's have our first critique session!

If you're interested in being critiqued, please send your first 20 pages, double spaced, to [masked] by 3/28. This could be any combination of the following: prose, outline (to critique the plot), or synopsis/query letter (to critique in advance of querying agents). The first three submissions will be discussed.

Those who have RSVP'd will get links for download by 3/29. At the session, we'll discuss possible guidelines for giving/receiving critiques.

Looking forward to seeing you all there! Let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded clubs, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to NEW Madison Square Tavern in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  We will have the private Madison room downstairs all for our group.

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

Drink specials till 7pm

$5 Bud Light Drafts

$6 Craft Beers

$8 Wine

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-Fun and friendly bar staff

-A full menu available 

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Any train to Penn Station Herald Square

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

Hi hardwarians,

Another month, another hardware meetup and we've got an amazing variety of startups for you  - ranging from a new instrument to 3D printing as a service! Hope to see you all there!

Agenda:

6:00 - 6:15pm: arrival, pizza and beer

6:15 - 6:25pm: welcome and sponsors

6:25 - 6:40pm: Emmanuel Dumont, CEO and founder of Shade,  a beautifully designed wearable ultraviolet measurement technology, to take control of sunlight exposure. Oh, and Emmanuel is also an artist, a sculptor and has a PhD in biophysics.

6:40- 7:00pm: Jacob Gordon, CMO and cofounder of Artiphon, a new type of instrument that's different than anything you've seen before. Find out why it won Times' best Invention award. 

7:00 - 7:15pm: Oscar Pedroso, CEO and cofounder of Thimble, a subscription service that sends you once a month a carefully curated kit of electronic parts and components organized around specific themes and contests.

7:15 - 7:30pm: Max Friefeld, cofounder and CEO of Voodoo Manufacturing, that are looking to redefine the boundaries between prototype and production, with high volume 3D printing.


7:30pm - onwards: networking and community announcements.

See you all there!

Haytham
